original: de bas na 'dir tshig gi don ni 'di yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir tshig gi don ni 'di yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the words here should be understood as follows.

original: 'dod chags bcas pa'i sems yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ma yin zhing de bden pa ma yin pas de spangs te /
analyzed: 'dod chags bcas pa'i sems yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid ma yin zhing de bden pa ma yin pas de spangs te /
translated: A mind that is associated with attachment is not reality, and since it is not real, it is abandoned.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid kyi rnam par rab tu mkhyen to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid kyi rnam par rab tu mkhyen to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is thoroughly known in the aspect of reality.

original: de bas yang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid du rab tu mkhyen pa ston te /
analyzed: de bas yang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid du rab tu mkhyen pa ston te /
translated: Therefore, it is shown that a mind that is free from attachment is thoroughly known as reality.🔽What is shown by the statement, “Su­bhūti, a mind that is free from attachment is not a mind that is associated with attachment”?

original: rab 'byor sems 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa ma yin zhes bya bas ci bstan zhe na @210b sems 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid don dam par med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor sems 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa ma yin zhes bya bas ci bstan zhe na @210b sems 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid don dam par med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only does a mind that is free from attachment and a mind that is associated with attachment not exist ultimately,

original: 'on kyang kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid du yang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: 'on kyang kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid du yang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i gnas skabs na /
translated: but also, in terms of the imagined nature, when there is a state of being free from attachment,

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa zhes brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa zhes brjod par mi nus te /
translated: One cannot say that it is associated with passion,

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba gnyis sems gcig la mi srid pa dang / sems gnyis cig car mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba gnyis sems gcig la mi srid pa dang / sems gnyis cig car mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for both that associated with passion and that free from passion to be in one mind, and because two minds do not occur simultaneously.

original: de bas na yang dag pa ma yin par yang ma zad kyi /
analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa ma yin par yang ma zad kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is not only not real,

original: kun brtags pa'i rnam par yang 'dod chags dang bral ba la 'dod chags dang bcas pa zhes byar mi rung bas /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i rnam par yang 'dod chags dang bral ba la 'dod chags dang bcas pa zhes byar mi rung bas /
translated: but also, because it is not possible to call that free from passion “associated with passion” in the imagined mode,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ces bshad do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ces bshad do //
translated: it is explained as “free from passion.”

original: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bral ba yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bral ba yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should apply “free from hatred” and “free from delusion.”

original: sems rgya che ba la rgya che zhes bya ba dang / rab 'byor 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems rgya che ba ma yin zhum pa ma yin par rab tu mkhyen to zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems rgya che ba la rgya che zhes bya ba dang / rab 'byor 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems rgya che ba ma yin zhum pa ma yin par rab tu mkhyen to zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: The mind that is vast is called “vast,” and so on, as in the passage that begins, “Subhūti, here the Tathāgata knows that the minds of those sentient beings are not vast, are not contracted.”

original: 'di'i sems ni rgya che ba'o //🔽gzhan gyi sems ni zhum pa'o //🔽'di'i sems ni 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i sems ni rgya che ba'o // gzhan gyi sems ni zhum pa'o // 'di'i sems ni 'phel ba'o //
translated: The mind of this one is vast.🔽The mind of that one is contracted.🔽The mind of this one is expanded.

original: gzhan gyi sems ni 'grib pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems ni 'grib pa'o //
translated: The mind of that one is diminished.

original: 'di'i sems ni khyab par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i sems ni khyab par 'gro ba'o //
translated: The mind of this one goes everywhere.

original: gzhan gyi sems ni khyab par 'gro ba ma yin pa'o zhes bya bar mi gzigs kyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems ni khyab par 'gro ba ma yin pa'o zhes bya bar mi gzigs kyi /
translated: The mind of that one does not go everywhere.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten nas /🔽sems rgya che ba de dngos po med cing yod pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten nas / sems rgya che ba de dngos po med cing yod pa ma yin pa /
translated: But, based on this perfection of wisdom,🔽he knows that the vast mind is non-existent, not existent, and has no intrinsic nature.

original: ngo bo nyid med par rab tu mkhyen pa ni sems rgya che ba la sems rgya che bar yongs su mkhyen nas /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med par rab tu mkhyen pa ni sems rgya che ba la sems rgya che bar yongs su mkhyen nas /
translated: Having known the vast mind as vast,🔽he knows it as it really is, as non-existent.

original: de yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid du dngos po med par rab tu mkhyen to zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid du dngos po med par rab tu mkhyen to zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: de bzhin du chen por gyur pa zhes bya ba 'dir yang rab 'byor 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas sems can gzhan dang gang zag gzhan dag gi sems 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa dang gnas pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du chen por gyur pa zhes bya ba 'dir yang rab 'byor 'di la de bzhin gshegs pas sems can gzhan dang gang zag gzhan dag gi sems 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa dang gnas pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang /
translated: Similarly, in the passage that reads “Subhūti, here the Tathāgata understands the minds of other beings and other persons, which are without coming, without going, without abiding, without arising, without ceasing, without being diminished, and without increasing,” the phrase “without coming” means that the mind is not observed to come from any place.🔽

original: 'gag pa med par gzigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di ston te /🔽chen po zhes bya ba 'di la chen po ni skye ba'i dbang dang / yang dag par gnas @211a * //
analyzed: 'gag pa med par gzigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di ston te / chen po zhes bya ba 'di la chen po ni skye ba'i dbang dang / yang dag par gnas @211a * //
translated: Likewise, in the passage beginning “Subhūti, here the Tathāgata sees the minds of other beings and other persons as neither coming nor going, nor remaining, nor arising, nor ceasing,” the great is taught.

original: pa'i dbang dang gnas shing yangs pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan du gyur pas 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i dbang dang gnas shing yangs pa'i mtshan nyid gzhan du gyur pas 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the great is a transformation of the power of arising, the power of correct abiding, and the characteristic of abiding and expanding.

original: gyur pa zhes bya ba de ni 'ong ba dang 'gro ba'i dbang gis 'gyur te /
analyzed: gyur pa zhes bya ba de ni 'ong ba dang 'gro ba'i dbang gis 'gyur te /
translated: The transformation is due to the power of coming and going.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab kyi ni de lta bur mi gzigs kyi dngos po med par ngo bo nyid kho nar gzigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab kyi ni de lta bur mi gzigs kyi dngos po med par ngo bo nyid kho nar gzigs so //
translated: The Tathāgata’s wisdom does not see it in that way, but sees it as only the nature of non-entityness.

original: de ltar na sems chen por gyur pa la sems chen por 'gyur ba med pas 'di'i dngos po med par rab tu mkhyen pa la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sems chen por gyur pa la sems chen por 'gyur ba med pas 'di'i dngos po med par rab tu mkhyen pa la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Thus, since there is no transformation of the mind into a great mind, it is said that he knows the non-existence of this entity.

original: sems tshad med pa zhes bya bas 'di ston te /
analyzed: sems tshad med pa zhes bya bas 'di ston te /
translated: The phrase “immeasurable mind” teaches this.

original: sems can de bdag gi sems de gnas pa ma yin pa dang rgyun chad pa ma yin pa dang / yongs su gnas pa ma yin pa dang / yongs su mi gnas pa ma yin par yang dag par rjes su gzugs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: sems can de bdag gi sems de gnas pa ma yin pa dang rgyun chad pa ma yin pa dang / yongs su gnas pa ma yin pa dang / yongs su mi gnas pa ma yin par yang dag par rjes su gzugs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di skad bstan te /
translated: The meaning of the phrase “he sees that mind as neither abiding nor ceasing, as neither confined nor unconfined” is as follows.

original: tshad med pa ni khyab par gnas pa'am /
analyzed: tshad med pa ni khyab par gnas pa'am /
translated: If immeasurable means abiding pervasively,

original: dbyibs kyi dbang gis 'gyur grang na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa ni de lta bu'i tshad med pa 'di sems mi gzigs kyi sems thams cad mi gnas pa dang / rten med par gzigs te /
analyzed: dbyibs kyi dbang gis 'gyur grang na / de bzhin gshegs pa ni de lta bu'i tshad med pa 'di sems mi gzigs kyi sems thams cad mi gnas pa dang / rten med par gzigs te /
translated: then it would be a shape.🔽The Tathāgata does not see this kind of immeasurability in the mind. He sees all minds as non-abiding and without support.

original: de ltar gzigs pa na tshad med pa'i sems yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid du rab tu mkhyen to zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzigs pa na tshad med pa'i sems yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid du rab tu mkhyen to zhes bya'o //
translated: When he sees in this way, he knows the immeasurable mind as it truly is.

original: sems de mtshan nyid med pa /
analyzed: sems de mtshan nyid med pa /
translated: That mind is seen to be without a characteristic,🔽and to be devoid of an intrinsic nature.

original: ngo bo nyid dang bral bar gzigs zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir bstan par mi nus pas bstan du med par gzigs so //🔽spyan lnga la sems de dag snang bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bsags pa'i phyir sems te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang bral bar gzigs zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir bstan par mi nus pas bstan du med par gzigs so // spyan lnga la sems de dag snang bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bsags pa'i phyir sems te /
translated: Since it cannot be shown because of the absence of an intrinsic nature and the absence of a characteristic, it is seen to be unmanifest.🔽The five eyes do not see that mind.

original: kun brtags pa la bya'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa la bya'o //
translated: The mind is a collection, and it is to be understood as the imagined.

original: de yang de'i bdag nyid kyis yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang de'i bdag nyid kyis yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it does not exist by way of its own nature,

original: med pa nyid kyi phyir de kho na gzigs pa rnams kyi spyan la snang bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽de bas na sems ni bltar med pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: med pa nyid kyi phyir de kho na gzigs pa rnams kyi spyan la snang bar mi 'gyur ro // de bas na sems ni bltar med pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and so it is not seen by the eyes of those who see reality, because it does not exist.

original: / bam po nyi shu gcig pa /
analyzed: / bam po nyi shu gcig pa /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of “the mind is invisible” is that it is not an object of knowledge.🔽The mind is clear, sunken, closed, and expanded.

original: sems gsal ba dang / bying ba dang btsums pa dang / bkram pa zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can lta ba phyin ci log pa rnams sems rtag par 'dzin pa'i dbang gis ni gsal ba'o //
analyzed: sems gsal ba dang / bying ba dang btsums pa dang / bkram pa zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can lta ba phyin ci log pa rnams sems rtag par 'dzin pa'i dbang gis ni gsal ba'o //
translated: The tīrthikas, due to their mistaken views, hold the mind to be permanent.

original: chad par 'dzin pa'i dbang gis ni bying ba'o //🔽skur pa 'debs pa'i dbang gis ni btsums pa'o //
analyzed: chad par 'dzin pa'i dbang gis ni bying ba'o // skur pa 'debs pa'i dbang gis ni btsums pa'o //
translated: By the power of nihilism, it is sunken.🔽By the power of denial, it is closed.

original: sgro 'dogs pa'i dbang gis ni bkram pa ste yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du @211b mkhyen to //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa'i dbang gis ni bkram pa ste yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du @211b mkhyen to //
translated: By the power of reification, it is scattered.

original: gzugs la brten ces bya ba ni phung po lnga las brtsams te skye'o zhes bya bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la brten ces bya ba ni phung po lnga las brtsams te skye'o zhes bya bar bstan pa'o //
translated: “Based on form” means that it arises in terms of the five aggregates.

original: de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs la gnas te sems 'phro ba dang / gzugs bdag go zhes mngon par zhen nas smra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni gzugs la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs la gnas te sems 'phro ba dang / gzugs bdag go zhes mngon par zhen nas smra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “It is based on form” means that the mind is attached to form and speaks, thinking “form is the self.”

original: de bzhin du de ni tshor ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de ni tshor ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to “it is based on feeling” and so on.

original: de bzhin du lta bar gyur pa las sems 'phro ba la sogs pa yang bstan nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du lta bar gyur pa las sems 'phro ba la sogs pa yang bstan nas /
translated: Thus, the mind is scattered by the view and so on.

original: de ni rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa'i 'phro ba la sogs pas bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ni rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa'i 'phro ba la sogs pas bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to teach the scattering of conceptual proliferation, he says:

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten nas gzugs mkhyen to //🔽gzugs ji ltar mkhyen zhe na ji ltar de bzhin nyid du 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med la /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten nas gzugs mkhyen to // gzugs ji ltar mkhyen zhe na ji ltar de bzhin nyid du 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med la /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the Tathāgata, by relying on this perfection of wisdom, knows form.🔽How does he know form? He knows all dharmas as suchness, in six ways, such as “unchanging,” “non-conceptual,”

original: mtshan ma med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa drug gis chos thams cad de bzhin nyid du bdag nyid du mkhyen to //
analyzed: mtshan ma med cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa drug gis chos thams cad de bzhin nyid du bdag nyid du mkhyen to //
translated: “signless,” and so on.

original: de la 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Among them, “unchanging” means that it is suchness without being different.

original: rnam par rtog pa med ces bya ba ni ma nor ba de bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med ces bya ba ni ma nor ba de bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “Non-conceptual” means that it is non-erroneous suchness.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni yang dag pa'i mtha'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni yang dag pa'i mtha'i phyir ro //
translated: “Signless” means that it is the limit of reality.

original: lhun gyis grub pa ni gsal bar byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa ni gsal bar byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Spontaneous” means that it is not something that is made manifest.

original: spros pa med pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spros pa med pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Free from mental proliferation” means that it is naturally secluded.

original: de dmigs su med pa ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de dmigs su med pa ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is not an object of observation because it is the non-entityness of entities.

original: de ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad dang / 'phags pa'i chos thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa yang de bzhin nyid du tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad dang / 'phags pa'i chos thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa yang de bzhin nyid du tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
translated: It is the suchness of all dharmas, whether with or without contamination, whether worldly or transcendent, whether of an ārya or not, and it is the suchness of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du chos thams cad gnyis su med par ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du chos thams cad gnyis su med par ston te /
translated: It is the suchness of all dharmas, which is taught to be nondual.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na sems kyi gsal ba dang / bying ba dang / bkram pa dang / btsums pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni phung po dang khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na sems kyi gsal ba dang / bying ba dang / bkram pa dang / btsums pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni phung po dang khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Subhūti, the suchness of the clarity, sinking, spreading, and closing of the mind is the suchness of the aggregates, constituents, and sense-spheres, and it is the suchness of dependent arising.

original: lha'i bu dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @212a * //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @212a * //
translated: The gods said, “Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is deep.

original: zab mo 'di ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni byis pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa kun brtags pa'i chos rnams dang / bral ba nyid la stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: zab mo 'di ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni byis pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa kun brtags pa'i chos rnams dang / bral ba nyid la stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This profound emptiness is the characteristic of emptiness.

original: rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad kyi mtshan ma med cing shin tu zhi ba'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad kyi mtshan ma med cing shin tu zhi ba'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of signlessness is that it is free from all signs of conceptual thought and discursive thought, and is completely peaceful.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i smon pa thams cad yongs su btang ba'i phyir phyis smon pa'i mtshams mi sbyor ba ni smon pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i smon pa thams cad yongs su btang ba'i phyir phyis smon pa'i mtshams mi sbyor ba ni smon pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of wishlessness is that it is free from all wishes and conceptual thoughts, and does not form any further wishes.

original: rgyu dang rkyen dang 'bras bur rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad rgyun chad cing skye ba la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas pa'i gnas skabs ni skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen dang 'bras bur rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad rgyun chad cing skye ba la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas pa'i gnas skabs ni skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of the unconditioned is that it is free from all conceptual thoughts of cause, condition, and effect, and is free from arising and so forth.

original: gyur pa rnam pa bzhis gnas gyur cing shin tu yongs su dag pa nyid la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gyur pa rnam pa bzhis gnas gyur cing shin tu yongs su dag pa nyid la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: It is called the “character of the absence of affliction and the absence of purification” because of the transformation of the four kinds of transformation and the extreme purity.

original: sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang mig yor la sogs pa bzhin du yongs su ma grub cing dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma dang rmi lam dang mig yor la sogs pa bzhin du yongs su ma grub cing dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: It is called the “character of the nature of non-existence” because of the non-establishment and the non-existence of things, like an illusion, a dream, or a mirage.

original: yongs su rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral zhing don dam par brjod du med pas nam mkha' bzhin du gang du yang gnas pa med pa la mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral zhing don dam par brjod du med pas nam mkha' bzhin du gang du yang gnas pa med pa la mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: It is called the “character of non-abiding” because of the absence of abiding anywhere, like space, due to the absence of all conceptualization and discrimination and the inexpressibility in the ultimate sense.

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus kyi mtha' rnam par spangs pa'i phyir yod pa dang med pa'i dngos po dang bral ba rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid la chad pa med pa dang / rnam par rtag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dang / dbus kyi mtha' rnam par spangs pa'i phyir yod pa dang med pa'i dngos po dang bral ba rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa nyid la chad pa med pa dang / rnam par rtag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Because of the abandonment of the extremes of the past, the future, and the middle, the freedom from the entities of existence and non-existence, the natural nirvana itself, is said to be characterized by the absence of annihilation and the absence of eternalism.

original: tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pas gnyis su med pa tha dad pa dang gcig pa dang bral ba nyid ni don gcig pa ma yin pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pas gnyis su med pa tha dad pa dang gcig pa dang bral ba nyid ni don gcig pa ma yin pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Because of the abandonment of all conceptual thoughts of difference, the non-duality free from difference and identity itself is said to be characterized by the non-difference of meaning and the non-difference of difference.

original: rtsol ba thams cad spangs pas gsal bar byed pa med pa la byed pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtsol ba thams cad spangs pas gsal bar byed pa med pa la byed pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the abandonment of all effort, the absence of manifestation is said to be characterized by the absence of activity.

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang bral ba nyid ni 'ong ba med pa dang 'gro ba med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang bral ba nyid ni 'ong ba med pa dang 'gro ba med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Because of the absence of going and coming, the freedom from going and coming itself is said to be characterized by the absence of coming and the absence of going.

original: rnam pa thams cad du thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral bas mtshan nyid @212b med pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid thams cad dang bral bas mtshan nyid @212b med pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of space is said to be the state of being devoid of all aspects, all natures, and all characteristics.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten gyi brdar bka' stsal te don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pas 'jig rten gyi brdar bka' stsal te don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid du gsungs pa'o //
translated: The Tathāgata has taught this as a conventional expression in the world, but not in the ultimate sense. This is the teaching on the characteristic of the inexpressible.

original: lha'i bu dag mtshan nyid de dag ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis gzhan du bya bar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa dang / phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pas yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag mtshan nyid de dag ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis gzhan du bya bar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa dang / phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pas yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid du gsungs pa'o //
translated: “Divine princes, those characteristics cannot be otherwise by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.” This is the teaching on the characteristic of the accomplished, because it is accomplished as unchanging and as unmistaken.

original: lha'i bu dag mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid gzhan du mi byed do zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin nyid rnam par 'khrug par mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid gzhan du mi byed do zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin nyid rnam par 'khrug par mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The sons of the gods, a characteristic does not make another characteristic. This means that reality does not disturb reality.

original: mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid mi shes so zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin nyid mi shes te ji ltar nam mkhas nam mkha' mi shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid mi shes so zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin nyid mi shes te ji ltar nam mkhas nam mkha' mi shes pa bzhin no //
translated: A characteristic does not know a characteristic. This means that reality does not know reality, just as space does not know space.

original: mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid med pa mi shes so zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyis kun brtags pa mi shes te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni mtshan nyid med pa mi shes so zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyis kun brtags pa mi shes te /
translated: A characteristic does not know the absence of a characteristic. This means that reality does not know the imagined.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' ri bong gi rva mi shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' ri bong gi rva mi shes pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as space does not know the horn of a rabbit.

original: mtshan nyid med pa ni mtshan nyid mi shes so zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pas de bzhin nyid mi shes te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa ni mtshan nyid mi shes so zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pas de bzhin nyid mi shes te /
translated: The absence of a characteristic does not know a characteristic. This means that the imagined does not know reality.

original: ji ltar ri bong gi rvas nam mkha' mi shes pa bzhin no//
analyzed: ji ltar ri bong gi rvas nam mkha' mi shes pa bzhin no//
translated: Just as the horn of a rabbit does not know space.

original: mtshan nyid med pas mtshan nyid mi shes so zhes bya ba kun brtags pas kun brtags pa mi shes te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pas mtshan nyid mi shes so zhes bya ba kun brtags pas kun brtags pa mi shes te /
translated: Since there is no characteristic, there is no cognition of a characteristic. The imaginary does not cognize the imaginary,

original: ji ltar ri bong gi rvas ri bong gi rva mi shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar ri bong gi rvas ri bong gi rva mi shes pa bzhin no //
translated: just as the horns of a rabbit do not cognize the horns of a rabbit.🔽Since neither that which is a characteristic nor that which is not a characteristic has an intrinsic nature that can be cognized,

original: mtshan nyid gang yin pa dang mtshan nyid med pa gang yin pa gnyis ka la yang gang gis shes par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid rnam par mi rtog pa dang lhun gyis grub pa nyid dang spyod pa med pa'i
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang yin pa dang mtshan nyid med pa gang yin pa gnyis ka la yang gang gis shes par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid rnam par mi rtog pa dang lhun gyis grub pa nyid dang spyod pa med pa'i
translated: because of the non-conceptuality, spontaneity, and non-functioning of thusness, there is no intrinsic nature of cognition.

original: phyir rab tu shes pa'i ngo bo nyid med de kun brtags pa rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir rab tu shes pa'i ngo bo nyid med de kun brtags pa rnams med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the imaginary do not exist, there is no intrinsic nature of cognition.

original: gang gis shes par byed ces bya ba ni shes pa la sogs pas so //🔽gang shes par byed ces bya ba ni gang zag gam chos so //
analyzed: gang gis shes par byed ces bya ba ni shes pa la sogs pas so // gang shes par byed ces bya ba ni gang zag gam chos so //
translated: By what is it cognized? By cognition, etc.🔽What is cognized? The person or the dharmas.

original: gang la shes par byed ces bya ba ni gang zag gam chos gzhan la'o //
analyzed: gang la shes par byed ces bya ba ni gang zag gam chos gzhan la'o //
translated: Where is it cognized? In another person or dharma.

original: lha'i bu dag mtshan nyid 'di dag ni gzugs kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ston to//
analyzed: lha'i bu dag mtshan nyid 'di dag ni gzugs kyis mngon par 'dus byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ston to//
translated: The passage beginning with “Divine sons, these characteristics are not created by form” teaches the characteristic of non-creation.

original: @213a * // mtshan nyid thams cad ni mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa la sogs pa sngar smos pa rnams dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa thams cad dang kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: @213a * // mtshan nyid thams cad ni mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa la sogs pa sngar smos pa rnams dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa thams cad dang kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “All characteristics are without characteristics” refers to emptiness, signlessness, and so on mentioned previously, and all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos gnas pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos gnas pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning with “whether the tathāgatas appear or not” teaches the characteristic of the abiding of the Dharma.

original: mtshan nyid kyi dbyings ni mtshan nyid med pa'i dbyings ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa nyid de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi dbyings ni mtshan nyid med pa'i dbyings ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa nyid de /
translated: The realm of characteristics abides just as the realm of non-characteristics.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa thams cad med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa'i dbyings zhes bya'o //🔽de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid du thugs su chud pa'am /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa thams cad med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa'i dbyings zhes bya'o // de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid du thugs su chud pa'am /
translated: That is called the thusness realized by the Tathāgata, and it is called the realm without characteristics because all conceptual characteristics are absent.🔽Therefore, he is called the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin nyid thugs su chud pa la nges pa'i tshig gis de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid thugs su chud pa la nges pa'i tshig gis de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called the Tathāgata because he has realized suchness, or because suchness has been realized.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rab tu bstan pas mtshan nyid thams cad yang dag par rab tu mkhyen zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rab tu bstan pas mtshan nyid thams cad yang dag par rab tu mkhyen zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Tathāgata, by teaching the perfection of wisdom, knows all characteristics perfectly.

original: lha'i bu dag stong pa nyid kyang mtshan nyid dang mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag stong pa nyid kyang mtshan nyid dang mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: O gods, because emptiness has the characteristic of the absence of characteristics and the absence of signs,

original: 'di ni zab pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar smos pa ston to //
analyzed: 'di ni zab pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar smos pa ston to //
translated: this is profound, and so on, as stated above.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang mtshan nyid thams cad rab tu dbye ba mdzad de zhes bya ba ni don dam pa rnam par mi rtog pa de lta bu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang mtshan nyid thams cad rab tu dbye ba mdzad de zhes bya ba ni don dam pa rnam par mi rtog pa de lta bu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas
translated: This means that after fully awakening to that non-conceptual ultimate,

original: kyang kyang sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid rnams bshad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kyang kyang sems can rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid rnams bshad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: he explained the characteristics of the conventional in order to benefit sentient beings.

original: gzugs ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid rnams ston to //🔽'di la byas pa gzo ba dang byas pa tshor ba ni bdag gis 'di byas so //
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid rnams ston to // 'di la byas pa gzo ba dang byas pa tshor ba ni bdag gis 'di byas so //
translated: The characteristics of the conventional are taught by “Form is the characteristic of being able to assume form,” and so on.🔽Here, being grateful and being appreciative are understood as “I did this,”

original: bdag gis 'di khas blangs so zhes bya bar bdag gis byas pa dang / bsgrub par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gis 'di khas blangs so zhes bya bar bdag gis byas pa dang / bsgrub par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and “I promised this,” because of realizing what was done and what was accomplished.

original: ma byas pa dang 'gyur ba med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas @213b zhes bya ba ni sus kyang ma byas pa'i chos rnams ma byas pa'i bdag nyid du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: ma byas pa dang 'gyur ba med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas @213b zhes bya ba ni sus kyang ma byas pa'i chos rnams ma byas pa'i bdag nyid du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'o //
translated: “Awakened to what is not done and what does not change” means that he has awakened to the fact that dharmas, which are not done, are not done by anyone.

original: 'gyur ba med pa ni mi 'gyur ba med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni mi 'gyur ba'i bdag nyid du mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa ni mi 'gyur ba med par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni mi 'gyur ba'i bdag nyid du mkhyen pa'o //
translated: “Awakened to what does not change” means that he has awakened to the fact that they do not change.

original: lus med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lus med pa khog pa med pa gzugs med pa nyid do //
analyzed: lus med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lus med pa khog pa med pa gzugs med pa nyid do //
translated: “Because it is without a body” means that it is without a body, without a trunk, and without form.

original: rab 'byor de ltar na lus med cing khog pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pas ma byas pa mkhyen pa dang / ma byas pa rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid mkhyen pas ma byas pa mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar na lus med cing khog pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pas ma byas pa mkhyen pa dang / ma byas pa rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas kyi mtshan nyid mkhyen pas ma byas pa mkhyen pa'o //
translated: “Subhūti, thus, the Tathāgata has known and seen this body, which is without a body, as not done, as not made, as not compounded.” This is the knowledge of the characteristic of the uncompounded.

original: don dam par 'byung ba med pa'i mthus ye shes byas pa med pa chos thams cad la zhugs so zhes bya ba la don dam pa byung ba med pa'i mthus zhes bya ba ni don dam pa /
analyzed: don dam par 'byung ba med pa'i mthus ye shes byas pa med pa chos thams cad la zhugs so zhes bya ba la don dam pa byung ba med pa'i mthus zhes bya ba ni don dam pa /
translated: By the power of ultimate non-arising, the uncreated pristine wisdom of the Tathagata penetrates all dharmas.

original: ma skyes ma byung ba'i dbang gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma skyes ma byung ba'i dbang gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By the power of ultimate non-arising means by the power of ultimate non-production and non-arising.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni yongs su grub pa'i chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid yin pas ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni yongs su grub pa'i chos kyi sku'i mtshan nyid yin pas ma byas pa ste /
translated: The pristine wisdom of the Tathagata is characterized by the Dharma Body of perfect achievement, and so is uncreated.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni ma byas pa mkhyen pa'o zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni ma byas pa mkhyen pa'o zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that the Tathagata is the knower of the uncreated.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe chos thams cad skyed pa po ma mchis shing mthong ba po ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni mi skyed pas na skyed pa po med pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gi tshe chos thams cad skyed pa po ma mchis shing mthong ba po ma mchis pa zhes bya ba ni mi skyed pas na skyed pa po med pa ste /
translated: Blessed One, when all dharmas are not producers and not perceivers, they are not producers because they are not produced.

original: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skyed pa'o zhes bya ba ni mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skyed pa'o zhes bya ba ni mi mthong ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not seen that the perfection of wisdom produces.

original: mthong bar mi byed pas mthong ba po med pa ste /
analyzed: mthong bar mi byed pas mthong ba po med pa ste /
translated: It is not a perceiver because it does not perceive.

original: de bas na 'jig rten ston pa'o zhes bya ba mi mthong ngo zhes ston to //
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten ston pa'o zhes bya ba mi mthong ngo zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, it is shown that the world is not seen as a teacher.

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos thams cad stong pa dang / gso ba dang gsog yin pa'i phyir skyed pa po med pa dang / mthong ba po med pa bden mod kyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos thams cad stong pa dang / gso ba dang gsog yin pa'i phyir skyed pa po med pa dang / mthong ba po med pa bden mod kyi /
translated: Subhūti, it is so and so forth shows that it is true that all phenomena are empty, and that there is no creator and no seer because they are like a dream and a magical creation.

original: don 'di lta bu shes pa 'jig rten na su yang med de /
analyzed: don 'di lta bu shes pa 'jig rten na su yang med de /
translated: However, there is no one in the world who knows this meaning.

original: ngas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brtan nas /
analyzed: ngas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brtan nas /
translated: I, having relied on this perfection of wisdom,

original: don ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: have fully awakened to the meaning just as it is.

original: de lta bas na der bskyed pa yin zhing ston pa yin no zhes de skad ston te /
analyzed: de lta bas na der bskyed pa yin zhing ston pa yin no zhes de skad ston te /
translated: Therefore, it is shown that it is created and taught there.

original: 'di ni bstod pa'i tshig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni bstod pa'i tshig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the words of praise.

original: gzugs mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gzugs ngas ma mthong ba de'i phyir de ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs mthong ba med pa'i phyir ston pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gzugs ngas ma mthong ba de'i phyir de ston pa'o //
translated: Because form is not seen, it is a teacher means that because form is not seen by me, therefore it is a teacher.

original: gal te gzugs mthong bar gyur na ni rab @214a * //
analyzed: gal te gzugs mthong bar gyur na ni rab @214a * //
translated: If he were to see forms,

original: rib can bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don mthong bas de ston par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rib can bzhin du yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don mthong bas de ston par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then, like one with cataracts, he would see unreal objects, and he would not be a teacher.

original: rab 'byor nam gzugs la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba'i tshe zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rab rib can la skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba de phyis mi 'byung bar gyur pa de nas mthong
analyzed: rab 'byor nam gzugs la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung ba'i tshe zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rab rib can la skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba de phyis mi 'byung bar gyur pa de nas mthong
translated: Subhuti, when consciousness no longer occurs in regard to form,

original: ba yongs su dag pa zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ba yongs su dag pa zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: at that time, the eye is said to be purified.🔽When consciousness no longer occurs in regard to form, etc.,

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams mi 'byung ba'i phyir ston pa zhes bya ba'i ming du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams mi 'byung ba'i phyir ston pa zhes bya ba'i ming du 'gyur ro //
translated: then the name “teacher” is appropriate, because the consciousnesses that perceive form, etc. no longer occur.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar ston to zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya bar ston to zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid rtog ge'i spyod yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Inconceivable” indicates that reality is beyond the domain of sophistry.

original: rab 'byor gzugs ni bsam gyis mi khyab /🔽gzhal du med /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs ni bsam gyis mi khyab / gzhal du med /
translated: Subhūti, form is inconceivable,🔽immeasurable,

original: dpag tu med /
analyzed: dpag tu med /
translated: infinite,🔽incalculable, and equal to the unequaled.

original: grangs med cing mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste snang ba med pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs na snang ba med pa ste ci'i phyir zhe na kun brtags pa'i gzugs ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pa'i phyir snang ba med do //
analyzed: grangs med cing mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa ste snang ba med pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs na snang ba med pa ste ci'i phyir zhe na kun brtags pa'i gzugs ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du med pa'i phyir snang ba med do //
translated: This is the non-appearance of form. Why is it so? Imagined form does not appear because it is non-existent like the horn of a rabbit.

original: chos nyid kyi gzugs ni rnam par shes pa gang gis kyang gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir snang ba med de /🔽gang gi phyir de ltar snang ba med pa de'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya gzhal du med ces bya /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi gzugs ni rnam par shes pa gang gis kyang gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir snang ba med de / gang gi phyir de ltar snang ba med pa de'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya gzhal du med ces bya /
translated: The form of reality does not appear because it cannot be apprehended by any consciousness.

original: dpag tu med ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpag tu med ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because it is thus non-appearing, it is called inconceivable, immeasurable, infinite, and so on.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa bstan pa ni gzhung las 'byung ba bzhin du brda phrad sla'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa bstan pa ni gzhung las 'byung ba bzhin du brda phrad sla'o //
translated: The teaching on the inconceivable and so on is easy to understand according to the text.

original: de la ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyis gzung du med ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de la ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyang mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams kyis gzung du med ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: In that, even the phenomena of mind and mental factors are not apprehended. This means that the phenomena of mind and mental factors are not grasped.

original: de bas na snang ba med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na snang ba med pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be without appearance.

original: ci'i phyir gnas brtan rab 'byor don chen po'i slad du nye bar gnas pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin pa'i skabs yang slar glengs te bstan zhe na 'khor bsdu ba'i phyir 'di nyid glengs nas rgya cher spro bar 'dod pa'i phyir yang bstan te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gnas brtan rab 'byor don chen po'i slad du nye bar gnas pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad zin pa'i skabs yang slar glengs te bstan zhe na 'khor bsdu ba'i phyir 'di nyid glengs nas rgya cher spro bar 'dod pa'i phyir yang bstan te /
translated: Why is it that the elder Subhūti is said to abide for the sake of the great meaning, and so on? This was explained before, but why is it mentioned again? It is taught in order to gather the assembly and to expand on what was previously taught.

original: sngar ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sngon gyi spyod pa la phan 'dogs pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: sngar ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sngon gyi spyod pa la phan 'dogs pa yin par bstan to //
translated: Previously, it was taught that it benefits the conduct of the buddhas.

original: de ni sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byed do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byed do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, it is taught that it performs the activities of the buddhas.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu @214b phyin pa ni gzugs la yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / mngon par zhen pa med par nye bar gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mthong bas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la sred pas yongs su 'dzin pa dang /🔽lta bas mngon par zhen pa mi 'byung ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu @214b phyin pa ni gzugs la yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / mngon par zhen pa med par nye bar gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mthong bas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la sred pas yongs su 'dzin pa dang / lta bas mngon par zhen pa mi 'byung ba de'i phyir /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is present as non-apprehending and non-adherence with regard to form.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / mngon par zhen pa med par nye bar gnas pa'o zhes bya ba'i ming du 'gyur te don chen po nyid du ston to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang / mngon par zhen pa med par nye bar gnas pa'o zhes bya ba'i ming du 'gyur te don chen po nyid du ston to //
translated: This is the great significance of the perfection of wisdom, because of which it is called by that name.

original: rab 'byor ngas kyang zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid dbang du gyur par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor ngas kyang zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid dbang du gyur par gsungs pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, I also, having fully known all dharmas as they really are, have taught the Dharma to beings through the twelve branches of the scriptures.

original: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang rang sangs rgyas kyi bar gyi shes pa dang / spros pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i bzod pa'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab ni che bar bstan te /
analyzed: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang rang sangs rgyas kyi bar gyi shes pa dang / spros pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i bzod pa'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab ni che bar bstan te /
translated: The knowledge of the faith-follower, the Dharma-follower, up to the arhat and pratyekabuddha, and any conceptual elaboration, that is the acceptance of the bodhisattva who has attained the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu'i shes pa rnams dang nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa rnams ni sa brgyad pa la zhugs pa'i mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa tsam nyid kyis mthar gtugs par 'gyur
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu'i shes pa rnams dang nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa rnams ni sa brgyad pa la zhugs pa'i mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa tsam nyid kyis mthar gtugs par 'gyur
translated: The knowledge of the arhats on the path of the result of all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and the abandonment of all afflictions, is included in the mere attainment of the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas by one who has entered the eighth stage.

original: te / de dag gi shes pa dang spang ba ni bzod pa de las lhag pa med do //
analyzed: te / de dag gi shes pa dang spang ba ni bzod pa de las lhag pa med do //
translated: Because there is no knowledge or abandonment superior to that acceptance.

original: de phan chad ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams rnam pa thams cad du nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de phan chad ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams rnam pa thams cad du nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: From that point on, the bodhisattvas are completely free from afflictions.

original: de dag shin tu yang mi ring ba zhig tu phyin nas mi snang bar gyur te zhes bya ba ni bshad pa 'dis de dag gi bya ba yongs su rdzogs par bstan to //
analyzed: de dag shin tu yang mi ring ba zhig tu phyin nas mi snang bar gyur te zhes bya ba ni bshad pa 'dis de dag gi bya ba yongs su rdzogs par bstan to //
translated: They went a little way off and disappeared. This explains the completion of their activity.

original: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bshad pa 'di la mos pa la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i gang zag rnams gus pa skyed pa'i phyir de dag gi skye ba zhus pa /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bshad pa 'di la mos pa la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'i gang zag rnams gus pa skyed pa'i phyir de dag gi skye ba zhus pa /
translated: Then, in order to generate respect for the person who is endowed with the perfection of faith, etc., in this explanation, the elder Subhūti asked about their birth:

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos ma thag tu mos par 'gyur ba de gang nas shi 'phos te 'dir skyes par gyur pa lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos ma thag tu mos par 'gyur ba de gang nas shi 'phos te 'dir skyes par gyur pa lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Where did those who immediately upon hearing this profound perfection of wisdom have faith come from to be born here?

original: 'dir yang byang chub sems dpa' dkar po'i phyogs su gtogs pa gsum dang nag po'i phyogs su gtogs pa gsum bstan te mi rnams nyid kyi nang nas shi 'phos te mi rnams nyid kyi nang du @215a * //
analyzed: 'dir yang byang chub sems dpa' dkar po'i phyogs su gtogs pa gsum dang nag po'i phyogs su gtogs pa gsum bstan te mi rnams nyid kyi nang nas shi 'phos te mi rnams nyid kyi nang du @215a * //
translated: Here, the three types of bodhisattvas belonging to the bright side and the three belonging to the dark side are taught. Those who die as humans and are born among humans

original: skyes pa ni dge ba ste gcig go //
analyzed: skyes pa ni dge ba ste gcig go //
translated: are virtuous, the first.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dag nas shi 'phos te mi rnams kyi nang du skyes pa yang dge ba ste gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan dag nas shi 'phos te mi rnams kyi nang du skyes pa yang dge ba ste gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is the wholesome one who has died in another Buddha-field and is reborn among humans.

original: dga' ldan nas shi 'phos te 'dir skyes pa yang dge ba ste gsum pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ldan nas shi 'phos te 'dir skyes pa yang dge ba ste gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is the wholesome one who has died in Tusita and is reborn here.

original: nag po'i phyogs gsum ni sngon gyi mthar mnyan pa dang yongs su dris pa dang mi ldan pas 'dir skyes na yang bshad pa lam mos pa ni gcig go //
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs gsum ni sngon gyi mthar mnyan pa dang yongs su dris pa dang mi ldan pas 'dir skyes na yang bshad pa lam mos pa ni gcig go //
translated: The three unwholesome ones: the first is the one who is reborn here without having listened to or questioned about the Dharma in the past, and who is not interested in the teaching.

original: sngon gyi mthar mnyan pa la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa 'dir dad pa tsam gyis thos na yang 'phrogs par 'gyur zhing ldam ldem du 'gyur ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi mthar mnyan pa la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa 'dir dad pa tsam gyis thos na yang 'phrogs par 'gyur zhing ldam ldem du 'gyur ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is the one who, without having listened to the Dharma in the past, is carried away by mere faith when he hears it here, and becomes confused.

original: gar sngon gyi mthar bshad pa 'di dad pa tsam gyis dris na yang 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang mi ldan na phyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dag tu lhung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gar sngon gyi mthar bshad pa 'di dad pa tsam gyis dris na yang 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang mi ldan na phyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dag tu lhung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is the one who, without having listened to the Dharma in the past, is carried away by mere faith when he questions about it here, and later falls into the vehicles of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: 'dir yang rgya mtsho'i gru'i dpe dang / bum pa'i dpe dang / de nas yang gru'i dpe dang mi rgad po'i dpe dag ni gzhung nyid las brda phrad sla'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang rgya mtsho'i gru'i dpe dang / bum pa'i dpe dang / de nas yang gru'i dpe dang mi rgad po'i dpe dag ni gzhung nyid las brda phrad sla'o //
translated: Here, the example of the ocean and the ship, the example of the pot, and then again the example of the ship and the old man are easy to understand from the text itself.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs mkhas pa dang mi ldan na theg pa gnyis su ltung gi ldan na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis ji ltar
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang thabs mkhas pa dang mi ldan na theg pa gnyis su ltung gi ldan na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis ji ltar
translated: In order to demonstrate that if one is not endowed with the perfection of wisdom and skill in means, one falls into the two vehicles, but if one is endowed with them, one attains unsurpassed perfect complete awakening, the elder Subhūti asked how

original: de gnyis dang mi ldan par 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar de gnyis dang mi ldan par mi 'gyur ba zhus pa dang / de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la dmigs pa'i dbang dang nga rgyal gyi dbang gis mi ldan pa'i ming du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gnyis dang mi ldan par 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar de gnyis dang mi ldan par mi 'gyur ba zhus pa dang / de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la dmigs pa'i dbang dang nga rgyal gyi dbang gis mi ldan pa'i ming du 'gyur te /
translated: one becomes not endowed with those two, and how one does not become not endowed with those two. At that time, the Bhagavān said that one becomes not endowed with them by the power of the six perfections and the power of pride.

original: de ni sa gnyis las sa gang yang rung ba gcig tu ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni sa gnyis las sa gang yang rung ba gcig tu ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One falls into either of the two stages.

original: gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la dmigs pa dang / nga rgyal med pa de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byed do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la dmigs pa dang / nga rgyal med pa de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byed do zhes bstan to //
translated: He who has the six perfections as his object and is free from pride, he will attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: 'di ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa de ni tshu rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi phyogs rnam par mi rtog pa la tshu rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa de ni tshu rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi phyogs rnam par mi rtog pa la tshu rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the perfection of giving is a near shore, etc. The near shore is said to be the non-discriminative side of the path of the bodhisattvas' knowledge of paths.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyogs ni pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ste rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu @215b phyin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyogs ni pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ste rnam par mi rtog pa'i pha rol tu @215b phyin pa'o //
translated: The far shore is said to be the side of the knowledge of all modes of the Buddhas, the non-discriminative far shore.

original: de bas na tshu rol yang shes pha rol yang shes zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na tshu rol yang shes pha rol yang shes zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he who knows the near shore and knows the far shore is said to be able to teach the crossing over.

original: de'i 'og tu thabs mkhas pa'i 'gres la yang rim pa de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu thabs mkhas pa'i 'gres la yang rim pa de nyid do //
translated: After that, in the series on skill in means, the same sequence is followed.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs mkhas pa dang mi ldan pa dag theg pa gnyis su ltung bar 'gyur ba thos nas 'o na theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa las dad po pa dag ji ltar 'gyur snyam nas /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs mkhas pa dang mi ldan pa dag theg pa gnyis su ltung bar 'gyur ba thos nas 'o na theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa las dad po pa dag ji ltar 'gyur snyam nas /
translated: Thus, having heard that those who are not endowed with the perfection of wisdom and skill in means fall into the two vehicles, one might think, “Well then, what about those who have newly entered the vehicle and have little faith?”

original: bcom ldan 'das las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi zhes zhus pa dang bcom ldan 'das kyis pas dang po pa dag la dge ba'i bshes gnyen nges par dgos te
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bgyi zhes zhus pa dang bcom ldan 'das kyis pas dang po pa dag la dge ba'i bshes gnyen nges par dgos te
translated: Therefore, one asks the Bhagavān, “How should a beginner bodhisattva mahāsattva train in the perfection of wisdom?” The Bhagavān teaches that beginners definitely need a spiritual friend.

original: / de bas na dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par bya zhes bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: / de bas na dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten par bya zhes bya ba bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it teaches, “One should rely on a spiritual friend.”

original: mchog tu 'dzin par ma byed cig ces bya ba dang / 'dod pa ma skyed cig ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i lta ba dang / don dam pa la chags pas smon pa ma byed cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin par ma byed cig ces bya ba dang / 'dod pa ma skyed cig ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i lta ba dang / don dam pa la chags pas smon pa ma byed cig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Do not grasp at the highest,” and “Do not generate desire” means do not conceive of and be attached to the ultimate.

original: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis de ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tshol ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dka' ba bgyid pa'o zhes gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis skabs der 'jig rten la phan pa dang /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis de ltar chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tshol ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni dka' ba bgyid pa'o zhes gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis skabs der 'jig rten la phan pa dang /
translated: Then the elder Subhuti said, “A bodhisattva who seeks unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in all phenomena that are empty of their own marks is doing something difficult.”

original: bde ba dang mgon dang skyabs dang gnas dang dpung gnyen dang gling dang / yongs su 'dren pa dang / rten du 'gyur bar bya'o zhes bya ba tshig dgus bstan nas de nas yang tshig de dag re re nas smos te /
analyzed: bde ba dang mgon dang skyabs dang gnas dang dpung gnyen dang gling dang / yongs su 'dren pa dang / rten du 'gyur bar bya'o zhes bya ba tshig dgus bstan nas de nas yang tshig de dag re re nas smos te /
translated: The Blessed One, in that context, taught with nine phrases, “I will be a protector, a refuge, a support, a friend, an island, a leader, and a resort for the world’s benefit, happiness, and protection.”

original: rgya cher bshad pa mdzad do //
analyzed: rgya cher bshad pa mdzad do //
translated: Then he explained each of those phrases in detail.

original: 'gro ba rnams las yongs su thar par byas la /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams las yongs su thar par byas la /
translated: Having completely liberated beings,

original: 'jig pa med pa'i gnas su dgod pa'i bsam pa ni phan pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa med pa'i gnas su dgod pa'i bsam pa ni phan pa'o //
translated: the intention to establish them in a state of non-destruction is benefit.

original: sdug bsngal rnams las yongs su thar par byas la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnams las yongs su thar par byas la /
translated: Having completely liberated them from suffering,

original: bde ba la dgod pa'i bsam pa ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba la dgod pa'i bsam pa ni bde ba'o //
translated: the intention to establish them in happiness is happiness.

original: sdug bsngal rnams las yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir chos bshad pa'i bsam pa ni mgon no //🔽sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnams las yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir chos bshad pa'i bsam pa ni mgon no // sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag pa rnams sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byas la /
translated: The intention to liberate those who are tormented by suffering from suffering

original: phung po med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par dgod pa'i bsam pa ni skyabs so//🔽@216a * // chags pa med par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po med pa'i mya ngan las 'das par dgod pa'i bsam pa ni skyabs so// @216a * // chags pa med par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: and to establish them in nirvana without remainder is a shelter.

original: chos 'chad pa'i bsam pa ni gnas so //
analyzed: chos 'chad pa'i bsam pa ni gnas so //
translated: The intention to teach the Dharma in order to eliminate attachment🔽is a friend.🔽The intention to teach the Dharma in order to eliminate all attachment to phenomena such as form is a protector.🔽The intention to teach the Dharma in order to eliminate all attachment to phenomena such as form is a protector.

analyzed: sems can rnams la snying rje chen pos mya ngan las 'das par 'dren pa'i chos 'chad pa'i bsam pa ni yongs su 'dren pa'o //
translated: The intention to teach the Dharma in order to eliminate all attachment

original: mdor na 'gro ba'i gnas brgyad cu rtsa lnga nye bar gzung nas so sor rtog pa'i bsam pa ni rten du 'gyur ro zhes gzhung gi go rims so //
analyzed: mdor na 'gro ba'i gnas brgyad cu rtsa lnga nye bar gzung nas so sor rtog pa'i bsam pa ni rten du 'gyur ro zhes gzhung gi go rims so //
translated: The order of the text is as follows.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na chos thams cad 'dre ba ma mchis pa lags zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i dus na kun brtags pa dang / yongs su grub pa gnyis gang gi tshe gcig tu gyur te tha dad pa ma yin par gnas pa de'i tshe de gnyis tha dad pa med par gnas pa ni 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na chos thams cad 'dre ba ma mchis pa lags zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i dus na kun brtags pa dang / yongs su grub pa gnyis gang gi tshe gcig tu gyur te tha dad pa ma yin par gnas pa de'i tshe de gnyis tha dad pa med par gnas pa ni 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The question, “Blessed One, how are all phenomena unmixed?” refers to the imagined and the perfect, which at the time of cyclic existence are not different, in the sense that they are not separate. At that time, their non-difference is called “mixed.”

original: gang gi tshe chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mthun pa nyan pa dang bsam pa dang sgom pa la sogs pa'i mthus rim gyis gnas gyur pa na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mthun pa nyan pa dang bsam pa dang sgom pa la sogs pa'i mthus rim gyis gnas gyur pa na /
translated: When the realm of reality becomes the basis through the power of listening, reflection, and meditation, which are concordant with the extremely pure realm of reality,

original: yongs su grub pa dang kun brtags pa gnyis tha dad par gyur cing shin tu rnam par dag pa dri ma med pa'i ngo bo nyid du gnas par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa dang kun brtags pa gnyis tha dad par gyur cing shin tu rnam par dag pa dri ma med pa'i ngo bo nyid du gnas par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the two, the thoroughly established nature and the imagined nature, become different and the thoroughly established nature abides in the nature of the extremely pure, stainless reality,

original: 'dres pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: then it is called “unmixed.”

original: 'brel pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa yang de nyid kyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //🔽gzugs kyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid gzugs kyi mtshan nyid spangs pa'i phyir gzugs kyi pha rol du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa yang de nyid kyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o // gzugs kyi pha rol gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid gzugs kyi mtshan nyid spangs pa'i phyir gzugs kyi pha rol du gyur pa yin te /
translated: “Unrelated,” “non-arisen,” “non-ceased,” and so on are also included in its synonyms.🔽“Whatever is the other side of form, that is not form” means that suchness is the other side of form because it is the abandonment of the characteristic of form.

original: de bas na gzugs kyi pha rol du gyur pa de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs kyi pha rol du gyur pa de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that suchness, which is the other side of form, is not the imagined nature of form.

original: rab 'byor gzugs ji lta bar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba thams cad kyang de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir de skad gsungs kyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs ji lta bar chos thams cad kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba thams cad kyang de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir de skad gsungs kyi /
translated: “Subhūti, all phenomena are just like form” is said because all are of the nature of suchness,

original: mngon par 'brel ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon par 'brel ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: but not because of direct connection.🔽“Subhūti, if all phenomena are just like form,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par @216b rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nyid du mi 'gyur lags sam zhes bya ba ni ci las dgongs she na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par @216b rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nyid du mi 'gyur lags sam zhes bya ba ni ci las dgongs she na /
translated: then will bodhisattva great beings not become fully awakened to the very suchness of form?”

original: gal te chos thams cad gzugs ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad gzugs ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: This is said because of the thought, “If all phenomena are just like form,

original: 'o na ni gzugs mngon par rtogs pa nyid kyis chos thams cad mngon par rtogs par 'gyur te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ni gzugs mngon par rtogs pa nyid kyis chos thams cad mngon par rtogs par 'gyur te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: then the full awakening to all phenomena will be the full awakening to the suchness of form alone, and the attainment of the knowledge of all aspects will be the attainment of the knowledge of the suchness of form alone.”

original: bcom ldan 'das gzugs kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni gal te gzugs kyi pha rol du gyur pa de bzhin nyid la gzugs su rnam par rtog par gyur na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzugs kyi pha rol na rnam par rtog pa gang yang ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni gal te gzugs kyi pha rol du gyur pa de bzhin nyid la gzugs su rnam par rtog par gyur na /
translated: If the suchness that is the other side of form were a conceptualization of form,

original: gzugs kyi pha rol rtogs pas chos thams cad rtogs par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gzugs kyi pha rol rtogs pas chos thams cad rtogs par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: one would not realize all phenomena by realizing the other side of form.

original: gzugs rtogs pa tsam du zad par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gzugs rtogs pa tsam du zad par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: It would be merely the realization of form.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid yin pas /
translated: But since it is suchness,

original: gzugs kyi pha rol la gzugs su rnam par rtog pa med de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi pha rol la gzugs su rnam par rtog pa med de /
translated: there is no conceptualization of form beyond form.

original: de'i phyir de tsam zhig rtogs pas chos thams cad rtog par 'grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de tsam zhig rtogs pas chos thams cad rtog par 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, by realizing just that, the realization of all phenomena is established.

original: gling lta bu'i chos rnams mthong ba'i phyir gling ngo //
analyzed: gling lta bu'i chos rnams mthong ba'i phyir gling ngo //
translated: It is an island because phenomena are seen as being like an island.

original: gzugs ni sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs ni sngon gyi mthar don dam par nam yang ma byung /
analyzed: gzugs ni sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs ni sngon gyi mthar don dam par nam yang ma byung /
translated: Form is the end of the past and the future.

original: phyi ma'i mthar yang don dam par nam yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mthar yang don dam par nam yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it ever arise ultimately in the future,

original: dus thams cad du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist at all times.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad kyi sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa gang yin pa de ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad kyi sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su chad pa gang yin pa de ni zhi ba'o //
translated: Subhuti, the peace of all dharmas, their calm, their utter abandonment, is the ultimate.

original: de ni gya nom pa'o zhes bya ba ni dus stong pa nyid kyi phyir chos thams cad dmigs su med pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa ste de rigs pa'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: de ni gya nom pa'o zhes bya ba ni dus stong pa nyid kyi phyir chos thams cad dmigs su med pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa ste de rigs pa'o zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that the non-apprehension of all dharmas is the ultimate, because of the emptiness of time.🔽Form is of the nature of space.

original: gzugs ni nam mkha'i tshul can no zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i gzugs ni nam mkha' bzhin du gos pa med cing 'gyur ba med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs ni nam mkha'i tshul can no zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i gzugs ni nam mkha' bzhin du gos pa med cing 'gyur ba med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that ultimate form is like space, unsoiled and unchanging.🔽The emptiness of form is without coming and going.

original: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba med pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi stong pa nyid rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i tshe yang gang yang mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid ni 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba med pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi stong pa nyid rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i tshe yang gang yang mi 'gro'o //
translated: This means that even when the emptiness of form is conceptualized, it does not go anywhere.

original: phyis rnam par mi rtog pa'i tshe yang gang nas kyang ma 'ongs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyis rnam par mi rtog pa'i tshe yang gang nas kyang ma 'ongs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Later, when there is no discursive thought, it is as if they have not come from anywhere.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni stong pa nyid kyi tshul can te zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de dag ni tshul de @217a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni stong pa nyid kyi tshul can te zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de dag ni tshul de @217a * //
translated: Subhuti: All dharmas are empty of their own-being.🔽They do not pass beyond that own-being.

original: las mi 'da'o zhes bya ba ni chos de dag ngo bo nyid de mi 'dor zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: las mi 'da'o zhes bya ba ni chos de dag ngo bo nyid de mi 'dor zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They do not abandon that own-being.

original: skye ba med pa dang dngos po med pa'i tshul can no zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen gyi mthus ma skyes shing ma byung ba dang / ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'o //🔽chos thams cad ni mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa med pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang dngos po med pa'i tshul can no zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang rkyen gyi mthus ma skyes shing ma byung ba dang / ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'o // chos thams cad ni mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa med pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: They are without production, without occurrence, without origination, and without nonorigination.🔽All dharmas are infinite.

original: tshad med pa'i phyir kun du mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i phyir kun du mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: They are infinite because they are not destroyed.🔽They are boundless because they are immeasurable.

original: yang na rtag pa dang chad pa med pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rtag pa dang chad pa med pa'i phyir mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is infinite because it is neither eternal nor annihilated.

original: lus med pa'i phyir kun du mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: lus med pa'i phyir kun du mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: It is all-pervading because it is bodiless.

original: dbri ba dang bsnan pa med pa'i tshul can zhes bya ba ni yod pa la skur pa mi 'debs pa'i phyir dbri ba med pa'o //
analyzed: dbri ba dang bsnan pa med pa'i tshul can zhes bya ba ni yod pa la skur pa mi 'debs pa'i phyir dbri ba med pa'o //
translated: The phrase “it has the mode of not being diminished or augmented” means that it is not diminished because it does not deny existence.

original: med pa la sgro mi 'dogs pa'i phyir bsnan pa med pa'o //
analyzed: med pa la sgro mi 'dogs pa'i phyir bsnan pa med pa'o //
translated: It is not augmented because it does not falsely project nonexistence.
