original: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pa zhes bya ba ni gang nas kyang ma 'ongs pa'i phyir 'ong ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pa zhes bya ba ni gang nas kyang ma 'ongs pa'i phyir 'ong ba med pa'o //
translated: The phrase “it has no coming or going” means that it does not come from anywhere.

original: gang du yang mi 'gro ba'i phyir 'gro ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gang du yang mi 'gro ba'i phyir 'gro ba med pa'o //
translated: It does not go anywhere.

original: blang ba dang dor ba med pa'i tshul can zhes bya ba ni las kyi tshe ni blang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: blang ba dang dor ba med pa'i tshul can zhes bya ba ni las kyi tshe ni blang ba med pa'o //
translated: The phrase “it has the mode of not being grasped or rejected” means that it is not grasped at the time of action.

original: rnam par smin pa'i tshe ni dor ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i tshe ni dor ba med pa'o //
translated: It is not rejected at the time of its maturation.

original: phrad pa med pa dang 'bral ba med pa dang / 'dre ba med pa dang / mi 'dre ba med pa'i tshul can zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i tshe yang kun brtags pa de bzhin nyid dang lhan cig phrad pa med la /
analyzed: phrad pa med pa dang 'bral ba med pa dang / 'dre ba med pa dang / mi 'dre ba med pa'i tshul can zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i tshe yang kun brtags pa de bzhin nyid dang lhan cig phrad pa med la /
translated: The phrase “the mode of being that is neither in contact nor disjoined, neither mixed nor unmixed” means that even when conceptual thought is present, the imagined reality is not in contact with the reality of the perfected.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i tshe yang phyis 'bral ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i tshe yang phyis 'bral ba med pa'o //
translated: And even when conceptual thought is absent, it is not the case that they are later disjoined.

original: de bzhin du 'dre ba dang mi 'dre ba yang sbyar ro //🔽'dod chags brtsal bas dben pa'i rang bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dre ba dang mi 'dre ba yang sbyar ro // 'dod chags brtsal bas dben pa'i rang bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa'i phyir /
translated: The same is true of the phrases “neither mixed nor unmixed.”

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa brtsal ba med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa brtsal ba med pa ste /
translated: The phrase “the nature of being devoid of the search for desire” means that desire, etc., are not sought because they are devoid of any intrinsic nature.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rtags rnams dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa spyod pa'i rtags rnams dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu rnams dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dmigs pa rnams dang / 'dod chags dang 'dod chags med pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni sems las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rtags rnams dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa spyod pa'i rtags rnams dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu rnams dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dmigs pa rnams dang / 'dod chags dang 'dod chags med pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni sems las byung ba yin te /
translated: The signs of attachment and so on, the signs of engaging in attachment and so on, the causes of attachment and so on, the objects of attachment and so on, and the phenomena of attachment and nonattachment and so on are mental factors.

original: de'i phyir go cha de ni gzugs dang 'brel pa ma yin te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir go cha de ni gzugs dang 'brel pa ma yin te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, this armor is not related to form.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams shin tu med pa'i phyir chos de rnams mtshan mar @217b bzung ste go cha 'dis bgos pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams shin tu med pa'i phyir chos de rnams mtshan mar @217b bzung ste go cha 'dis bgos pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Because phenomena such as form do not exist at all, one does not don this armor by apprehending those phenomena as signs.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i go cha yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i go cha yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that it is the armor of signlessness.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sa mtshams bcad de sems can gyi don du go cha btsal ba ma lags so zhes bya ba ni sems can 'di snyed cig mya ngan las 'da'o zhes bya bar yongs su nges pa'i mtshams bcad pa gang🔽yang med do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sa mtshams bcad de sems can gyi don du go cha btsal ba ma lags so zhes bya ba ni sems can 'di snyed cig mya ngan las 'da'o zhes bya bar yongs su nges pa'i mtshams bcad pa gang yang med do //
translated: This means that there is no boundary that is determined, thinking I will liberate this many beings.

original: sus kyang bsgom par mi bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni byed pa po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sus kyang bsgom par mi bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni byed pa po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No one should cultivate it means that there is no agent.

original: gang du bsgom par mi bgyi zhes bya ba ni chos gang las bsgom par bya ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du bsgom par mi bgyi zhes bya ba ni chos gang las bsgom par bya ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nowhere should it be cultivated means that one does not see any dharma from which it should be cultivated.

original: ji ltar yang bsgom par mi bgyi zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i yid la byed pa yang ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar yang bsgom par mi bgyi zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i yid la byed pa yang ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In no way should it be cultivated means that one does not see any mental activity of cultivation.

original: de ni bsgom pa rnam par 'jig pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa med par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni bsgom pa rnam par 'jig pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa med par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is the destruction of cultivation means that it is made to be without cultivation.

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis /
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis /
translated: Subhuti, the irreversible Bodhisattva, the great being, should be known by this perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di phyir mi ldog pa yin nam /
analyzed: 'di phyir mi ldog pa yin nam /
translated: Is he irreversible or not?

original: 'on te ma yin zhes phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po brtag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhes phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po brtag par bya ba'o //
translated: Thus the irreversible Bodhisattva, the great being, should be known.

original: de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mngon par zhen pa med dam zhes bya ba ni brtags pa'i mtshan ma ston te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mngon par zhen pa med dam zhes bya ba ni brtags pa'i mtshan ma ston te /
translated: After that, the sign of the investigation is shown: Subhuti, the Bodhisattva, the great being, should be known by this perfection of wisdom whether he is really irreversible or not.

original: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la zhes bya ba nas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bshad pa na de la mngon par zhen pa mi skyed cing mi gnas na byang chub sems dpa' ni phyir mi ldog pa yin no zhes yongs su brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la zhes bya ba nas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du bshad pa na de la mngon par zhen pa mi skyed cing mi gnas na byang chub sems dpa' ni phyir mi ldog pa yin no zhes yongs su brtag par bya'o //
translated: “If bodhisattvas, when this perfection of wisdom is being taught, do not settle down on, and do not conceive of, anything up to the perfection of giving, up to the emptinesses, up to the special Buddhadharmas, and up to the knowledge of all modes, then one should know that those bodhisattvas are irreversible.

original: la la rang bzhin gyis gzhan gyis smras pa la snying por 'du shes mi skyed do //
analyzed: la la rang bzhin gyis gzhan gyis smras pa la snying por 'du shes mi skyed do //
translated: Some, by their very nature, do not conceive of what others say as being essential.

original: la la dad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la la dad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Some do not believe it.

original: la la de la chags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la la de la chags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Some do not get attached to it.

original: zhe sdang bar mi 'gyur gyi btang snyoms su gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang bar mi 'gyur gyi btang snyoms su gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Some do not get angry, but remain equanimous.

original: la la rang bzhin gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ma bral ba yin no//
analyzed: la la rang bzhin gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ma bral ba yin no//
translated: Some, by their very nature, are not without the six perfections.

original: @218a * // la la chos zab mo thos na skrag pa la sogs par mi 'gyur gyi gong nas gong du mngon par dga' zhing nyan par 'gyur ba dang 'dzin pa dang / 'chang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: @218a * // la la chos zab mo thos na skrag pa la sogs par mi 'gyur gyi gong nas gong du mngon par dga' zhing nyan par 'gyur ba dang 'dzin pa dang / 'chang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Some, when they hear the profound Dharma, are not frightened, etc. , but listen, take it up, and hold it with ever-increasing joy.

original: yon tan de rnams dang ldan na phyir mi ldog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan de rnams dang ldan na phyir mi ldog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If they have these qualities, they should be known as irreversible.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di rnam par brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na lhag mthong gis rnam par brtag pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di rnam par brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na lhag mthong gis rnam par brtag pa'o //
translated: This profound perfection of wisdom should be investigated. This is the investigation by means of insight at the time of realization.

original: stong pa nyid la gzhol ba dang / stong pa nyid la 'bab pa dang / stong pa nyid la bab pas zhes bya ba ni chung ngu dang 'bring po dang chen po'i dbang gis tshig gsum mo //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la gzhol ba dang / stong pa nyid la 'bab pa dang / stong pa nyid la bab pas zhes bya ba ni chung ngu dang 'bring po dang chen po'i dbang gis tshig gsum mo //
translated: It is inclined to emptiness, tends to emptiness, and is bent on emptiness. These three phrases are due to the small, medium, and great.

original: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa la sogs pa'i chos nyid kyis mngon par rtogs par byas nas rnam par brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa la sogs pa'i chos nyid kyis mngon par rtogs par byas nas rnam par brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Having realized the nature of phenomena such as emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, non-arising, non-cessation, non-affliction, and non-purification, one should investigate. This is the meaning.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
translated: When this was said, the elder Subhuti

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar stong pa nyid la gzhol ba'i bsam pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la rtog par 'gyur ba de bzhin du gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyang de ltar brtag par bgyi'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar stong pa nyid la gzhol ba'i bsam pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la rtog par 'gyur ba de bzhin du gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyang de ltar brtag par bgyi'am /
translated: asked, Bhagavan, should phenomena such as form, feeling, and perception be investigated in the same way as this profound perfection of wisdom, with the intention of being oriented towards emptiness?

original: 'on te mi bgyi zhes zhus pa /
analyzed: 'on te mi bgyi zhes zhus pa /
translated: Or should they not be investigated?

original: bcom ldan 'das ci gzugs la rtog pa lags sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci gzugs la rtog pa lags sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Bhagavan, is form investigated? and so on.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Then the Bhagavan

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gzugs la rtog pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di ston te mngon par rtogs pa'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams med pa'i phyir snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gzugs la rtog pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di ston te mngon par rtogs pa'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams med pa'i phyir snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This is taught by “Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not conceptualize form” and so on. At the time of manifest realization, the phenomena of form and so on do not appear because they do not exist.

original: de bas na gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis mthar thug pa rnams kyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni med kyi /
analyzed: de bas na gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis mthar thug pa rnams kyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa ni med kyi /
translated: Therefore, the phenomena of form, feeling, and so on, and the culmination of the knowledge of all aspects are not manifest realizations.

original: de dag gi de bzhin nyid mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi de bzhin nyid mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: However, the suchness of those phenomena is a manifest realization.

original: de bzhin nyid de yang tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de yang tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: That suchness is not different.

original: gzugs la sogs pa chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang / @218b rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang gcig go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid dang / @218b rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang gcig go //
translated: The suchness of all phenomena, such as form, and the knowledge of all aspects are one.

original: de bas na de bzhin nyid gcig pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la brtag pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin nyid gcig pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la brtag pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, because of the sameness of thusness, it is the same as the non-examination of phenomena such as form.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni sus kyang ma byas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni sus kyang ma byas /
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is not made by anyone,

original: 'gyur bar ma byas /
analyzed: 'gyur bar ma byas /
translated: it does not become,

original: gang nas kyang ma 'ongs /
analyzed: gang nas kyang ma 'ongs /
translated: it does not come from anywhere,🔽it does not go anywhere.

original: gang du yang ma song zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di ston te /
analyzed: gang du yang ma song zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di ston te /
translated: This is shown by such statements as these.

original: gal te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bya ba dang 'gyur ba'i chos sam /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bya ba dang 'gyur ba'i chos sam /
translated: If the knowledge of all aspects were a phenomenon of action and becoming,

original: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba dang / gnas pa dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba dang / gnas pa dang ldan pa'am /
translated: or were endowed with coming and going, staying and possessing,

original: nyi tshe pa'am /
analyzed: nyi tshe pa'am /
translated: or were partial,

original: grangs la sogs pa dang ldan na ni /
analyzed: grangs la sogs pa dang ldan na ni /
translated: or were endowed with enumeration and so on,

original: kun brtags pa'i rnam par 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i rnam par 'gyur te /
translated: it would be an imaginary transformation.

original: 'o na ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams su mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur ba zhig na gang gi phyir de'i rnam pa dang bral te /
analyzed: 'o na ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams su mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur ba zhig na gang gi phyir de'i rnam pa dang bral te /
translated: But if it were to be fully awakened to as phenomena such as form, then because it is free from those aspects,

original: nam mkha'i chos can yin pa de'i phyir de gzugs la sogs par mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so//
analyzed: nam mkha'i chos can yin pa de'i phyir de gzugs la sogs par mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so//
translated: Because it is a phenomenon of space, it cannot be fully awakened into form and so on.

original: lha rnams kyis chos zab mo de lta bu thos nas /
analyzed: lha rnams kyis chos zab mo de lta bu thos nas /
translated: The gods, having heard such a profound Dharma,

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab po zhes bya ba la sogs pas mngon par bsngags nas de bzhin nyid de nyid don tha dad pa med par smras so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab po zhes bya ba la sogs pas mngon par bsngags nas de bzhin nyid de nyid don tha dad pa med par smras so //
translated: praise it with The profound perfection of wisdom of the Blessed One... and so on, and say that suchness itself is without different meanings.

original: gang la gnyis kun du rgyu ba med pa de ni chos rnams kyi zab pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang la gnyis kun du rgyu ba med pa de ni chos rnams kyi zab pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid yin la /
translated: That in which duality does not move at all is the profundity of phenomena means that all phenomena have suchness as their nature.

original: de bzhin nyid kyang gcig pa'i phyir gcig rgyu bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang gcig pa'i phyir gcig rgyu bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Since suchness is one, only one moves,

original: gnyis su rgyu bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis su rgyu bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: not two.

original: nam mkha' zab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: nam mkha' zab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sngar bstan pa nyid do //
translated: Because space is profound... and so on has been explained before.

original: chos 'di ni gzugs gzung ba'i slad du bstan pa ma lags /
analyzed: chos 'di ni gzugs gzung ba'i slad du bstan pa ma lags /
translated: This Dharma is not taught for the sake of grasping form...

original: mi gzung ba'i slad du yang ma lags zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi gzung ba'i slad du yang ma lags zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Not for the sake of not apprehending means

original: 'di gzugs so zhes mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni gzung pa'o //
analyzed: 'di gzugs so zhes mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni gzung pa'o //
translated: apprehending as this is form is apprehending.

original: gzugs med do zhes rnam pa thams cad du skur pa 'debs pa ni mi gzung ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs med do zhes rnam pa thams cad du skur pa 'debs pa ni mi gzung ba'o //
translated: Denigrating as form does not exist in every way is not apprehending.

original: gzugs la thogs pa ma mchis so zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos thams cad dang rjes su mthun pa nyid rnam par byed de gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' med pa'i phyir thogs pa med pa 'di🔽ltar kun brtags pa'i gzugs ni yod pa ma yin pas sgro @219a * //
analyzed: gzugs la thogs pa ma mchis so zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos thams cad dang rjes su mthun pa nyid rnam par byed de gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' med pa'i phyir thogs pa med pa 'di ltar kun brtags pa'i gzugs ni yod pa ma yin pas sgro @219a * //
translated: By form is unobstructed, and so on, it distinguishes the compatibility with all phenomena. Because there is no extreme of superimposition or denial regarding all phenomena such as form, it is unobstructed.

original: 'dogs pa'i mtha' med do //
analyzed: 'dogs pa'i mtha' med do //
translated: Thus, imputed form does not exist, so there is no extreme of superimposition.

original: chos nyid kyi gzugs ni yod pa'i phyir skur pa 'debs pa med de /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi gzugs ni yod pa'i phyir skur pa 'debs pa med de /
translated: The form of reality exists, so there is no extreme of denial.

original: de bas na gzugs dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is compatible with form.

original: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to all.

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni ma 'ongs ma song ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni ma 'ongs ma song ba ste /
translated: The suchness of form is not come and not gone.🔽In the same way, Subhūti, suchness is not come and not gone.

original: de bzhin du rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang ma 'ongs ma song zhes bya ba la sogs pas de de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang ma 'ongs ma song zhes bya ba la sogs pas de de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid du ston te /
translated: In this way, it is shown that the suchness of the Tathāgata and the suchness of Subhūti are the same.

original: rjes su skyes pa yin par bsgrub pa'i phyir ma 'ongs ma song zhes bya smos te /
analyzed: rjes su skyes pa yin par bsgrub pa'i phyir ma 'ongs ma song zhes bya smos te /
translated: In order to establish that they are born from that, it is said, “not come and not gone.”

original: gang nas kyang ma 'ongs /
analyzed: gang nas kyang ma 'ongs /
translated: It does not come from anywhere,

original: gang du yang ma song ba'o //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyang de'o //
analyzed: gang du yang ma song ba'o // de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyang de'o //
translated: and it does not go anywhere.🔽The suchness of the Tathāgata is also the suchness of all phenomena.🔽The suchness of all phenomena is also the suchness of Subhūti.

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni rab 'byor de bzhin nyid kyang de'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa'i phyir gcig go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni rab 'byor de bzhin nyid kyang de'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid gcig pa'i phyir gcig go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is because suchness is one. This is the meaning of “one.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gnas pa zhes bya ba ni chos gnas pa'i mtshan nyid du yang gcig go zhes ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gnas pa zhes bya ba ni chos gnas pa'i mtshan nyid du yang gcig go zhes ston to //
translated: The phrase “the thusness of the tathāgatas is called ‘abiding’” indicates that it is a single characteristic of the abiding of entities.

original: 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med cing rnam par rtog pa med ces bya ba la /
translated: The phrase “it is unchanging and nonconceptual” indicates

original: 'gyur ba med ces bya ba 'dis ni mi 'gyur ba'i yongs su grub pas yongs su grub par ston to //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med ces bya ba 'dis ni mi 'gyur ba'i yongs su grub pas yongs su grub par ston to //
translated: that it is unchanging because of its unchanging perfection.

original: rnam par rtog pa med ces bya ba 'dis ni phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pas yongs su grub par ston to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med ces bya ba 'dis ni phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pas yongs su grub par ston to //
translated: The phrase “it is nonconceptual” indicates that it is a perfection because of its undistorted perfection.

original: ci la 'ang thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la khyab pa ste /
analyzed: ci la 'ang thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la khyab pa ste /
translated: The phrase “it is unimpeded with regard to anything” indicates that it pervades all entities.

original: gang na yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang na yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist anywhere.

original: de bas na gang gi de bzhin nyid du ma gyur pa yang med de zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na gang gi de bzhin nyid du ma gyur pa yang med de zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the text states, “there is nothing that is not its thusness.”

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyang yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyang yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the thusness of all entities.

original: nam yang de bzhin nyid du ma gyur pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du yang de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: nam yang de bzhin nyid du ma gyur pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du yang de bzhin nyid do //
translated: It is never not thusness means that it is thusness at all times.

original: gnyis su med ces bya ba ni ngo bo nyid gcig pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med ces bya ba ni ngo bo nyid gcig pa'o //
translated: Nondual means having a single essence.

original: de gnyis su byar med ces bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis su dbyer mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis su byar med ces bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis su dbyer mi nus pa'o //
translated: It is not made dual means that it cannot be divided into two aspects.

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid tha mi dad pa dbyer med pa gnyis su med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyang tha mi dad par dbyer med pa dmigs @219b su med pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid tha mi dad pa dbyer med pa gnyis su med pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyang tha mi dad par dbyer med pa dmigs @219b su med pa'o //
translated: Just as the thusness of the Tathāgata is undifferentiated, indivisible, and nondual, so too the thusness of all phenomena is undifferentiated, indivisible, and nonapprehended.🔽Similarly, the thusness of the elder Subhūti is undifferentiated, indivisible, and nonapprehended.

original: de bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang tha mi dad pa dbyer med pa dmigs su med pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid bzhin du chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang tha mi dad pa dbyer med pa dmigs su med pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid bzhin du chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid
translated: This means that just as the thusness of the Tathāgata is undifferentiated, indivisible, and nonapprehended, so too the thusness of all phenomena is undifferentiated, indivisible, and nonapprehended.

original: kyis tha mi dad do //
analyzed: kyis tha mi dad do //
translated: It is undifferentiated by nature.

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis tha mi dad do zhes ston te /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis tha mi dad do zhes ston te /
translated: Just as the suchness of all phenomena is undifferentiated by its very nature of being unobservable, the suchness of the elder Subhūti is also undifferentiated.

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gnyis su med pa'i phyir tha mi dad pa dang gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir dbyer med pa dang / dmigs su med pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis dmigs su med de gcig pa dang / ji ltar chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyang tha mi dad dbyer med pa dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa de bzhin du rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis tha mi dad de /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gnyis su med pa'i phyir tha mi dad pa dang gnyis su byar med pa'i phyir dbyer med pa dang / dmigs su med pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis dmigs su med de gcig pa dang / ji ltar chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyang tha mi dad dbyer med pa dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa de bzhin du rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis tha mi dad de /
translated: Just as the suchness of the Tathāgata is undifferentiated because it is nondual, is inseparable because it is not made into two, and is unobservable by its very nature because it is unobservable, and just as the suchness of all phenomena is undifferentiated, inseparable, and unobservable by its very nature, the suchness of Subhūti is also undifferentiated by its very nature of being unobservable.

original: dbyer med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbyer med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what it means to be inseparable.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid las gud na yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid las gud na yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The suchness of the tathāgatas is not separate from the suchness of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid las gud na yod pa ma yin pa de ni nam yang de bzhin nyid ma yin pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid las gud na yod pa ma yin pa de ni nam yang de bzhin nyid ma yin pa ma yin zhing /
translated: That which is not separate from the suchness of all phenomena is never not suchness.

original: de ni rtag tu de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de ni rtag tu de bzhin nyid do //
translated: It is always suchness.

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang de lta bu ste /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang de lta bu ste /
translated: The suchness of the elder Subhūti is also like that.🔽Therefore, since it is not a different aspect, although it is born after the Tathāgata, it is not born anywhere.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa gzhan ma yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes kyang gang du yang rjes su skyes pa med do zhes bya bas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid du chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa gzhan ma yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes kyang gang du yang rjes su skyes pa med do zhes bya bas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid du chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo
translated: This shows that the suchness of all phenomena is not observed as separate from the suchness of the Tathāgata.

original: nyid kyis tha mi dad do //
analyzed: nyid kyis tha mi dad do //
translated: It is not different because of its nature of non-apprehension.

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis tha mi dad do zhes ston te /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis tha mi dad do zhes ston te /
translated: Just as the reality of all phenomena is, so the reality of the elder Subhūti is undifferentiated by way of the nature of being unapprehendable.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid las gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid las gzhan ma yin la /
translated: The reality of the Tathāgata is not other than the reality of all phenomena.

original: gang chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid las gzhan pa ma yin pa de yang nam yang de bzhin nyid ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid las gzhan pa ma yin pa de yang nam yang de bzhin nyid ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: And that which is not other than the reality of all phenomena is never not reality,

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ni dus thams cad du yod pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bzhin gshegs @220a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ni dus thams cad du yod pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin gshegs @220a * //
translated: because the reality of all phenomena exists at all times.

original: pa'i de bzhin nyid de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pa'i de bzhin nyid de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The reality of the Tathāgata is not other than that,

original: dus thams cad du yod do //
analyzed: dus thams cad du yod do //
translated: and therefore it exists at all times.

original: de bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid las gzhan pa ma yin pa'i phyir dus thams cad du yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid las gzhan pa ma yin pa'i phyir dus thams cad du yod do //
translated: In the same way, the reality of the elder Subhūti exists at all times, because it is not other than the reality of all phenomena.

original: de bas na dus thams cad du yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na dus thams cad du yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it exists at all times,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su skyes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su skyes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: it is said to be “born after the suchness of the Tathāgata.”

original: skye ba'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir gang du yang rjes su skyes pa med pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i mtshan nyid med pa'i phyir gang du yang rjes su skyes pa med pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: Because it has no characteristic of birth, it is also said to be “not born anywhere.”

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid 'das pa ma yin ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid 'das pa ma yin ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
translated: As it is said, “The suchness of the Tathāgata is not past, not future,🔽and not present.”

original: da ltar byung ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dis ston te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dis ston te /
translated: This is taught by the above and other such statements.

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis dus gsum du gtogs kyang de bzhin nyid ni dus kyis bsdus pa ma yin pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid du dus gsum du gtogs kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis dus gsum du gtogs kyang de bzhin nyid ni dus kyis bsdus pa ma yin pa de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid du dus gsum du gtogs kyang /
translated: Just as the Tathāgata, although included in the three times in terms of his imagined nature, his suchness is not subsumed by time, in the same way, although all phenomena are included in the three times in terms of their imagined nature,

original: de dag gis de bzhin nyid ni dus kyis bsdus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis de bzhin nyid ni dus kyis bsdus pa ma yin no //
translated: their suchness is not subsumed by time.

original: de bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang dus kyis bsdus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi de bzhin nyid kyang dus kyis bsdus pa ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, the suchness of the elder Subhūti is not subsumed by time.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su skyes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be born after the Tathāgata.

original: lha'i bu dag 'di la 'das pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi mnyam pa nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag 'di la 'das pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi mnyam pa nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid du rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad ston te /
translated: “Divine princes, here, the suchness of the Tathāgata should be known as the suchness of sameness of the past. ” And so on. This is taught as follows.

original: 'di ltar 'das pa'i chos thams cad kyi 'das pa'i de bzhin nyid ngo bo nyid gcig pa'i phyir mnyam pas de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang mnyam mo //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'das pa'i chos thams cad kyi 'das pa'i de bzhin nyid ngo bo nyid gcig pa'i phyir mnyam pas de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang mnyam mo //
translated: Thus, because the suchness of the past of all past phenomena is the same in being a single essence, therefore all tathāgatas are the same.

original: de dag kyang de bzhin nyid de dang bdag bzhin nyid gcig pa'i phyir mnyam mo /
analyzed: de dag kyang de bzhin nyid de dang bdag bzhin nyid gcig pa'i phyir mnyam mo /
translated: And they are the same because the suchness of the Tathāgata and their suchness are the same.

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid mnyam pa de nyid kyi phyir 'das pa'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid kyang mnyam mo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid mnyam pa de nyid kyi phyir 'das pa'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid kyang mnyam mo //
translated: Because the suchness of all Tathāgatas is the same, therefore the suchness of past dharmas is also the same.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the suchness of the Tathāgata and the suchness of all dharmas are one.

original: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyang mnyam pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid mnyam pa nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin nyid kyang mnyam pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The suchness of the Tathāgata should be known as the same as the sameness of the suchness of all dharmas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin @220b nyid mnyam pa nyid kyis 'das pa'i chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de bzhin @220b nyid mnyam pa nyid kyis 'das pa'i chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: All past dharmas should be known as the same as the sameness of the suchness of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the others.

original: gzugs kyi chos mnyam pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid de nyid rgya cher ston to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi chos mnyam pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid de nyid rgya cher ston to //
translated: The sameness of the form dharma and so on extensively teaches just that suchness of all dharmas.

original: lha'i bu dag de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa'i de bzhin nyid 'di la brten nas de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i mtshan thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba de ni yang dag pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi🔽tshig bla dags so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa'i de bzhin nyid 'di la brten nas de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i mtshan thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba de ni yang dag pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi tshig bla dags so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhuti, the Tathagata is a designation for the reality of reality.🔽Shaken in six ways means shaking, trembling, quaking, trembling strongly, trembling greatly, and trembling intensely.

original: rnam pa drug tu g-yos zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba dang / 'gul ba dang / ldeg pa dang / chem chem pa dang / 'ur 'ur dang / 'khrugs zhes bya ba rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: rnam pa drug tu g-yos zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba dang / 'gul ba dang / ldeg pa dang / chem chem pa dang / 'ur 'ur dang / 'khrugs zhes bya ba rnam pa drug ste /
translated: These are the six ways.

original: de ngag las chung ngu dang 'bring po dang chen po'i dbang gis re re la yang rnam pa gsum du phye na /
analyzed: de ngag las chung ngu dang 'bring po dang chen po'i dbang gis re re la yang rnam pa gsum du phye na /
translated: From these, each is divided into three by the power of small, medium, and great.

original: mtshan ltas chen po rnam pa bco brgyad dang / phyogs drug rnams su mtho ba dang / dma' ba'i dbang gis phyogs su gyur pa rnam pa bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: mtshan ltas chen po rnam pa bco brgyad dang / phyogs drug rnams su mtho ba dang / dma' ba'i dbang gis phyogs su gyur pa rnam pa bcu gnyis te /
translated: There are eighteen great signs, and twelve directions by the power of rising and falling in the six directions.

original: de dag kyang gleng gzhi'i le'u nyid du bshad zin to //
analyzed: de dag kyang gleng gzhi'i le'u nyid du bshad zin to //
translated: These are explained in the nidana chapter.

original: de la g-yos pa la sogs pa 'di dag kyang rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis 'byung ste lha mthu chen po rnams dam pa'i chos thos nas dga' zhing mgu ba skyes pa'i mthus phan tshun yongs su bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang mnyam mo //
analyzed: de la g-yos pa la sogs pa 'di dag kyang rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis 'byung ste lha mthu chen po rnams dam pa'i chos thos nas dga' zhing mgu ba skyes pa'i mthus phan tshun yongs su bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang mnyam mo //
translated: These quakings and so on occur by two causes: the great gods, having heard the holy Dharma, are filled with joy and delight, and by the power of that, they quake.

original: de dangs pa'i 'jig rten gyis kyang chos kyi che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bshad pa'i chos nyid kyis dbang du gyur pa nyid du ston pa lta bur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de dangs pa'i 'jig rten gyis kyang chos kyi che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bshad pa'i chos nyid kyis dbang du gyur pa nyid du ston pa lta bur gyur pa'o //
translated: The pure worlds also show the greatness of the Dharma, as if to say, “The Dharma is the same as that taught by all the Tathagatas of the past.”

original: de la phyogs gcig par rab tu ldeg pa ni g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: de la phyogs gcig par rab tu ldeg pa ni g-yo ba'o //
translated: Shaking is a trembling in one direction.

original: shing ljon pa bzhin bdag nyid thams cad 'gul ba ni 'gul ba'o //
analyzed: shing ljon pa bzhin bdag nyid thams cad 'gul ba ni 'gul ba'o //
translated: Quaking is a trembling in all directions, like a tree.

original: me mgal skor ba bzhin du 'khor ba ni ldeg pa'o //
analyzed: me mgal skor ba bzhin du 'khor ba ni ldeg pa'o //
translated: Rocking is a circular movement, like a firebrand.

original: sgra skad ring du 'byung ba'i sgra ni chem chem mo //
analyzed: sgra skad ring du 'byung ba'i sgra ni chem chem mo //
translated: Rumbling is a sound that arises from within.

original: rnam par 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'khrug pa'o //
translated: It is agitated.

original: sgra ber ber po ni 'ur 'ur ro //
analyzed: sgra ber ber po ni 'ur 'ur ro //
translated: The sound is a loud sound.

original: yang na sa ni g-yos so //
analyzed: yang na sa ni g-yos so //
translated: Or else, the earth trembles.

original: shing thams cad ni 'gul lo //
analyzed: shing thams cad ni 'gul lo //
translated: All the trees shake.

original: ri thams cad ni ldeg go //
analyzed: ri thams cad ni ldeg go //
translated: All the mountains quake.

original: lha'i rnga bo che la sogs pa ni chem chem mo //
analyzed: lha'i rnga bo che la sogs pa ni chem chem mo //
translated: The great drums of the gods sound.

original: rgya mtsho la sogs pa ni 'khrugs so //
analyzed: rgya mtsho la sogs pa ni 'khrugs so //
translated: The oceans are agitated.

original: @221a * // 'brug rnams ni 'ur 'ur ro //
analyzed: @221a * // 'brug rnams ni 'ur 'ur ro //
translated: The clouds rumble.

original: de dag kyang dang po rtsom pa'i tshe ni dal zhing mi drag par snang ngo //
analyzed: de dag kyang dang po rtsom pa'i tshe ni dal zhing mi drag par snang ngo //
translated: Moreover, at the beginning of the cosmic age, the sound is slow and weak.

original: de'i 'og tu ni de bas drag go //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni de bas drag go //
translated: Later, it is stronger.

original: tha mar de bas kyang rab tu drag ste /
analyzed: tha mar de bas kyang rab tu drag ste /
translated: Finally, it is very strong.

original: rnam pa gsum du phyo bas bco brgyad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum du phyo bas bco brgyad du 'gyur te /
translated: Since the sound is threefold, the trembling is eighteenfold.

original: phyogs rnams kyang cig car mtho ba la sogs par gyur na mugs shing rnam par zhigs pa bzhin du rab tu 'khrugs par 'gyur ba'i phyir mthar gyis mtho ba dang dma' bar gyur to //
analyzed: phyogs rnams kyang cig car mtho ba la sogs par gyur na mugs shing rnam par zhigs pa bzhin du rab tu 'khrugs par 'gyur ba'i phyir mthar gyis mtho ba dang dma' bar gyur to //
translated: When the directions rise and fall all at once, the earth is agitated, as if it were breaking up.

original: de la gang gi tshe shar phyogs kyi sa dang / shing dang ri la sogs pa rab tu 'khrugs par gyur pa de'i tshe shar phyogs mtho ba 'dra bar snang ngo //
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe shar phyogs kyi sa dang / shing dang ri la sogs pa rab tu 'khrugs par gyur pa de'i tshe shar phyogs mtho ba 'dra bar snang ngo //
translated: When the earth, trees, mountains, etc., in the eastern direction are disturbed, then the east appears to be elevated.

original: gang gi tshe shar phyogs mtho bar snang ba de'i tshe nub phyogs rang bzhin du gnas kyang dma' ba 'dra bar snang ba de'i tshe shar phyogs mtho na nub phyogs dma' zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe shar phyogs mtho bar snang ba de'i tshe nub phyogs rang bzhin du gnas kyang dma' ba 'dra bar snang ba de'i tshe shar phyogs mtho na nub phyogs dma' zhes bya'o //
translated: When the east appears to be elevated, then the west, even though it remains as it is, appears to be depressed. At that time, it is said that the east is elevated and the west is depressed.

original: gang gi tshe nub phyogs kyi sa dang shing dang ri la sogs pa rab tu 'khrugs par gyur pa de'i tshe nub phyogs mtho ba 'dra bar snang zhing shar phyogs rang bzhin du gnas kyang dma' ba 'dra bar snang ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nub phyogs kyi sa dang shing dang ri la sogs pa rab tu 'khrugs par gyur pa de'i tshe nub phyogs mtho ba 'dra bar snang zhing shar phyogs rang bzhin du gnas kyang dma' ba 'dra bar snang ngo //
translated: When the earth, trees, mountains, etc., in the western direction are disturbed, then the west appears to be elevated and the east, even though it remains as it is, appears to be depressed.

original: de bzhin du thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to all.

original: gzugs kyi rjes su ma skyes /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rjes su ma skyes /
translated: It does not arise in the form of an object.

original: gzugs las gzhan gyi rjes su ma skyes so zhes bya ba ni gzugs skye bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po med pas gnas brtan yang dngos po med pa'i phyir gzugs kyi rjes su skye ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs las gzhan gyi rjes su ma skyes so zhes bya ba ni gzugs skye bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po med pas gnas brtan yang dngos po med pa'i phyir gzugs kyi rjes su skye ba'am /
translated: “It does not arise after anything other than form” means that since the reality of the arising of form does not exist, the elder also does not exist. Therefore, it is not logical that he arises after form,

original: gzugs las gzhan pa gang du yang skye bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: gzugs las gzhan pa gang du yang skye bar mi rigs so //
translated: or that he arises anywhere other than form.

original: de bzhin nyid kyang skye ba dang 'brel pa med pas de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su skye ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang skye ba dang 'brel pa med pas de bzhin nyid kyi rjes su skye ba'am /
translated: Since reality is also not related to arising, it is not logical that he arises after reality,

original: de bzhin nyid las gzhan pa gang du yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid las gzhan pa gang du yang mi rigs so //
translated: or that he arises anywhere other than reality.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid dang ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid zab po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dngos po ni de bzhin nyid do //🔽ma nor ba'i dngos po ni ma nor ba'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid dang ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid zab po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i dngos po ni de bzhin nyid do // ma nor ba'i dngos po ni ma nor ba'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: “The reality of the Tathāgata, the unmistaken reality, and the unaltered reality are profound” and so on means that the reality of the Tathāgata is reality.🔽The unmistaken reality is the unmistaken reality.

original: gzhan ma yin pa'i dngos po ni gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa'i dngos po ni gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The unaltered reality is the unaltered reality.

original: chos rnams kyi brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su grub pa don dam pa'i dbyings gang yin pa de ni dus thams cad du de bzhin nyid du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su grub pa don dam pa'i dbyings gang yin pa de ni dus thams cad du de bzhin nyid du 'gyur zhing /
translated: That which is the perfected nature, the inexpressible characteristic of all phenomena, the ultimate realm, is suchness at all times,

original: nor bar mi 'gyur gzhan du mi 'gyur @221b ba'i phyir de bzhin nyid dang ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: nor bar mi 'gyur gzhan du mi 'gyur @221b ba'i phyir de bzhin nyid dang ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
translated: because it is not mistaken, and does not change into something else. Therefore, it is called suchness, unmistaken suchness, and unchanging suchness.

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The perfected characteristic is threefold:

original: mi 'jig par yongs su grub pa dang / phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa dang / mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jig par yongs su grub pa dang / phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa dang / mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: perfected as indestructible, perfected as unmistaken, and perfected as unchanging.

original: de la mi 'jig par yongs su grub pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid do //🔽phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa'i phyir ma nor ba de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de la mi 'jig par yongs su grub pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid do // phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa'i phyir ma nor ba de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Among them, it is suchness because it is perfected as indestructible.🔽It is unmistaken suchness because it is perfected as unmistaken.

original: mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa'i phyir gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: mi 'gyur bar yongs su grub pa'i phyir gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid do //
translated: It is unchanging suchness because it is perfected as unchanging.

original: chos nyid dang chos kyi dbyings dang chos gnas pa nyid ces bya ba tshig gsum gyis mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum bstan te /
analyzed: chos nyid dang chos kyi dbyings dang chos gnas pa nyid ces bya ba tshig gsum gyis mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum bstan te /
translated: The three terms reality, reality realm, and reality abidingness teach three kinds of reality.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / 'byung gnas kyi mtshan nyid dang / gnas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / 'byung gnas kyi mtshan nyid dang / gnas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: They are the reality of phenomena, the reality of the source, and the reality of abiding.

original: chos kyi dngos po ni chos nyid de kun brtags pa dang / rnam par brtags pa'i chos thams cad las gzhan du gyur pa na de dang mi 'dra ba brjod du med pa chos kyi dngos por gnas pa gang yin pa de gnas pa'i phyir chos nyid kyi sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: chos kyi dngos po ni chos nyid de kun brtags pa dang / rnam par brtags pa'i chos thams cad las gzhan du gyur pa na de dang mi 'dra ba brjod du med pa chos kyi dngos por gnas pa gang yin pa de gnas pa'i phyir chos nyid kyi sgrar brjod do //
translated: The reality of phenomena is the reality of all phenomena, which is different from all imagined and discriminatively constructed phenomena. It is the inexpressible reality of phenomena, which is called reality because it is the abiding nature of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba ni 'byung gnas kyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba ni 'byung gnas kyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa ste /
translated: The reality realm is taught as the reality of the source.

original: chos ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: chos ni stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / ma 'dres pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams so //
translated: Phenomena are the qualities of the Buddha, such as the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, and the unique qualities.

original: dbyings kyi sgra ni rgyu'i don te sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi 'byung gnas yin pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ste chos kyi sku bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbyings kyi sgra ni rgyu'i don te sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi 'byung gnas yin pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ste chos kyi sku bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term “element” means “cause,” because it is the source of the qualities of a buddha. It is called the “element of the Dharma” because it is a synonym for the “Dharma body.”

original: chos gnas pa nyid ces bya ba ni gnas pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: chos gnas pa nyid ces bya ba ni gnas pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa ste /
translated: The “nature of the establishment of the Dharma” is the characteristic of establishment.🔽As it is said, “Whether the tathāgatas appear or not, this nature of things and this establishment of the Dharma remain.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung chos nyid dang / chos gnas pa nyid 'di ni 'dug pa nyid do zhes ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu ste don dam pa brjod du med pas yongs su grub pa'i chos ni sngon dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs dang phyis dri ma med pa'i gnas skabs na yang dus🔽thams cad du yod pa ni chos gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung chos nyid dang / chos gnas pa nyid 'di ni 'dug pa nyid do zhes ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu ste don dam pa brjod du med pas yongs su grub pa'i chos ni sngon dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs dang phyis dri ma med pa'i gnas skabs na yang dus🔽thams cad du yod pa ni chos gnas pa nyid do //
translated: The “nature of the establishment of the Dharma” is the ultimate truth, which is inexpressible. The perfected nature, which is the Dharma, exists in all times, whether it is in the state of being previously contaminated or subsequently uncontaminated.

original: chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings zhes bya ba tshig gsum gyis nges pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs te /
analyzed: chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings zhes bya ba tshig gsum gyis nges pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs te /
translated: The three phrases “the faultless nature of phenomena,” “the perfect limit,” and “the inconceivable expanse” teach the defining characteristics of certainty.🔽The faultless nature of phenomena

original: de la chos skyon med pa nyid ces @222a * //
analyzed: de la chos skyon med pa nyid ces @222a * //
translated: The first is the dharmakāya, which is free from flaws.🔽

original: bya ba la chos ni 'dir log pa'i chos las bzlog pa /
analyzed: bya ba la chos ni 'dir log pa'i chos las bzlog pa /
translated: Here, phenomena are the opposite of false phenomena,

original: yang dag pa nyid kyi chos te de dag la nges pa nyid dang / gcig tu chad pa nyid ni skyon med pa nyid des rab tu dga' ba'i ye shes kyis dang po nyid du de bzhin nyid rab tu rtogs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid kyi chos te de dag la nges pa nyid dang / gcig tu chad pa nyid ni skyon med pa nyid des rab tu dga' ba'i ye shes kyis dang po nyid du de bzhin nyid rab tu rtogs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no
translated: the true nature of phenomena. Certainty and singleness of purpose with respect to those is the faultless nature. By means of the joy of that, one first realizes suchness and thus one is certain to attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, but not otherwise.

original: // de bas na pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas byed pa yang dag pa nyid kyi chos rnams kyi nges pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir chos skyon med pa nyid ces bya ste 'di skad du yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la zhugs pa yin🔽no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: // de bas na pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas byed pa yang dag pa nyid kyi chos rnams kyi nges pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir chos skyon med pa nyid ces bya ste 'di skad du yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la zhugs pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the perfection, etc., are the cause of the true dharmas that make a Buddha, and so are called the faultlessness of dharmas, because it is said, “One enters into the faultlessness of the true .

original: yang na skyon zhes bya ba ni chos la sred pa ste /
analyzed: yang na skyon zhes bya ba ni chos la sred pa ste /
translated: Or else, a “fault” is craving for dharmas,

original: skyon gyi dngos po med pa ni skyon med pa nyid do zhes sngar ji skad du bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: skyon gyi dngos po med pa ni skyon med pa nyid do zhes sngar ji skad du bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: and the absence of the thing called a fault is faultlessness, as previously explained.

original: chos rnams la skyon med pa nyid ni chos skyon med pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos rnams la skyon med pa nyid ni chos skyon med pa nyid de /
translated: The faultlessness of dharmas is the faultlessness of dharmas.

original: chos gang rab tu rtogs pas skyon gyi chos rnams rgyun bcad pa de la chos skyon med pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos gang rab tu rtogs pas skyon gyi chos rnams rgyun bcad pa de la chos skyon med pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The faultlessness of dharmas is the cutting off of the stream of dharmas that are faults, by the realization of any dharma.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa de kho na nyid kyi don gyi mtha' ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa de kho na nyid kyi don gyi mtha' ste /
translated: The “limit of reality” is the limit of the meaning of that reality which is true suchness.

original: mthar phyin pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha' shin tu nges pa de kho na nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mthar phyin pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha' shin tu nges pa de kho na nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: And because it is the culmination, it is the ultimate reality, which is to say, the extremely certain limit of reality.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings zhes bya ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings zhes bya ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The inconceivable realm is the inconceivable nature.

original: 'jig rten pa'i rtog pa thams cad kyi rjes su dpag pa'i spyod yul ma yin pas shin tu nges pa so so rang gis rig pa don dam pa la bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings shes bya'o //🔽yang na ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnams kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rtog pa thams cad kyi rjes su dpag pa'i spyod yul ma yin pas shin tu nges pa so so rang gis rig pa don dam pa la bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings shes bya'o // yang na ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnams kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is the ultimate reality, which is to be known as the inconceivable realm, because it is extremely certain and is to be personally experienced, and because it is not the domain of the postulations of any mundane thought.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings te /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings te /
translated: Or else, it is the inconceivable realm because it is the cause of the inconceivable, marvelous, and wonderful dharmas.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos kyi sku'i dbang gis cho 'phrul ngo mtshar rnams 'jig rten du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos kyi sku'i dbang gis cho 'phrul ngo mtshar rnams 'jig rten du 'byung ba'o //
translated: The marvelous and wonderful miracles occur in the world by the power of the Dharma Body of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: de la gzugs mi dmigs gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams med pa'i phyir mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de la gzugs mi dmigs gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams med pa'i phyir mi dmigs so //
translated: The phrase form is not apprehended, the reality of form is not apprehended means that form and so on are not apprehended because they do not exist.

original: de bzhin nyid ni dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa mnyam pa nyid du gyur ba'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa mnyam pa nyid du gyur ba'i gnas skabs na /
translated: The reality of form is not apprehended because it is the state of equality of the apprehended object and the apprehending subject.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po med pas mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po med pas mi dmigs so //
translated: It is not apprehended because it is devoid of the nature of the grasped and the grasper.

original: yang @222b na dri ma dang bcas pa dang dri ma med pa'i gnas skabs nyid la gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrar brjod pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang @222b na dri ma dang bcas pa dang dri ma med pa'i gnas skabs nyid la gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrar brjod pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Or else, it is so called because it is expressed by the term the reality of form in the very state of being with or without stain.

original: de'i 'og tu chos mngon par rtogs pa ni brda phrad sla bas ma bkrol lo //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu chos mngon par rtogs pa ni brda phrad sla bas ma bkrol lo //
translated: The realization of the Dharma is not explained here because it is easy to understand.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yongs su nyams pa'i chos can drug cu ni nye bar len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' de dag yongs su nyams pa'i chos can yin zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yongs su nyams pa'i chos can drug cu ni nye bar len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' de dag yongs su nyams pa'i chos can yin zhe na /
translated: The sixty bodhisattvas who have the quality of backsliding are said to have “freed their minds from the defilements without remainder.” Why are those bodhisattvas said to have the quality of backsliding?

original: 'di ltar de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs mkhas pa dang bral bas pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa spyad pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs mkhas pa dang bral bas pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa spyad pas /
translated: Because they practice the six perfections with reference to the six perfections, lacking the perfection of wisdom and skill in means.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' de dag skyon med par ma zhugs shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bsgrub par ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' de dag skyon med par ma zhugs shing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bsgrub par ma byas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, those bodhisattvas have not entered into the flawlessness of the path, and have not accomplished unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de dag gis sngon stong pa nyid dang mtshan med pa dang smon pa med pa'i bsgom pa des rnam par grol ba'i sgo thob par gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gis sngon stong pa nyid dang mtshan med pa dang smon pa med pa'i bsgom pa des rnam par grol ba'i sgo thob par gyur te /
translated: But they have previously attained the door of liberation through the cultivation of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: de'i phyir de dag gis yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byas nas dgra bcom pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gis yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byas nas dgra bcom pa thob par gyur to //
translated: Therefore, they actualized the very limit of reality and attained the state of an arhat.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa sgom pa de nyid thabs mkhas pa dang bral ba rnams ni nyan thos su 'gyur gyi ma bral ba rnams ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba 'di ci'i phyir zhes zhus pa dang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa sgom pa de nyid thabs mkhas pa dang bral ba rnams ni nyan thos su 'gyur gyi ma bral ba rnams ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba 'di ci'i phyir zhes zhus pa dang /
translated: The Lord has taught that the very meditation on emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness becomes the śrāvaka vehicle for those who are devoid of skillful means, but for those who are not devoid of skillful means, it becomes the attainment of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bya'i dpe bstan to //
analyzed: bya'i dpe bstan to //
translated: The Lord has taught the example of the bird.

original: thabs mkhas pa bstan pa yang brda phrad sla'o //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa bstan pa yang brda phrad sla'o //
translated: The teaching on skillful means is easy to understand.

original: de nas gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus /
translated: Then the elder Śāriputra said,🔽“Blessed One, according to my understanding of the meaning of what the Blessed One has said,

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don 'tshal ba ltar na zhes gsungs pa ni rigs kyi bye brag gis shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don 'tshal ba ltar na zhes gsungs pa ni rigs kyi bye brag gis shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pa 'byung ste /
translated: wisdom and skillful means arise from the distinctions of lineage.

original: de las mi dmigs pa'i blo skye zhing /
analyzed: de las mi dmigs pa'i blo skye zhing /
translated: From that, the mind of non-apprehension arises.

original: des de dag thams cad grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: des de dag thams cad grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: He teaches that all of those are accomplished.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste zhes bya ba ni sa dang po nye bar bzung ste zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste zhes bya ba ni sa dang po nye bar bzung ste zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Beginning from the generation of the first thought of awakening means beginning from the first stage.

original: lha'i bu dag ngas kyang chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te ngas ni gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'am /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag ngas kyang chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te ngas ni gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'am /
translated: O sons of gods, I have also fully awakened to all phenomena in all aspects. I do not apprehend any phenomenon that fully awakens,

original: gang gis mngon @223a * //
analyzed: gang gis mngon @223a * //
translated: by which one fully awakens,

original: par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'am /
analyzed: par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'am /
translated: or to which one fully awakens.

original: gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i chos gang ma dmigs so zhes bya ba ni ngas kun rdzob kyi shes pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus pas ni chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du shes kyi don dam pa'i ye
analyzed: gang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i chos gang ma dmigs so zhes bya ba ni ngas kun rdzob kyi shes pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus pas ni chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du shes kyi don dam pa'i ye
translated: This means that I know all phenomena in all aspects through conventional knowledge subsumed by the wisdom of omniscience. I do not apprehend any phenomenon ultimately through ultimate knowledge.

original: shes kyis rab tu rnam par phye na rmi lam na mthong ba'i don bzhin du shes par byed pa'am /
analyzed: shes kyis rab tu rnam par phye na rmi lam na mthong ba'i don bzhin du shes par byed pa'am /
translated: When it is thoroughly analyzed by wisdom, it is understood to be like an object seen in a dream.

original: shes rab bya ba'i chos gang yang ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes rab bya ba'i chos gang yang ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or, it is understood that no phenomenon whatsoever called “wisdom” is seen.

original: lha'i bu dag chos thams cad shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dir dngos po med pa nyid la rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste shin tu med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag chos thams cad shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dir dngos po med pa nyid la rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste shin tu med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Divine princes, it is because all phenomena are utterly pure.” Here, non-entityness is called “utter purity,” and utter non-existence is what is meant.

original: bcom ldan 'das bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bgyi ba ni mi dka'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bgyi ba ni mi dka'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Blessed One, it is not difficult to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.”

original: chos thams cad med pa'i phyir te dngos po med pa la dngos po med par rtogs par bya ba ni mi dka'i /
analyzed: chos thams cad med pa'i phyir te dngos po med pa la dngos po med par rtogs par bya ba ni mi dka'i /
translated: Because all phenomena do not exist. It is not difficult to realize that non-entities are non-entities.

original: yod pa'i chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid rtogs par bya ba ni dka'o //
analyzed: yod pa'i chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid rtogs par bya ba ni dka'o //
translated: But it is difficult to realize the characteristics of existent phenomena just as they are.

original: med pa la dngos po med pa tsam du shes shing sgrub pa ni mi dka' ste /
analyzed: med pa la dngos po med pa tsam du shes shing sgrub pa ni mi dka' ste /
translated: It is not difficult to know and to establish that non-existence is just the absence of an existent thing.

original: 'di ltar chos rnams yod pa la ni dkar po'i chos 'phel bar bya ba dang / nag po'i chos spang bar bya ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa bsgrub dgos par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos rnams yod pa la ni dkar po'i chos 'phel bar bya ba dang / nag po'i chos spang bar bya ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa bsgrub dgos par 'gyur na /
translated: Thus, if things existed, it would be necessary to practice the perfections and so on in order to increase good qualities and to abandon bad qualities.

original: gang gi phyir chos 'di rnams med pa de'i phyir sgrub pa yang mi dka'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos 'di rnams med pa de'i phyir sgrub pa yang mi dka'o //
translated: But because these phenomena do not exist, practice is not difficult.

original: de bas na mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi dka'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi dka'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that “complete buddhahood is not difficult.”

original: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dka' bar gsungs pa de'i dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dka' bar gsungs pa de'i dgongs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The Elder Śāriputra said that complete buddhahood is difficult. The intention behind that statement is as follows.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de nam mkha' lta bur dngos po med par rig nas /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de nam mkha' lta bur dngos po med par rig nas /
translated: After knowing that all phenomena are the nature of non-existence, like space, and are non-existent,

original: gal te mi smra bar 'dug pas chog na de ltar na ni dka' ba ma yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te mi smra bar 'dug pas chog na de ltar na ni dka' ba ma yin par 'gyur na /
translated: if it were sufficient to remain silent, then it would not be difficult.

original: 'di ltar yang dag par na chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa med par yang rig par byas la /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag par na chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa med par yang rig par byas la /
translated: Thus, one should know that in reality, all phenomena are not fully awakened.

original: de'i 'og tu pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa rnams la yang sbyor zhing /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa rnams la yang sbyor zhing /
translated: After that, one should also apply oneself to the practices of the perfections.

original: chos thams cad kyang mngon par rdzogs par @223b 'tshang rgya bar byed na de lta bu na ni dka'o zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang mngon par rdzogs par @223b 'tshang rgya bar byed na de lta bu na ni dka'o zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: If one fully awakens to all phenomena, then it is difficult.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad nam mkha' lta bur mos par mi byed kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di skad ston te //
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad nam mkha' lta bur mos par mi byed kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di skad ston te //
translated: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva does not contemplate all phenomena as being like space, and so on, it is taught:

original: gal te chos thams cad shin tu med pa'i phyir nam mkha' lta bur mos par ma byas kyang byang chub 'thob par 'gyur na ni de lta na sla ste dka' ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad shin tu med pa'i phyir nam mkha' lta bur mos par ma byas kyang byang chub 'thob par 'gyur na ni de lta na sla ste dka' ba ma yin no //
translated: If one could attain awakening even without contemplating all phenomena as being like space because they are utterly non-existent, then it would be easy, not difficult.

original: gal te de ltar gyur na 'jig rten na yang byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa dag dmigs pa'i 'du shes ma spangs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir ldog par yang mi 'gyur la nyan
analyzed: gal te de ltar gyur na 'jig rten na yang byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa dag dmigs pa'i 'du shes ma spangs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir ldog par yang mi 'gyur la nyan
translated: If that were so, then even in the world, bodhisattvas who practice the six perfections would not turn away from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening because they have not abandoned the discriminations of the apprehension of signs.🔽

original: thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar lhung bar yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar lhung bar yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If that were the case, then even in the world, those who practice the six perfections would not have given up the perception of real things, and so they would not turn away from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and they would not fall to the śrāvaka or pratyekabuddha levels.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar dmigs pa can du spyod pa rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar dmigs pa can du spyod pa rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med pas /
translated: But because those who practice with a perception of real things do not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: de'i phyir chos de dag nyid shin tu dngos po med par mthong bas chos de dag nyid mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba de dka'o zhes bstan pa'o /🔽// / bam po nyi shu gnyis pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos de dag nyid shin tu dngos po med par mthong bas chos de dag nyid mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba de dka'o zhes bstan pa'o /🔽// / bam po nyi shu gnyis pa /
translated: it is taught that it is difficult for them to fully awaken to those very dharmas by seeing those very dharmas as utterly unreal.

original: de skad smras pa dang / gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir ldog go zhes bya ba de ma gzod nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ji snyam du sems gzugs bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub
