analyzed: de skad smras pa dang / gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir ldog go zhes bya ba de ma gzod nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ji snyam du sems gzugs bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub
translated: Then the Lord said to the venerable Śāriputra, “What do you think, Śāriputra? Does form turn away from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?”

original: las ldog gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: las ldog gam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: 'dir yang rnam pa drug ston te /
analyzed: 'dir yang rnam pa drug ston te /
translated: Here also, six aspects are taught:

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams phyir ldog gam /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams phyir ldog gam /
translated: Do phenomena such as form turn away?

original: gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan pa'i chos 'ga' zhig phyir ldog gam /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa las gzhan pa'i chos 'ga' zhig phyir ldog gam /
translated: Or does some phenomenon other than form turn away?

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dri ma dang bcas pa'i chos 'ga' zhig phyir ldog gam /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid dri ma dang bcas pa'i chos 'ga' zhig phyir ldog gam /
translated: Or does the suchness of phenomena such as form, some phenomenon with stains, turn away?

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid las gzhan pa'i chos 'ga' zhig phyir ldog gam /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid las gzhan pa'i chos 'ga' zhig phyir ldog gam /
translated: Or does some phenomenon other than the suchness of form turn away?

original: de bzhin nyid shin tu rnam par dag pa dri ma med pa gang yin pa de phyir ldog gam /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid shin tu rnam par dag pa dri ma med pa gang yin pa de phyir ldog gam /
translated: Is it the utterly pure, stainless suchness that turns back?

original: de las gzhan pa'i chos 'ga' zhig phyir ldog grang na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i chos 'ga' zhig phyir ldog grang na /
translated: Or is it some other phenomenon that turns back?

original: de ltar chos rnams drug po de dag med @224a * //
analyzed: de ltar chos rnams drug po de dag med @224a * //
translated: If those six phenomena do not exist,

original: na gang phyir ldeg par 'gyur ba'i chos bden par gnas pa de gang zhig yod de /
analyzed: na gang phyir ldeg par 'gyur ba'i chos bden par gnas pa de gang zhig yod de /
translated: then what phenomenon that truly abides turns back?

original: de bas na don dam par phyir ldog par 'gyur ba gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //🔽gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis chos kyi tshul gyi rnam pa des bstan pa ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad smras te /
analyzed: de bas na don dam par phyir ldog par 'gyur ba gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o // gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis chos kyi tshul gyi rnam pa des bstan pa ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad smras te /
translated: Therefore, ultimately, there is nothing at all that turns back.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' phyir ldog pa med na /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' phyir ldog pa med na /
translated: The elder Subhūti, in accordance with the way of the Dharma that was taught, said, “Elder Śāriputra, if bodhisattvas do not turn back,

original: de lta na ni byang chub sems dpa' thams cad sangs rgyas su 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta na ni byang chub sems dpa' thams cad sangs rgyas su 'gyur gyi /
translated: then in that case all bodhisattvas will become buddhas.

original: phyir log nas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir log nas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not turn back and become śrāvakas or pratyekabuddhas.”

original: de ltar gyur na byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa gsum mo zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ba med do zhes de snyam du bsams pa dang / gnas brtan gang po'i tshig gis rab 'byor la yang dris pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa gsum mo zhes bya ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ba med do zhes de snyam du bsams pa dang / gnas brtan gang po'i tshig gis rab 'byor la yang dris pa dang /
translated: If that were the case, then the phrase “the three kinds of bodhisattvas” would not exist, and there would be no three kinds of bodhisattvas.

original: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba'i tshig de ma bzod nas /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba'i tshig de ma bzod nas /
translated: Then, the elder Subhūti, not being able to bear the words “three kinds of bodhisattvas,”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus khyod de bzhin nyid la byang chub sems dpa' gsum 'dod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus khyod de bzhin nyid la byang chub sems dpa' gsum 'dod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the elder Subhūti said, “Venerable Śāriputra, do you assert that the three kinds of bodhisattvas exist in suchness?”

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad dang 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad dang / rang byang chub dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas kyang de bzhin nyid kyi dbang gis gcig kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad dang 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad dang / rang byang chub dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas kyang de bzhin nyid kyi dbang gis gcig kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: All ordinary beings, all noble beings, solitary realizers, bodhisattvas, and buddhas are the same in suchness.

original: de dag la tha dad pa med do zhes sngar yang bshad zin to //
analyzed: de dag la tha dad pa med do zhes sngar yang bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that they are not different.

original: de ltar thams cad gcig tu zad pa la byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa gsum du 'dod na /
analyzed: de ltar thams cad gcig tu zad pa la byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa gsum du 'dod na /
translated: If, in this way, everything is exhausted in the one, and the bodhisattvas are held to be three,

original: de bzhin nyid rnam pa thams cad du tha dad pa med pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid rnam pa thams cad du tha dad pa med pa la /
translated: then, in suchness, which is not different in any way,

original: gcig gam gnyis sam gsum zhes tha dad du dbye ba ji ltar rigs par 'gyur zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gcig gam gnyis sam gsum zhes tha dad du dbye ba ji ltar rigs par 'gyur zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: how can it be right to make a difference, saying one, two, or three?🔽Then, in the passage where the Lord said to the elder Subhuti, “You should know that this bodhisattva will go forth to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,”

original: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor la bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'byung bar rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i skabs las nges par 'byung ba bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid shes par
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor la bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'byung bar rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i skabs las nges par 'byung ba bsgrub pa'i mtshan nyid shes par
translated: in order to show the defining characteristic of going forth,

original: 'dod pa'i 'khor rnams kyi don du /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'khor rnams kyi don du /
translated: for the sake of the retinue that desires the Dharma,

original: bcom ldan 'das bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'byung bar @224b 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpas ji ltar gnas par bgyi zhes zhus pa dang / de'i 'og tu bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pas gnas par bstan pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'byung bar @224b 'tshal ba'i byang chub sems dpas ji ltar gnas par bgyi zhes zhus pa dang / de'i 'og tu bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pas gnas par bstan pa /
translated: Then, the teaching on abiding with perfect thought and perfect application:

original: sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid du bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba nas nye du dang snag gi gnyen mtshams kyi sems kyis dmigs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid du bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba nas nye du dang snag gi gnyen mtshams kyi sems kyis dmigs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: One should generate the thought of sameness toward all sentient beings, up to one should focus with the thought of relatives and blood relations.

original: bdag gis kyang srog gcod pa spang bar bya zhes bya ba nas dam pa'i chos gnas pa mthun pas dga' bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa'o ;
analyzed: bdag gis kyang srog gcod pa spang bar bya zhes bya ba nas dam pa'i chos gnas pa mthun pas dga' bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa'o ;
translated: One should abandon taking life, up to one should delight in the harmony of the teaching of the true Dharma.

original: / de'i 'og tu sbyor ba'i 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: / de'i 'og tu sbyor ba'i 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Then, the two kinds of fruits of application:

original: sgrib pa med pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'o //
translated: It is without obscuration and without grasping.

original: sems can thams cad la mnyam pa'i sems bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la mnyam pa'i sems bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyi dbang gis so //
translated: One should arouse the thought of the sameness of all sentient beings. This is because of the reality of all dharmas.

original: gzugs sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sgrib par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs sgrib pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sgrib par mi rtog go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Form becomes unobstructed. This means that one does not conceive of form as an obstruction.

original: sngon gyi mtha' nas kyang gzugs yongs su ma gzung ngo zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi dus nas kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i sgrib par 'gyur ba yongs su mi gzung ngo //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' nas kyang gzugs yongs su ma gzung ngo zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi dus nas kyang gzugs la sogs pa'i sgrib par 'gyur ba yongs su mi gzung ngo //
translated: One does not grasp form from the prior limit. This means that from the prior time one does not grasp the obstruction of form, etc.

original: de ltar yongs su ma bzung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su ma bzung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: Thus, one does not grasp, etc.

original: ji ltar gzugs yongs su ma bzung ba zhes bya bar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba ni the tshom za ba rnams kyi phyir gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs yongs su ma bzung ba zhes bya bar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba ni the tshom za ba rnams kyi phyir gsungs so //
translated: How does form become ungrasped? This is stated for those who doubt.

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar gzugs yongs su gzung du med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad la yongs su 'dzin pa med pa nyid 'phel bar byed kyi yongs su 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar gzugs yongs su gzung du med pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad la yongs su 'dzin pa med pa nyid 'phel bar byed kyi yongs su 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, that form which is ungraspable is not form.” Thus, the bodhisattva increases the very ungraspability of all dharmas, but does not grasp.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su mi 'dzin pa de yang gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su mi 'dzin pa de yang gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
translated: And that ungraspability of the bodhisattva is not the intrinsic reality of form, etc.

original: de bas na yongs su 'dzin pa med pa spel na byang chub sems dpas gzugs la sogs pa yongs su ma bzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na yongs su 'dzin pa med pa spel na byang chub sems dpas gzugs la sogs pa yongs su ma bzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when ungraspability is increased, the bodhisattva does not grasp form, etc.

original: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis sngar don dam par phyir ldog pa yang med byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa gsum yang med do zhes smras pa'i phyir de ni skabs 'dir phyir mi ldog pa'i @225a * //
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis sngar don dam par phyir ldog pa yang med byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa gsum yang med do zhes smras pa'i phyir de ni skabs 'dir phyir mi ldog pa'i @225a * //
translated: Then, the elder Subhūti, in order to explain that ultimately there is no reversal, and that the three kinds of bodhisattvas do not exist, said:

original: rtags rnams zhus pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags rnam pa sum cu rtsa lngas bstan te /
analyzed: rtags rnams zhus pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags rnam pa sum cu rtsa lngas bstan te /
translated: Then, the signs of irreversibility of the Bhagavān are taught by thirty-five aspects.

original: de bzhin nyid la gnyis su med par mthong ba dang / thams cad las phyir ldog pa dang / ston pa gzhan la rim gro byed pa la sogs pa chos ngan pa med pa dang / mi khom par skye ba med pa dang / mi dge ba'i las kyi lam spangs pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la gnyis su med par mthong ba dang / thams cad las phyir ldog pa dang / ston pa gzhan la rim gro byed pa la sogs pa chos ngan pa med pa dang / mi khom par skye ba med pa dang / mi dge ba'i las kyi lam spangs pa dang /
translated: The absence of bad qualities such as seeing nonduality in suchness, turning away from everything, and serving other teachers, the absence of birth in unfavorable states, the abandonment of nonvirtuous paths of action,

original: dge ba'i las kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi don du pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi don du gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi chos kun chub par byed pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i las kyi lam yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi don du pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi don du gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis kyi chos kun chub par byed pa dang /
translated: the completion of virtuous paths of action, the completion of all perfections for the sake of all sentient beings, the mastery of all the dharmas of the twelve branches of scripture for the sake of all sentient beings,

original: chos zab mo la nem nur med pa dang / lus ngag dang / yid kyi las 'jam zhing byams par ldan pa dang / sgrib pa rnam pa lnga dang du mi len pa dang / bag la nyal ba rnam pa bdun med pa dang / dran pa dang shes bzhin du ldan pa'i spyod lam can dang /
analyzed: chos zab mo la nem nur med pa dang / lus ngag dang / yid kyi las 'jam zhing byams par ldan pa dang / sgrib pa rnam pa lnga dang du mi len pa dang / bag la nyal ba rnam pa bdun med pa dang / dran pa dang shes bzhin du ldan pa'i spyod lam can dang /
translated: They are not doubtful about the profound Dharma, their physical, verbal, and mental actions are gentle and loving, they do not indulge in the five obscurations, they are free of the seven latent tendencies, they are endowed with conduct that is mindful and vigilant,

original: gtsang sbrar spyod pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang / lus la srin bu'i rigs stong mi 'byung ba dang / lus dang ngag dang sems yongs su dag pa dang / 'dod pa chung la chog shes shing sbyangs pa'i yon tan la brten pa dang /
analyzed: gtsang sbrar spyod pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang / lus la srin bu'i rigs stong mi 'byung ba dang / lus dang ngag dang sems yongs su dag pa dang / 'dod pa chung la chog shes shing sbyangs pa'i yon tan la brten pa dang /
translated: they are endowed with pure conduct and so forth, they do not have the thousand types of worms in their bodies, their body, speech, and mind are completely pure, they have few desires, are content, and rely on the qualities of asceticism,

original: ser sna la sogs pa med pa dang / blo brtan zhing zab pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang / bdud la sogs pas mi 'phrogs pa dang / dring mi 'jog pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten pa dang /
analyzed: ser sna la sogs pa med pa dang / blo brtan zhing zab pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang / bdud la sogs pas mi 'phrogs pa dang / dring mi 'jog pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten pa dang /
translated: they are free of stinginess and so forth, they are endowed with a stable and profound mind and so forth, they are not swayed by demons and so forth, they are not fickle, they rely on the perfection of wisdom,

original: bdud kyi las rtogs pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa dang / phyir ldog pa dang phyir mi ldog pa dang / bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu la mi reg pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad lhur mi len pa dang /
analyzed: bdud kyi las rtogs pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa dang / phyir ldog pa dang phyir mi ldog pa dang / bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'bras bu la mi reg pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad lhur mi len pa dang /
translated: the activities of Mara, the attainment of the acceptance that phenomena are unborn, the turning back and not turning back, the non-touching of the results of concentration, meditative stabilization and meditative absorption, the non-taking of form and so forth as the most important of all phenomena,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sbyor ba rnam pa bzhi phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyin pa'i 'bras bu gzhan mi dga' bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa la mi re ba dang / rdo rje'i rigs lnga phyi bzhin 'brang ba la sogs pa'i dbang dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sbyor ba rnam pa bzhi phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyin pa'i 'bras bu gzhan mi dga' bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa la mi re ba dang / rdo rje'i rigs lnga phyi bzhin 'brang ba la sogs pa'i dbang dang /
translated: the perfection of the four kinds of perfect application to the perfections, the non-expectation of the results of generosity and so forth, such as the pleasure of others, and the empowerment of being followed by the five vajra families and so forth.

original: sngags dang bzo ngan pa la mi brten pa dang / gtam ngan pa'i sbyor ba las ldog cing yang dag pa'i las dang @225b bsam pa la 'jug pa dang / rang gi sa la the tshim med pa dang / chos yongs su bzung ba'i phyir srog kyang yongs su gtong ba dang /
analyzed: sngags dang bzo ngan pa la mi brten pa dang / gtam ngan pa'i sbyor ba las ldog cing yang dag pa'i las dang @225b bsam pa la 'jug pa dang / rang gi sa la the tshim med pa dang / chos yongs su bzung ba'i phyir srog kyang yongs su gtong ba dang /
translated: not relying on bad mantras and crafts, turning away from the performance of bad speech, engaging in right action and right thought, not being doubtful about one’s own stage, and giving up one’s life for the sake of upholding the Dharma.

original: chos bzung ba rnams chung mi gson pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos bzung ba rnams chung mi gson pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of upholding the Dharma, one does not abandon those who uphold it.

original: de la de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de dag ni re re dang gnyis ka ma yin par the tshom za ba gang yang med do zhes bya bas ni gang zag thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyi dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa gcig pa nyid du ston
analyzed: de la de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de dag ni re re dang gnyis ka ma yin par the tshom za ba gang yang med do zhes bya bas ni gang zag thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyi dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa gcig pa nyid du ston
translated: Here, it is said that there is no doubt that all of these are the suchness of each individual, and that there is no suchness of both. This teaches the sameness of the Tathāgata through the suchness of all persons.

original: te // ngo bo nyid dam gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: te // ngo bo nyid dam gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that whatever is an intrinsic reality or the intrinsic reality of both is not the intrinsic reality of suchness.

original: chos thams cad ni rnam pa med pa mtshan ma med pa rtags med pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la rnam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rnam pa med pa mtshan ma med pa rtags med pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la rnam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All phenomena are said to be without aspects, without signs, and without tokens, because suchness is without aspects.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad rnam pa ma mchis pa lags na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad rnam pa ma mchis pa lags na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad ston te /
translated: “Blessed One, if all phenomena are without aspects, etc.,” shows that:

original: gal te rnam pa med cing mtshan ma med na /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa med cing mtshan ma med na /
translated: if they are without aspects and without signs,

original: ji ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i rnam pa dang mtshan ma bshad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i rnam pa dang mtshan ma bshad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: how can the aspects and signs of the irreversible be explained?

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gzugs las phyir ldog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam pa med par shes pa nyid rtags yin ni zhes ston te /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gzugs las phyir ldog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam pa med par shes pa nyid rtags yin ni zhes ston te /
translated: “Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being who turns away from form, etc.,” shows that the knowledge of the absence of aspects is a token.

original: gzugs kyi rnam pa dang / gzugs kyi rtags las phyir ldog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam pa dang / gzugs kyi rtags las phyir ldog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “Turning away from the aspects of form and the signs of form” is called “turning away from form.”

original: shes par bya ba shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes par bya ba shes pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes shes pa'o //
translated: “The known is knowledge” means that knowledge is the known.

original: blta bar bya ba mthong ba'o zhes bya ba ni lta ba mthong ba'o //
analyzed: blta bar bya ba mthong ba'o zhes bya ba ni lta ba mthong ba'o //
translated: Seeing is the seeing of the seen.

original: ngo mtshar dang bkra shis kyis dag par mi 'dzin zhes bya ba la bkra shis dang ngo mtshar gyi bkra shis ni bsams pa tsam gyis byas pa ste /
analyzed: ngo mtshar dang bkra shis kyis dag par mi 'dzin zhes bya ba la bkra shis dang ngo mtshar gyi bkra shis ni bsams pa tsam gyis byas pa ste /
translated: He does not hold that the auspicious and the marvelous are pure. The auspicious and the marvelous are auspicious because they are accomplished merely by wishing.

original: khrus dang smyung bar ; dug pa dang mngon par 'jug pa dang mu stegs dang / mchod sbyin la sogs pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khrus dang smyung bar ; dug pa dang mngon par 'jug pa dang mu stegs dang / mchod sbyin la sogs pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He does not hold that they are pure because of bathing, fasting, purification, initiation, heteropraxy, sacrifice, etc.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan ma thams cad ni brda phrad sla'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan ma thams cad ni brda phrad sla'o //
translated: All the signs of irreversibility are easily understood.

original: sa dang po thob pa nyid kyis phyir mi ldog par 'gyur mod kyi 'on kyang sa brgyad pa la phyir ldog par 'gyur ba gnyis pa yang bstan to //
analyzed: sa dang po thob pa nyid kyis phyir mi ldog par 'gyur mod kyi 'on kyang sa brgyad pa la phyir ldog par 'gyur ba gnyis pa yang bstan to //
translated: Although one becomes irreversible merely by attaining the first stage, still, the second kind of irreversibility is taught with regard to the eighth stage.

original: phyir ldog pa dang phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya ba la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las phyir ldog pas phyir ldog pa'o //
analyzed: phyir ldog pa dang phyir mi ldog pa zhes bya ba la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las phyir ldog pas phyir ldog pa'o //
translated: As for irreversibility and reversibility, one is reversible because one can turn back from the stages of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa las phyir mi ldog pas phyir mi ldog pa zhes @226a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa las phyir mi ldog pas phyir mi ldog pa zhes @226a * //
translated: It is called “irreversible” because it does not turn back from the stage of the Buddhas.

original: bya'o ; / de ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i yon tan rnams thos nas phyir mi ldog par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis zab cing zab pa'i gnas rnams zhus pa /
analyzed: bya'o ; / de ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i yon tan rnams thos nas phyir mi ldog par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi don du gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis zab cing zab pa'i gnas rnams zhus pa /
translated: Thus, in order to hear about the qualities of irreversibility and to attain irreversibility, the elder Subhūti asked about the very profound topics.

original: bcom ldan 'das gnas zab mo rnams legs par bstan du gsol zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gnas zab mo rnams legs par bstan du gsol zhes bya'o ;
translated: “ Blessed One, please teach well the profound topics.

original: /'di man chad ni gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis zhu ba nyis brgya bdun cu rtsa bdun gyis zab mo'i gnas zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang lan glan pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: /'di man chad ni gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis zhu ba nyis brgya bdun cu rtsa bdun gyis zab mo'i gnas zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang lan glan pa 'byung ste /
translated: ” From here on, the elder Subhūti asks about the profound topics with two hundred and seventy-seven questions, and the Blessed One also answers them.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das gnas zab mo zab mo rnams legs par bstan du gsol zhes bya ba ni zhus pa dang po'o //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das gnas zab mo zab mo rnams legs par bstan du gsol zhes bya ba ni zhus pa dang po'o //
translated: Among them, “Blessed One, please teach well the profound topics” is the first question.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags de mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshig bla dags su bas kyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags de mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshig bla dags su bas kyi /
translated: “ Blessed One, is that a designation for nirvāṇa?

original: chos thams cad kyi tshig bla dags ma lags sam zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi tshig bla dags ma lags sam zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: Is it not the highest expression of all dharmas? This is the second.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ni ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ni ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is from Bhagavan, what is the tathatā of form? and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags mngon par 'du bgyid pa thams cad ni kun brtags pa'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags mngon par 'du bgyid pa thams cad ni kun brtags pa'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is from Bhagavan, if the Bhagavan has said that all conditioned things are imagined, and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das grangs ma mchis pa dang dpag tu ma mchis pa dang tshad ma mchis pa la bye brag ni ci zhig mchis zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das grangs ma mchis pa dang dpag tu ma mchis pa dang tshad ma mchis pa la bye brag ni ci zhig mchis zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth is from Bhagavan, what is the difference between incalculable, immeasurable, and limitless?

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam grangs gang gis gzugs kyang grangs ma mchis par 'gyur ba de lta bu mchis sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam grangs gang gis gzugs kyang grangs ma mchis par 'gyur ba de lta bu mchis sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth is from Bhagavan, is there a way in which form also becomes incalculable? and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags gzugs 'ba' zhig stong du bas kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags gzugs 'ba' zhig stong du bas kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh is from Bhagavan, is it only form that is empty? and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das brjod du ma mchis pa'i don la 'phel ba dang yongs su 'grib pa ma mchis sam zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das brjod du ma mchis pa'i don la 'phel ba dang yongs su 'grib pa ma mchis sam zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: This is the eighth.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te brjod du ma mchis pa'i don la 'phel ba dang yongs su 'grib pa ma mchis na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dgu pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te brjod du ma mchis pa'i don la 'phel ba dang yongs su 'grib pa ma mchis na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dgu pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, if in the meaning of the inexpressible there is no increase or decrease, and so on, this is the ninth.🔽Blessed One, what is unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening like?

original: bcom ldan 'das bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba ni bcu pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba ni bcu pa'o //
translated: This is the tenth.🔽Blessed One, what is the suchness of all phenomena like?

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta bu zhig ces bya ba ni bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta bu zhig ces bya ba ni bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: This is the eleventh.🔽Blessed One, is it by the first production of the thought?

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags @226b sems dang po bskyed pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bcu gnyis pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das bcu po gang dag yongs su rdzogs par bgyis nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags @226b sems dang po bskyed pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bcu gnyis pa'o // bcom ldan 'das bcu po gang dag yongs su rdzogs par bgyis nas /
translated: And so on, this is the twelfth.🔽Blessed One, having completed which ten does one become a bodhisattva great being?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bcu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bcu gsum pa'o //
translated: And so on, this is the thirteenth.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams kyi don du ting nge 'dzin gsum la snyoms par 'jug cing zhes bya ba ni bcu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can rnams kyi don du ting nge 'dzin gsum la snyoms par 'jug cing zhes bya ba ni bcu bzhi pa'o //
translated: “Blessed One, how do Bodhisattva-Mahāsattvas, for the sake of sentient beings, enter into the three samādhis?” This is the fourteenth.

original: ji ltar na pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bgyid cing zhes bya ba ni bco lnga pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bgyid cing zhes bya ba ni bco lnga pa'o //
translated: “How do they perfect the six perfections?” This is the fifteenth.

original: ji ltar stong pa nyid la yongs su 'dris par bgyi zhes bya ba ni bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar stong pa nyid la yongs su 'dris par bgyi zhes bya ba ni bcu drug pa'o //
translated: “How should they familiarize themselves with emptiness?” This is the sixteenth.

original: ji ltar na stong pa nyid la gnas la stong pa nyid mngon sum du yang mi bgyid pa lags zhes bya ba ni bcu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na stong pa nyid la gnas la stong pa nyid mngon sum du yang mi bgyid pa lags zhes bya ba ni bcu bdun pa'o //
translated: “How do they abide in emptiness without actualizing emptiness?” This is the seventeenth.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba ni bco brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba ni bco brgyad pa'o //
translated: “Blessed One, what are the defining characteristics of the perfection of wisdom?” This is the eighteenth.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad kyang chos thams cad kyis dben pa la zhes bya ba ni bcu dgu pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad kyang chos thams cad kyis dben pa la zhes bya ba ni bcu dgu pa'o //
translated: “Blessed One, if all phenomena are devoid of all phenomena, and so forth, up to…” This is the nineteenth.

original: bcom ldan 'das yid la bgyi ba de dag thams cad kyang rang bzhin dang bral ba ste zhes bya ba ni nyi shu pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yid la bgyi ba de dag thams cad kyang rang bzhin dang bral ba ste zhes bya ba ni nyi shu pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, all these mental activities are devoid of intrinsic nature. This is the twentieth.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin gyis dben zhing zhes bya ba ni nyi shu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin gyis dben zhing zhes bya ba ni nyi shu gcig pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, if the perfection of wisdom is isolated by its intrinsic nature, this is the twenty-first.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stong pa nyid dang gsog nyid dang gsob nyid ces bya ba ni nyi shu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stong pa nyid dang gsog nyid dang gsob nyid ces bya ba ni nyi shu gnyis pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, the emptiness, hollowness, and futility of the perfection of wisdom, this is the twenty-second.

original: skabs 'dir bar skabs su zhus pa bcu'o //
analyzed: skabs 'dir bar skabs su zhus pa bcu'o //
translated: In this section, there are ten interjections.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags chos thams cad skye ba'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni nyi shu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags chos thams cad skye ba'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni nyi shu gsum pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, is it because all phenomena arise that the bodhisattva mahāsattva is predicted to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening? This is the twenty-third.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid gang lags zhes bya ba ni nyi shu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mnyam pa nyid gang lags zhes bya ba ni nyi shu bzhi pa'o //
translated: “Blessed One, what is the sameness of the bodhisattvas?”

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags gzugs bas par bgyi ba'i slad du slob na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du slob pa lags sam zhes bya ba ni nyi shu lnga pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags gzugs bas par bgyi ba'i slad du slob na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du slob pa lags sam zhes bya ba ni nyi shu lnga pa'o //
translated: “Blessed One, if one trains in order to empty out form, does one train in the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa lags na zhes bya ba ni nyi shu drug @227a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa lags na zhes bya ba ni nyi shu drug @227a * //
translated: “Blessed One, if all phenomena are pure by nature,

original: pa'o ; / bcom ldan 'das ci nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa yang des thob par bgyi'am zhes bya ba ni nyi shu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; / bcom ldan 'das ci nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa yang des thob par bgyi'am zhes bya ba ni nyi shu bdun pa'o //
translated: “Blessed One, does one also attain the perfection of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas through that?”

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na sgyu ma lta bu'i sems bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba lags zhes bya ba ni nyi shu brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na sgyu ma lta bu'i sems bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba lags zhes bya ba ni nyi shu brgyad pa'o //
translated: “Blessed One, how does an illusory mind fully awaken to unsurpassed, complete enlightenment?”

original: ji ltar na dben pas dben pa rjes su rtogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nyi shu dgu pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na dben pas dben pa rjes su rtogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nyi shu dgu pa'o //
translated: How does emptiness realize emptiness?

original: bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po slar ldog pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po slar ldog pa'am /
translated: “Blessed One, those Blessed Buddhas proclaim the names of those Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas who are irreversible

original: slar mi ldog pa gang dag gi ming yongs su brjod cing dga' ba'i tshul gyis chos ston par mdzad ces bya ba ni sum cu pa'o //
analyzed: slar mi ldog pa gang dag gi ming yongs su brjod cing dga' ba'i tshul gyis chos ston par mdzad ces bya ba ni sum cu pa'o //
translated: and teach the Dharma with a joyful manner.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid du gnas nas de bzhin nyid du nan tan bgyis te zhes bya ba ni sum cu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin nyid du gnas nas de bzhin nyid du nan tan bgyis te zhes bya ba ni sum cu gcig pa'o //
translated: “Blessed One, having abided in suchness and practiced in suchness,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa zhes bgyi ba zhes bya ba ni sum cu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa zhes bgyi ba zhes bya ba ni sum cu gnyis pa'o //
translated: “Blessed One, what is called a Tathagata’s emanation?

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar mngon par bsgrub par bgyi zhes bya ba ni sum cu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ji ltar mngon par bsgrub par bgyi zhes bya ba ni sum cu gsum pa'o //
translated: “Blessed One, how should one accomplish the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni sum cu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni sum cu bzhi pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, how is it that the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom is called the perfection of giving?

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni sum cu lnga pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni sum cu lnga pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, how does the bodhisattva mahāsattva, abiding in the perfection of giving, have the perfection of morality?

original: ji ltar na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni sum cu drug pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni sum cu drug pa'o //
translated: How, abiding in the perfection of giving, does he have the perfection of patience?

original: ji ltar na brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni sum cu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni sum cu bdun pa'o //

original: ji ltar na bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni sum cu brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni sum cu brgyad pa'o //
translated: How does he have the perfection of concentration?🔽 How does he have the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni sum cu dgu pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni sum cu dgu pa'o //
translated: How is it that it is called the perfection of wisdom?

analyzed: ji ltar na tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu pa'o //
translated: How is it that, abiding in the perfection of morality, it is called the perfection of giving?

analyzed: ji ltar na bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu @227b gcig pa'o //

analyzed: ji ltar na brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu gnyis pa'o //

analyzed: ji ltar na bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu gsum pa'o //
translated: How is it that it is called the perfection of concentration?

analyzed: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu bzhi pa'o //
translated: How is it that it is called the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar na bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu lnga pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu lnga pa'o //
translated: How is it that, abiding in the perfection of patience, it is called the perfection of giving?

original: ji ltar na tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu drug pa'o //
translated: How is it that it is called the perfection of morality?

original: ji ltar na brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu bdun pa'o //
translated: How is it that it is called the perfection of effort?

original: ji ltar na bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu brgyad pa'o //
translated: How is it that it is called the perfection of meditation?

original: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu dgu pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu dgu pa'o //
translated: How is it that it is called the perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pa lags zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos rnams kyi chos kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pa lags zhes bya ba ni gsum pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, how do Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas realize the characteristic of dharmas?

original: bcom ldan 'das sprul pas lam bsgom pa ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sprul pas lam bsgom pa ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: “Blessed One, how does an emanation cultivate the path?” This is the fourth.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos rnams rtogs pa lags zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dngos po ma mchis pa'i chos rnams rtogs pa lags zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
translated: “Blessed One, how do bodhisattva great beings understand non-existent phenomena?” This is the fifth.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags gzugs thams cad ces bya ba ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags gzugs thams cad ces bya ba ni drug pa'o //
translated: “Blessed One, is it that all forms are illusory?” This is the sixth.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur 'tshal zhing zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bur 'tshal zhing zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'o //
translated: “Blessed One, if bodhisattva great beings know that all phenomena are like illusions, ” This is the seventh.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu zhes bya ba ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: “Blessed One, if all phenomena are like dreams, ” This is the eighth.

original: bcom ldan 'das ming ni gang lags mtshan ma ni gang lags zhes bya ba ni dgu pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ming ni gang lags mtshan ma ni gang lags zhes bya ba ni dgu pa'o //
translated: “Blessed One, what is a name? What is a sign?” This is the ninth.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos 'di dag thams cad du de tsam du bas te zhes bya ba ni bcu pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos 'di dag thams cad du de tsam du bas te zhes bya ba ni bcu pa'o //
translated: “Blessed One, if all these phenomena are just as you have explained, ” This is the tenth.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad mtshan ma ma mchis shing dran pa ma mchis te zhes bya ba ni bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad mtshan ma ma mchis shing dran pa ma mchis te zhes bya ba ni bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, if all phenomena are signless and without recollection, this is the eleventh.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa gang gi tshul du ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ni bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa gang gi tshul du ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ni bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, in what way and how is one called a bodhisattva great being? This is the twelfth.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe phan tshun tha dad pa'i chos de dag de ltar 'tshal na zhes bya ba ni bcu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe phan tshun tha dad pa'i chos de dag de ltar 'tshal na zhes bya ba ni bcu gsum pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, if a bodhisattva great being, when practicing the perfection of wisdom, knows those phenomena that are mutually distinct in that way, this is the thirteenth.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems @233b dpa' chen po chos kyi dbyings la slob pas zhes bya ba ni bcu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems @233b dpa' chen po chos kyi dbyings la slob pas zhes bya ba ni bcu bzhi pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, a bodhisattva great being who trains in the dharma-constituent, this is the fourteenth.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings lags na zhes bya ba ni bco lnga pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad chos kyi dbyings lags na zhes bya ba ni bco lnga pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, if all phenomena are the dharma-constituent, this is the fifteenth.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te sems can shin tu dmigs su ma mchis la zhes bya ba ni bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te sems can shin tu dmigs su ma mchis la zhes bya ba ni bcu drug pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, if sentient beings are not apprehended at all, this is the sixteenth.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan ma lags sems can gyi mtha' yang gzhan ma lags na zhes bya ba ni bcu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te yang dag pa'i mtha' yang gzhan ma lags sems can gyi mtha' yang gzhan ma lags na zhes bya ba ni bcu bdun pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, if the limit of reality is not one thing and the limit of sentient beings is not another, this is the seventeenth.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni bco brgyad pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na zhes bya ba ni bcu dgu pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni bco brgyad pa'o // bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na zhes bya ba ni bcu dgu pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, they are endowed with skillful means, this is the eighteenth.🔽Blessed One, if all phenomena are empty of their own intrinsic nature, this is the nineteenth.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad dbyer ma mchis pa lags na ci'i slad du zhes bya ba ni nyi shu pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad dbyer ma mchis pa lags na ci'i slad du zhes bya ba ni nyi shu pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, if all phenomena are inseparable, why is it so? This is the twentieth.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub 'dzin pa la yang mi spyod /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub 'dzin pa la yang mi spyod /
translated: Blessed One, if bodhisattva great beings do not practice with respect to the apprehension of awakening,

original: mi 'dzin pa la yang mi spyod na zhes bya ba ni nyi shu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dzin pa la yang mi spyod na zhes bya ba ni nyi shu gcig pa'o //
translated: and do not practice with respect to non-apprehension, ” this is the twenty-first.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'dzin pa la yang mi spyod /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'dzin pa la yang mi spyod /
translated: Blessed One, if bodhisattva great beings do not practice with respect to apprehension,

original: mi 'dzin pa la yang mi spyod gzugs la yang mi spyod ces bya ba ni nyi shu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dzin pa la yang mi spyod gzugs la yang mi spyod ces bya ba ni nyi shu gnyis pa'o //
translated: and do not practice with respect to non-apprehension, and do not practice with respect to form, ” this is the twenty-second.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu la zhes bya ba ni nyi shu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu la zhes bya ba ni nyi shu gsum pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, if bodhisattva great beings do not practice with respect to the ten bodhisattva stages, ” this is the twenty-third.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang la spyad de sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyi ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam gang lags zhes bya ba ni nyi shu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang la spyad de sems can rnams yongs su smin par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bgyi ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lam gang lags zhes bya ba ni nyi shu bzhi pa'o //
translated: The twenty-fourth question is: Blessed One, what is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's path for bringing sentient beings to maturity and purifying the buddha-field, by practicing which the bodhisattva-mahāsattva brings sentient beings to maturity and purifies the buddha-field?

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing zhes bya ba ni nyi shu lnga pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing zhes bya ba ni nyi shu lnga pa'o //
translated: The twenty-fifth question is: Blessed One, how does the bodhisattva-mahāsattva practice the perfection of generosity and so on up to the perfection of wisdom?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam gang lags zhes bya ba ni nyi shu drug pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad stong pa lags na zhes bya ba ni nyi @234a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam gang lags zhes bya ba ni nyi shu drug pa'o // bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad stong pa lags na zhes bya ba ni nyi @234a * //
translated: The twenty-sixth question is: Blessed One, what is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's path?

original: shu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: shu bdun pa'o //
translated: The twenty-seventh question is: Blessed One, if all phenomena are empty, how does the bodhisattva-mahāsattva practice the perfection of generosity and so on up to the perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du mi gnas pa lags zhes bya ba ni nyi shu brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du mi gnas pa lags zhes bya ba ni nyi shu brgyad pa'o //
translated: The twenty-eighth question is: Blessed One, why is it that the bodhisattva-mahāsattva does not abide in form and so on up to the knowledge of all aspects?

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad ma skyes na zhes bya ba ni nyi shu dgu pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad ma skyes na zhes bya ba ni nyi shu dgu pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, if all phenomena are unborn, this is the twenty-ninth.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung zhes bya ba ni sum cu pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung zhes bya ba ni sum cu pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, then whether the Tathāgatas arise or not, this is the thirtieth.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags skyes par gyur pa'i lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur lags sam zhes bya ba ni sum cu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags skyes par gyur pa'i lam gyis byang chub thob par 'gyur lags sam zhes bya ba ni sum cu gcig pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, is awakening attained by the path that has arisen? This is the thirty-first.

original: 'dir bar skabs su zhus pa lnga'o //
analyzed: 'dir bar skabs su zhus pa lnga'o //
translated: Here there are five interjections.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub nyid kyang lam lags la zhes bya ba ni sum bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub nyid kyang lam lags la zhes bya ba ni sum bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, if awakening itself is the path, this is the thirty-second.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dben pa lags na zhes bya ba ni sum cu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dben pa lags na zhes bya ba ni sum cu gsum pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, if all phenomena are isolated by their very nature, this is the thirty-third.

original: bcom ldan 'das lus kyi gnas ngan len ni gang lags zhes bya ba ni sum cu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das lus kyi gnas ngan len ni gang lags zhes bya ba ni sum cu bzhi pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, what is the negative tendency of the body? This is the thirty-fourth.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des shes bgyi'am zhes bya ba ni sum cu lnga pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des shes bgyi'am zhes bya ba ni sum cu lnga pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, is it that bodhisattva great being who knows? is the thirty-fifth.

original: bcom ldan 'das phung po gang du nges pa lags zhes bya ba ni sum cu drug pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phung po gang du nges pa lags zhes bya ba ni sum cu drug pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, in which aggregate is it determined? is the thirty-sixth.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags sems dang po'i bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni sum cu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags sems dang po'i bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni sum cu bdun pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, is it the first generation of the mind? is the thirty-seventh.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nges par ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur lags sam zhes bya ba ni sum cu brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nges par ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur lags sam zhes bya ba ni sum cu brgyad pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, is it that the bodhisattva great being who is determined will definitely be born in the lower realms? is the thirty-eighth.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ni sum cu dgu pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te nges pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ni sum cu dgu pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, if the bodhisattva great being who is determined... is the thirty-ninth.

original: bcom ldan 'das dge ba'i chos dag gang la gnas shing zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dge ba'i chos dag gang la gnas shing zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, abiding in which virtuous dharmas... is the fortieth.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i chos dkar po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'phags pa'i chos dkar po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, how is it that a bodhisattva mahāsattva is said to possess the noble bright qualities? This is the forty-first.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'phags shing zag pa mi mnga' zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa ni 'phags shing zag pa mi mnga' zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, the Tathāgata is said to be noble and free from defilements. This is the forty-second.

original: bcom ldan 'das dge ba'i chos gang dag la gnas te zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dge ba'i chos gang dag la gnas te zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu gsum pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, abiding in which virtuous qualities? This is the forty-third.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags byang chub @234b sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gzhan la mi gnas kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'ba' zhig la gnas shing zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags byang chub @234b sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos gzhan la mi gnas kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'ba' zhig la gnas shing zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu bzhi pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, is it that a bodhisattva mahāsattva does not abide in any other Dharma, but abides only in the perfection of wisdom? This is the forty-fourth.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid lags na zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu lnga pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid lags na zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu lnga pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, if the perfection of wisdom is empty of inherent nature, this is the forty-fifth.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu drug pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu drug pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, how is one called a bodhisattva mahāsattva? This is the forty-sixth.

original: bcom ldan 'das bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i lam de gang lags zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba'i lam de gang lags zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu bdun pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, what is that path by which one will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment? This is the forty-seventh.

original: gal te chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa lags na zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa lags na zhes bya ba ni bzhi bcu brgyad pa'o //
translated: If all phenomena are empty of their own characteristics, this is the forty-eighth.

translated: Is it so, Blessed One, that the Tathāgata, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, this is the forty-ninth.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags de bzhin gshegs pas chos nag po'am dkar po zhes bya ba ni lnga bcu pa'o //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa lags na ji ltar zhes bya ba ni lnga bcu gcig pa'o //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags sdug bsngal 'tshal bas zhes bya ba ni lnga bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhūti, all phenomena are empty of their own marks.🔽 Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being who practices the perfection of wisdom like this should train in all phenomena being empty of their own marks.

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin zhes bgyi ba gang lags zhes bya ba ni lnga bcu bzhi pa'o //

translated: The Blessed One said, Subhūti, all phenomena are empty of their own marks.🔽 Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being who practices the perfection of wisdom like this should train in all phenomena being empty of their own marks.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar lags na byang chub dngos po ma mchis na zhes bya ba ni lnga bcu lnga pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar lags na byang chub dngos po ma mchis na zhes bya ba ni lnga bcu lnga pa'o //
translated: Subhūti said, Blessed One, if all

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid lags te de dag sangs rgyas kyis kyang ma mdzad ces bya ba ni lnga bcu drug pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, if all phenomena are by nature non-existent, and the Buddha did not create them, this is the fifty-sixth.

translated: Blessed One, such an existent, which foolish ordinary beings cling to as real, is not an existent as it is in reality, this is the fifty-seventh.

original: nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am zhes bya ba ni lnga bcu brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am zhes bya ba ni lnga bcu brgyad pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, for one who sees reality, is there defilement or not? This is the fifty-eighth.

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid de gang lags zhes bya ba ni lnga bcu dgu pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid de gang lags zhes bya ba ni lnga bcu dgu pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, what is the sameness of all phenomena? This is the fifty-ninth.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba ni drug cu pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu zhes bya ba ni drug cu pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, if all phenomena are like an illusion, this is the sixtieth.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas chos gang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de zhes bya ba ni drug cu gcig pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das chos dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams la chos kyi mnyam pa nyid ces bgyi ba yang gang zhig mchis lags zhes bya ba ni drug cu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas chos gang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de zhes bya ba ni drug cu gcig pa'o // bcom ldan 'das chos dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid rnams la chos kyi mnyam pa nyid ces bgyi ba yang gang zhig mchis lags zhes bya ba ni drug cu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, the Tathāgata, has fully awakened to some dharma. This is the sixty-first.🔽Blessed One, in the case of dharmas whose nature is non-existent, what is this so-called sameness of dharmas? This is the sixty-second.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags chos mnyam pa nyid de zhes bya ba ni drug cu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags chos mnyam pa nyid de zhes bya ba ni drug cu gsum pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, is that sameness of dharmas

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos thams cad kyi yul la mnga' bsgyur ba ma lags sam zhes bya ba ni drug cu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos thams cad kyi yul la mnga' bsgyur ba ma lags sam zhes bya ba ni drug cu bzhi pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, are not the Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones masters of the domain of all dharmas? This is the sixty-fourth.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la zhes bya ba ni drug cu lnga pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid la zhes bya ba ni drug cu lnga pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, if in the sameness of all dharmas

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos mnyam pa nyid la so so'i skye bo rnams dang zhes bya ba ni drug cu drug pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos mnyam pa nyid la so so'i skye bo rnams dang zhes bya ba ni drug cu drug pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, if ordinary beings and those on the stages of the ten wholesome actions are not separate from the equality of phenomena, this is the sixty-sixth.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa chos mnyam pa nyid las mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni drug cu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa chos mnyam pa nyid las mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba ni drug cu bdun pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, is it so that the Thus-Gone One does not move from the equality of phenomena? This is the sixty-seventh.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar chos rnams kyi chos nyid ces bya ba ni drug cu brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te de ltar chos rnams kyi chos nyid ces bya ba ni drug cu brgyad pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, if the intrinsic nature of phenomena is like this, this is the sixty-eighth.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags chos nyid 'dus bgyis lags sam zhes bya ba ni drug cu dgu pa'o ;
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags chos nyid 'dus bgyis lags sam zhes bya ba ni drug cu dgu pa'o ;
translated: Blessed One, is the intrinsic nature conditioned? This is the sixty-ninth.

original: / bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste zhes bya ba ni bdun cu pa'o //
analyzed: / bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste zhes bya ba ni bdun cu pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, if the equality of all phenomena is naturally empty, this is the seventieth.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci zhig gis stong pa lags zhes bya ba ni bdun cu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci zhig gis stong pa lags zhes bya ba ni bdun cu gcig pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, by what is it empty? This is the seventy-first.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te 'jig rten pa'i chos 'di dag sprul pa lags na zhes bya ba ni bdun cu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te 'jig rten pa'i chos 'di dag sprul pa lags na zhes bya ba ni bdun cu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, if these worldly dharmas are emanations, is the seventy-second.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang spangs pa zhes bgyi ba zhes bya ba ni bdun cu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang spangs pa zhes bgyi ba zhes bya ba ni bdun cu gsum pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, what is called abandonment, is the seventy-third.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang ma sprul pa'i chos de gang lags zhes bya ba ni bdun cu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang ma sprul pa'i chos de gang lags zhes bya ba ni bdun cu bzhi pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, what is the dharma that is not emanated? is the seventy-fourth.

original: bcom ldan 'das de gang lags @235b zhes bya ba ni bdun cu lnga pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de gang lags @235b zhes bya ba ni bdun cu lnga pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, what is that? is the seventy-fifth.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du zhes bya ba ni bdun cu drug pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du zhes bya ba ni bdun cu drug pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, Kauṇḍinya, is the seventy-sixth.

original: bcom ldan 'das las dang po pa'i gang zag gis ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid yongs su btsal bar bgyi na ji ltar gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi zhes bya ba ni bdun cu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das las dang po pa'i gang zag gis ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid yongs su btsal bar bgyi na ji ltar gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi zhes bya ba ni bdun cu bdun pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, if a beginning practitioner of the person should investigate the emptiness of intrinsic nature, how should they be instructed and taught? is the seventy-seventh.

original: zhus pa 'di dag thams cad kyi 'khor de na 'khod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa rnams kyi don dang / ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir zhus pa rig par bya'o /
analyzed: zhus pa 'di dag thams cad kyi 'khor de na 'khod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa rnams kyi don dang / ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir zhus pa rig par bya'o /
translated: It should be understood that all these questions were asked for the sake of the bodhisattvas who were present in the retinue and were irreversible, and for the benefit of beings in the future.

original: // / bam po nyi shu gsum pa /🔽de la rab 'byor gzugs zab po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: // / bam po nyi shu gsum pa / de la rab 'byor gzugs zab po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: All these questions should be understood as asked for the sake of the irreversible bodhisattvas present in that assembly, and for the benefit of beings in the future.

original: 'dir gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid la gzugs kyi tshig tu brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid la gzugs kyi tshig tu brjod do //
translated: Here, the suchness of form is expressed in the words form.

original: de bas na ji ltar zab ces zhus pa dang / rab 'byor gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du gzugs zab po zhes bya bas de bzhin nyid kho na yin par bstan te /
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar zab ces zhus pa dang / rab 'byor gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du gzugs zab po zhes bya bas de bzhin nyid kho na yin par bstan te /
translated: Therefore, when it is asked how is it profound? and it is said just as the suchness of form is, so is form profound, it shows that it is just suchness.

original: rnam pa gang gis de bzhin nyid zab pa'i rnam pa des gzugs zab po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis de bzhin nyid zab pa'i rnam pa des gzugs zab po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By whatever aspect the suchness is profound, by that aspect form is profound - this is the meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ni ji lta bu lags zhes zhus pa ci las dgongs she na de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni rnam pa med pa ste /🔽gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ni ji lta bu lags zhes zhus pa ci las dgongs she na de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni rnam pa med pa ste / gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: The suchness that is spoken of is without aspects,🔽and it is not dependent on the characteristics of form, etc.,

original: gzugs la sogs pa la rag lus pa yang ma yin na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la rag lus pa yang ma yin na /
translated: or on form, etc.

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba gzugs la sogs pa'i tshig tu ji ltar brjod ces zhus pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid ces bya ba gzugs la sogs pa'i tshig tu ji ltar brjod ces zhus pa'o //
translated: How can it be said that the suchness of form and the suchness of feeling, etc., are the words form, etc.?

original: rab 'byor gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid de la gzugs kyang med /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid de la gzugs kyang med /
translated: Subhūti, in that suchness of form, there is no form,

original: gzugs las gud na yang de bzhin nyid med de gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ni de lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs las gud na yang de bzhin nyid med de gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ni de lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: and apart from form, there is no suchness. Such is the suchness of form.

original: kun brtags pa spangs te /
analyzed: kun brtags pa spangs te /
translated: Having abandoned the imagined,

original: kun brtags pa las gud na yod pa'i de bzhin nyid yongs su grub pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: kun brtags pa las gud na yod pa'i de bzhin nyid yongs su grub pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad dang bral ba ste /
translated: that which is the perfected suchness that exists apart from the imagined is free from all aspects,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i sgrar brjod du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i sgrar brjod du mi rung ngo //
translated: and it is not suitable to be expressed with the words form, etc.

original: gang byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dang de de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du mi rung ba dri ma dang bcas pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de /
analyzed: gang byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dang de de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du mi rung ba dri ma dang bcas pa'i de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de /
translated: The form, etc. that are imagined by the childish, ordinary beings, and the thusness that is associated with defilement, which is not suitable to be described as either the same as or different from that,

original: de'i gnas skabs nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i sgrar sgro btag @236a * //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i sgrar sgro btag @236a * //
translated: are designated with the words “form,” etc. in order to illustrate its state.

original: te tha snyad du byas so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: te tha snyad du byas so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that they are conventionally designated.

original: gzugs las kyang bzlog mya ngan las 'das pa yang bstan zhes bya ba ni gzugs zab po zhes bya ba des kun brtags pa'i gzugs las ni bzlog / chos nyid kyi gzugs mya ngan las 'das pa ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs las kyang bzlog mya ngan las 'das pa yang bstan zhes bya ba ni gzugs zab po zhes bya ba des kun brtags pa'i gzugs las ni bzlog / chos nyid kyi gzugs mya ngan las 'das pa ni bstan pa'o //
translated: “Also, nirvana is taught as the opposite of form” means that, by that statement “form is profound,” the form that is imagined is opposed, and the form of reality, nirvana, is taught.

original: skyes bu 'dod chags can gyi dpe ni go sla'o //
analyzed: skyes bu 'dod chags can gyi dpe ni go sla'o //
translated: The example of the lustful man is easy to understand.

original: nyin gcig la dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bzung ba des gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rnams yongs su gang bar gyur kyang /
analyzed: nyin gcig la dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bzung ba des gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rnams yongs su gang bar gyur kyang /
translated: Even if the world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river were filled with those who have taken up the roots of virtue in a single day,

original: des ni dge ba'i rtsa ba'i de'i lhag ma'i brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni nyin gcig la dge ba'i rtsa ba gang bstsags pa des gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rnams yongs su gang bar gyur kyang gang🔽g'a'i klung bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su gang bar gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de'i cha bas lhag ma lus pa'i cha mang du 'gyur la /
analyzed: des ni dge ba'i rtsa ba'i de'i lhag ma'i brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni nyin gcig la dge ba'i rtsa ba gang bstsags pa des gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rnams yongs su gang bar gyur kyang gang g'a'i klung bye ma snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su gang bar gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de'i cha bas lhag ma lus pa'i cha mang du 'gyur la /

original: 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su gang ba'i cha ni lhag ma lus pa'i cha'i brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su gang ba'i cha ni lhag ma lus pa'i cha'i brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The merit of the latter does not approach even a hundredth part of the former.🔽The merit of the latter does not approach

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba zhig gis shes rab sgom par byed na zhes bya ba ni dmigs su med pa mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi shes rab dang mi ldan par 'jig rten pa'i shes rab 'ba' zhig bsgom🔽na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba zhig gis shes rab sgom par byed na zhes bya ba ni dmigs su med pa mthong ba'i lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi shes rab dang mi ldan par 'jig rten pa'i shes rab 'ba' zhig bsgom na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it means that they would cultivate only mundane wisdom, without the wisdom of the aspect of the path of seeing that is devoid of reference points.

original: 'di lta ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ma'o zhes bya ba ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ma'o zhes bya ba ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid la bya'o //
translated: This perfection of wisdom is the mother of the bodhisattvas,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang mngon bar 'du bgyid pa thams cad ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kun brtags pa'o zhes bka' stsal na ji ltar rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang mngon bar 'du bgyid pa thams cad ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kun brtags pa'o zhes bka' stsal na ji ltar rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: the Blessed One has said that all that is compounded is imagined by the Tathāgata.

original: rigs kyi bu mo'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel bar 'gyur pa lags zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams kyi bdag nyid gang dang gang mngon par 'du byed pa de kun brtags pa yin
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel bar 'gyur pa lags zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams kyi bdag nyid gang dang gang mngon par 'du byed pa de kun brtags pa yin
translated: This is the imagined merit of the bodhisattva who is without the perfection of wisdom, and who is engaged in the accumulation of merit.

original: te / de bas na bsod nams mang du 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: te / de bas na bsod nams mang du 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the merit does not increase much.

original: mngon par 'du bgyid pa ma mchis pa ni dngos po ma mchis pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'du bgyid pa ma mchis pa ni dngos po ma mchis pa ste /
translated: The non-engagement is the non-existence of the entity.🔽 The non-existence of the entity is not able to produce the right view, the entry into the faultless, and so on.
