original: dngos po ma mchis pas ni yang dag pa'i @236b lta ba dang / skyon ma mchis par 'jug pa la sogs pa bgyid par yang mi nus so zhes bya ba ni des ci yang byed mi nus na /
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pas ni yang dag pa'i @236b lta ba dang / skyon ma mchis par 'jug pa la sogs pa bgyid par yang mi nus so zhes bya ba ni des ci yang byed mi nus na /
translated: This is the statement that if it is not able to produce anything,

original: de ji ltar rigs par 'gyur zhes gsol pa'o //
analyzed: de ji ltar rigs par 'gyur zhes gsol pa'o //
translated: how can it be reasonable?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par 'du byed pa de yang stong pa nyid du snang ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par 'du byed pa de yang stong pa nyid du snang ngo //
translated: The bodhisattva's engagement is also seen as emptiness.

original: gso ba nyid du snang ngo zhes bya ba 'dis 'di skad du nga ni mngon par 'du byed pas bsod nams 'phel bar yang mi smra /
analyzed: gso ba nyid du snang ngo zhes bya ba 'dis 'di skad du nga ni mngon par 'du byed pas bsod nams 'phel bar yang mi smra /
translated: This is saying, I do not say that merit increases through performance,

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med pas kyang bsod nams 'phel bar mi smra'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med pas kyang bsod nams 'phel bar mi smra'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: nor do I say that merit increases without performance.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams mngon par 'du bya ba gang dang gang byung ba de dag rtag tu rnam pa thams cad du stong pa nyid dang gsog dang gsob tu ji ltar so sor brtag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams mngon par 'du bya ba gang dang gang byung ba de dag rtag tu rnam pa thams cad du stong pa nyid dang gsog dang gsob tu ji ltar so sor brtag par bya zhe na /
translated: If one asks, Well then, how is it? [the answer is:] whatever merit-making activity arises for the bodhisattva, one should always and in every way examine it as empty, as hollow, and as false.

original: de ltar so sor rtog na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar so sor rtog na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir /
translated: If one examines it in that way, one will not be separated from the perfection of wisdom,

original: bsod nams dpag tu med grangs med pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes smra'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dpag tu med grangs med pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes smra'o zhes bya'o //
translated: and I say that immeasurable, innumerable merit will increase.

original: bye brag ni ci zhig mchis zhes bya ba skabs su bab pa'i phyir zhar la dris pa ste /
analyzed: bye brag ni ci zhig mchis zhes bya ba skabs su bab pa'i phyir zhar la dris pa ste /
translated: What is the difference? is a question that is relevant to the present context, so it is asked as an aside.

original: rab 'byor grangs med pa zhes bya ba ni gang la bgrang du med pa'o zhes bya ba la tshig gis bgrang mi nus pa ni grangs med pa'o //🔽dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba ni dpag par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor grangs med pa zhes bya ba ni gang la bgrang du med pa'o zhes bya ba la tshig gis bgrang mi nus pa ni grangs med pa'o // dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba ni dpag par mi nus pa'o //
translated: Subhuti: A number is that which can be counted.🔽Innumerable means that it cannot be counted by means of a number.🔽Immeasurable means that it cannot be measured by means of a measure.

original: grangs kyi dbang gis kyang 'di tsam mo zhes yongs su chad par tshad gzung du med pa ni tshad med pa ste /
analyzed: grangs kyi dbang gis kyang 'di tsam mo zhes yongs su chad par tshad gzung du med pa ni tshad med pa ste /
translated: Infinite means that it cannot be limited by means of an infinite.

original: 'di gsum char yang bgrang ba'i bye brag go //🔽grangs kyi khams dang grangs med pa'i khams zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi khams dang 'dus ma byas kyi khams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽gzugs kyang stong pa grangs med dpag tu med tshad med pa'o zhes bya ba ni grangs dang tshad la sogs pa ni kun brtags pa rnams la yod kyi /
analyzed: 'di gsum char yang bgrang ba'i bye brag go // grangs kyi khams dang grangs med pa'i khams zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi khams dang 'dus ma byas kyi khams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gzugs kyang stong pa grangs med dpag tu med tshad med pa'o zhes bya ba ni grangs dang tshad la sogs pa ni kun brtags pa rnams la yod kyi /
translated: These three are different kinds of counting.🔽The realm of number and the realm of nonnumber are the same as the compounded and the uncompounded.🔽Form is empty, and the empty is innumerable, immeasurable, and infinite.

original: stong pa nyid kyi dbyings la ni med de 'di ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi dbyings la ni med de 'di ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: Number, measure, etc. are in the imagined, but not in the realm of emptiness. This is a synonym.

original: de bas na gzugs kyang stong pa'o zhes bye brag yod par bya ba'i phyir yang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs kyang stong pa'o zhes bye brag yod par bya ba'i phyir yang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says “also” in order to make a distinction, namely, that form is also empty.

original: snying rje chen pos bshad pa'i rgyu mthun pa bstan pa'i nyid do zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu bshad pa ni thugs rje'i rgyu mthun pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad kyang brjod du ma mchis pa'o zhes bya @237a * //
analyzed: snying rje chen pos bshad pa'i rgyu mthun pa bstan pa'i nyid do zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu bshad pa ni thugs rje'i rgyu mthun pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad kyang brjod du ma mchis pa'o zhes bya @237a * //
translated: The statement “the teaching that is the natural outcome of great compassion” means that the teaching in terms of the conventional is the natural outcome of compassion.

original: ba ni sngar chos nyid 'ba' zhig brjod du med par bstan te /
analyzed: ba ni sngar chos nyid 'ba' zhig brjod du med par bstan te /
translated: The statement “Blessed One, all things are inexpressible” means that previously only reality was taught to be inexpressible.

original: da ni chos nyid dang tha mi dad pa'i chos thams cad kyang brjod du med pa nyid do zhes ston to //🔽bcom ldan 'das ci brjod du ma mchis pa'i don la 'phel ba'am /
analyzed: da ni chos nyid dang tha mi dad pa'i chos thams cad kyang brjod du med pa nyid do zhes ston to // bcom ldan 'das ci brjod du ma mchis pa'i don la 'phel ba'am /
translated: Now, he teaches that all things, which are not different from reality, are also inexpressible.🔽The statement “Blessed One, is there no increase or decrease in the meaning of the inexpressible?”

original: yongs su 'grib pa ma mchis sam zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bstan to //
analyzed: yongs su 'grib pa ma mchis sam zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bstan to //
translated: and so on, teaches the following.

original: brjod du med pas ni stong pa nyid du brjod pas stong pa nyid ni chos dkar po'i dbang gis 'phel ba yang med /
analyzed: brjod du med pas ni stong pa nyid du brjod pas stong pa nyid ni chos dkar po'i dbang gis 'phel ba yang med /
translated: Since it is inexpressible, emptiness is not increased by the power of virtuous phenomena.

original: chos nag po'i dbang gis yongs su 'grib pa yang med do //
analyzed: chos nag po'i dbang gis yongs su 'grib pa yang med do //
translated: Nor is it decreased by the power of nonvirtuous phenomena.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la yang 'phel ba dang 'grib pa gnyis med na 'o na rgyu gang gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur zhes zhus pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa la yang 'phel ba dang 'grib pa gnyis med na 'o na rgyu gang gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur zhes zhus pa ste /
translated: If there is no increase and decrease even in the perfections and so on, then by what cause will one become a fit vessel for the knowledge of all aspects,🔽for the complete and perfect enlightenment of unsurpassed buddhahood?

original: de skad zhus pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ji lta ba de bzhin du yongs su bsngo'o zhes bya ba tshig tha ma'i gzhung gis thabs mkhas pas yongs su bsngos pa'i stobs kyis 'gyur bar ston to //
analyzed: de skad zhus pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ji lta ba de bzhin du yongs su bsngo'o zhes bya ba tshig tha ma'i gzhung gis thabs mkhas pas yongs su bsngos pa'i stobs kyis 'gyur bar ston to //
translated: When this was asked, the text of the final verse shows that it is through the power of dedication with skillful means that one becomes a fit vessel, saying, “I dedicate in the same way that unsurpassed, complete, and perfect enlightenment is.”

original: bcom ldan 'das bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid de /🔽yang bstan pa'i phyir zhus pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ji lta bu lags zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid de / yang bstan pa'i phyir zhus pa'o //
translated: This is a request for further teaching on the nature of emptiness that is not different from form, etc.

original: 'phel ba dang / yongs su 'grib pa med pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: 'phel ba dang / yongs su 'grib pa med pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o zhes bya bas ni /
translated: How should one practice the perfection of wisdom by way of the non-decrease and non-increase of form, etc.?

original: 'di gcig pu'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa yin par ston to //
analyzed: 'di gcig pu'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa yin par ston to //
translated: This shows that this is the practice of the perfection of wisdom alone.🔽Blessed One, is unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment fully awakened to by the bodhisattva great being who first generates the mind,

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'am /
translated: or is it fully awakened to by the one who generates the later mind?

original: 'on te sems slad ma bskyed pas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhes bya ba ni zab mo'i gnas kyi skabs zhus pa ste /
analyzed: 'on te sems slad ma bskyed pas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhes bya ba ni zab mo'i gnas kyi skabs zhus pa ste /
translated: This is the request for the section on the profound point.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bstsags pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bstsags pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya na /
translated: One attains supreme perfect enlightenment by accumulating roots of virtue.

original: de la ji ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba bstsags par 'gyur //🔽ci 'di la byang chub sems dpa' bskal pa @237b grangs med pa gsum gyi sngon rol du gang thog mar sems bskyed pa de'i mthas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'am 'on te gnyis pas sam /
analyzed: de la ji ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba bstsags par 'gyur // ci 'di la byang chub sems dpa' bskal pa @237b grangs med pa gsum gyi sngon rol du gang thog mar sems bskyed pa de'i mthas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'am 'on te gnyis pas sam /
translated: How does one accumulate roots of virtue?

original: 'on te gsum pas sam /🔽'on te ci gang byang chub kyi snying por bzhugs pa na /
analyzed: 'on te gsum pas sam / 'on te ci gang byang chub kyi snying por bzhugs pa na /
translated: Is it that one attains perfect enlightenment at the end of the first incalculable eon, or the second, or the third?

original: thams cad kyi tha mar sems bskyed pa de'i mthus mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya /
analyzed: thams cad kyi tha mar sems bskyed pa de'i mthus mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya /
translated: Or is it that one attains perfect enlightenment at the end of the last thought of enlightenment, when one is seated on the seat of enlightenment?

original: de la sems gcig gis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la sems gcig gis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: One does not attain perfect enlightenment through a single thought of enlightenment,

original: de la de lta bu'i mthu med pa dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs lhag ma rnams don med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la de lta bu'i mthu med pa dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs lhag ma rnams don med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that thought does not have the power to do so, and because the remaining accumulations of merit would be meaningless.

original: thams cad kyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad kyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not all of them,

original: de dag skad cig re re la 'jigs pa'i ngang can yin pas bstsags su mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de dag skad cig re re la 'jigs pa'i ngang can yin pas bstsags su mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: because they are not suitable to be accumulated, since they are momentary and perishable.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis mar me'i dpe bstan pa /🔽gang gi tshe mar me'i snying po tshig pa ni skad cig re re la 'jigs pa'i ngang can yin yang /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis mar me'i dpe bstan pa / gang gi tshe mar me'i snying po tshig pa ni skad cig re re la 'jigs pa'i ngang can yin yang /
translated: The Lord taught the example of the lamp.🔽When the wick of a lamp is consumed, it is momentary and perishable.

original: mar me'i skad cig thams cad kyi stobs kyis tshig par gyur ces bya'o //
analyzed: mar me'i skad cig thams cad kyi stobs kyis tshig par gyur ces bya'o //
translated: But it is said that it is consumed by the power of all the moments of the lamp.

original: de bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yang sems thams cad kyi mthus 'gyur bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa yang sems thams cad kyi mthus 'gyur bar bstan pa ste /
translated: In the same way, it is taught that full enlightenment is due to the power of all the moments of mind.

original: skad cig pa yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: skad cig pa yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even though they are momentary,

original: 'du byed kyi bag chags bstsags pa'i tshul gyis 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi bag chags bstsags pa'i tshul gyis 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: it is thought that they are due to the way the habitual tendencies of the formative forces are accumulated.

original: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa ni lhag mthong gi tshe'o //
analyzed: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa ni lhag mthong gi tshe'o //
translated: The stage of seeing what is white is the time of penetrating insight.

original: rigs kyi sa ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog go //
analyzed: rigs kyi sa ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog go //
translated: The stage of lineage is the supreme mundane state.

original: brgyad pa'i sa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: brgyad pa'i sa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i lam mo //
translated: The stage of the eighth is the path of the stream-enterer.

original: de nyid kyi 'bras bu ni mthong ba'i sa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'bras bu ni mthong ba'i sa'o //
translated: Its fruit is the stage of the once-returner.

original: bsrab pa'i sa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i sa ste /
analyzed: bsrab pa'i sa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i sa ste /
translated: The stage of thinning is the stage of the once-returner,

original: des 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / gnod sems bsrabs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / gnod sems bsrabs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it thins out passion and ill will in the realm of desire.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i sa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i sa ste /
translated: The stage of freedom from passion is the stage of the non-returner,

original: 'dod chags dang gnod sems gnyis spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang gnod sems gnyis spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it abandons both passion and ill will.

original: byas pa rtogs pa'i sa ni dgra bcom pa nyid de /
analyzed: byas pa rtogs pa'i sa ni dgra bcom pa nyid de /
translated: The stage of the realization of what is to be done is the state of the saint,

original: bya ba byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the task is done.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa ni rang byang chub nyid do //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa ni rang byang chub nyid do //
translated: The stage of the Solitary Sage is the enlightenment of the Solitary Sage.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa ni lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid do //
translated: The stage of the Bodhisattva is the knowledge of the modes of the path.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //🔽gzhan yang sems gang 'gags pa de'i phyir skye bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba la @238a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do // gzhan yang sems gang 'gags pa de'i phyir skye bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba la @238a * //
translated: The stage of the Buddha is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sogs pas zab mo'i gnas skabs ston to //
analyzed: sogs pas zab mo'i gnas skabs ston to //
translated: Moreover, the profound stage is taught by the question, “Does the mind that has ceased arise again?”

original: gang 'gags pa ni skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang 'gags pa ni skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: What has ceased does not arise.

original: gang skyes pa ni 'gag pa'i chos can yin no //
analyzed: gang skyes pa ni 'gag pa'i chos can yin no //
translated: What has arisen has the nature of cessation.

original: gang 'gag pa'i chos can de ni 'gag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang 'gag pa'i chos can de ni 'gag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: What has the nature of cessation does not cease.

original: de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin nyid du de gnas par yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de bzhin nyid du de gnas par yang 'gyur la /
translated: It abides just as it is, in reality.

original: de ther zug tu gnas par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni zab mo'i gnas so //
analyzed: de ther zug tu gnas par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni zab mo'i gnas so //
translated: That is the profound point.

original: gang 'gags pa de ni skye bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis 'gag pa ste 'dus ma byas pa la bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'gags pa de ni skye bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis 'gag pa ste 'dus ma byas pa la bya'o //
translated: What has ceased does not arise means that cessation is by nature uncompounded.

original: gang skyes pa de ni 'gag pa'i chos can ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas la bya'o //
analyzed: gang skyes pa de ni 'gag pa'i chos can ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas la bya'o //
translated: What has arisen has the nature of cessation means that cessation is compounded.

original: gang 'gag pa'i chos can de ni 'gag par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'gag pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir de skad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: gang 'gag pa'i chos can de ni 'gag par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'gag pa gnyis pa med pa'i phyir de skad ces gsungs so //
translated: What has the nature of cessation does not cease means that cessation is not a second cessation.

original: de bzhin du de gnas par yang 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de gnas par yang 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la bya'o //
translated: It abides just as it is means that it abides in reality.

original: de ther zug tu gnas par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir de skad bshad do //
analyzed: de ther zug tu gnas par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir de skad bshad do //
translated: It does not endure permanently is said because it has no intrinsic reality.

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: sems de yang de bzhin nyid dam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems de yang de bzhin nyid dam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Is that mind suchness?

original: ci 'dus byas kyi sems gang yin pa de /
analyzed: ci 'dus byas kyi sems gang yin pa de /
translated: Is that mind which is conditioned

original: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin nam zhes dris pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid yin nam zhes dris pa'o //
translated: the intrinsic reality of suchness?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Bhagavān, it is not.

original: dri ma dang bcas pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma lags so zhes slar gsol pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma dang bcas pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ma lags so zhes slar gsol pa'o //
translated: It is not the intrinsic reality of suchness because it is defiled.

original: de bzhin nyid las sems de gud na yod dam zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi sems de de bzhin nyid las gzhan nam zhes dris pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid las sems de gud na yod dam zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi sems de de bzhin nyid las gzhan nam zhes dris pa'o //
translated: Is that mind other than suchness?🔽Bhagavān, it is not.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa ni yongs su grub pa las de kho na nyid dam gzhan du bsnyad du mi rung ba'i phyir slar gsol pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa ni yongs su grub pa las de kho na nyid dam gzhan du bsnyad du mi rung ba'i phyir slar gsol pa'o //
translated: It is not suitable to say that the imagined is the reality or other than the reality of the perfected.

original: de bzhin nyid la sems yod dam zhes bya ba dang / sems la de bzhin nyid yod dam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la sems yod dam zhes bya ba dang / sems la de bzhin nyid yod dam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The question, Is there mind in suchness? and Is there suchness in mind?

original: ci phan tshun gnas dang brten pa'i dngos por yod dam zhes dris pa'o //
analyzed: ci phan tshun gnas dang brten pa'i dngos por yod dam zhes dris pa'o //
translated: means, Are they mutually existent as a basis and something based?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa dang / yongs su grub pa gnyis gnas dang brten pa'i dngos por yod pa ma yin no zhes slar gsol pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa dang / yongs su grub pa gnyis gnas dang brten pa'i dngos por yod pa ma yin no zhes slar gsol pa'o //
translated: The reply, No, Blessed One, means that the imagined and the perfect are not mutually existent as a basis and something based.

original: de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin nyid yang dag par @238b rjes su mthong ngam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyis de bzhin nyid yang dag par @238b rjes su mthong ngam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The question, Does suchness see suchness?

original: sems des chos thams cad yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo snyam du sems pa la dris pa'o //
analyzed: sems des chos thams cad yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo snyam du sems pa la dris pa'o //
translated: means, Does that mind see all dharmas?

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The reply, No, Blessed One,🔽 means that suchness is not an object of knowledge.🔽The question, Does suchness see suchness?

original: de bzhin nyid kyi gnas skabs de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi gnas skabs de ni /
translated: means, Does suchness see suchness?🔽The reply, No, Blessed One,

original: dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa med pa'i phyir slar gsol pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa med pa'i phyir slar gsol pa'o //
translated: means that suchness is not an object of knowledge.🔽The question, Does suchness see suchness?🔽 means, Does suchness see suchness?

original: bcom ldan 'das gang de ltar spyod do zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang de ltar spyod do zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: Blessed One, that which is taught as “I practice thus”

original: ci la yang spyod pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ci la yang spyod pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: is not practicing anything at all.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni gang la gnyis kun 'byung ba ma mchis pa'i don dam pa la spyod do zhes bya ba ni spyod do zhe'am med do zhes bya bas de ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni gang la gnyis kun 'byung ba ma mchis pa'i don dam pa la spyod do zhes bya ba ni spyod do zhe'am med do zhes bya bas de ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, that is practicing the ultimate, in which the arising of duality does not exist.

original: des mtshan mar 'du shes pa rnam par bshig pa yin nam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des mtshan mar 'du shes pa rnam par bshig pa yin nam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Has that one destroyed the perception of signs?”

original: mtshan ma'i 'du shes med par byas pa yin nam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i 'du shes med par byas pa yin nam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: means “Has that one made the perception of signs non-existent?”

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Blessed One, that is not so.”

original: mtshan ma'i 'du shes rnam par gzhig par bya'o snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i 'du shes rnam par gzhig par bya'o snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa /
translated: means “The conception ‘I will destroy the perception of signs’ does not occur.”

original: kun tu 'byung ba med pa'i phyir slar gsol pa ste /
analyzed: kun tu 'byung ba med pa'i phyir slar gsol pa ste /
translated: Because of the non-occurrence of such a conception, he replies.

original: de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa kun tu spyod pa med par yang stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa'i mthus bdag nyid mtshan ma'i 'du shes kun tu mi spyod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa kun tu spyod pa med par yang stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa'i mthus bdag nyid mtshan ma'i 'du shes kun tu mi spyod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: And by the power of cultivating the emptiness, signless, and wishless meditative stabilizations without engaging in such conceptual thoughts, they themselves do not engage in the discriminations of signs.

original: ting nge 'dzin de dag gis sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba ni thabs mkhas pa'i mthus /🔽gang bdag kyang stong pa nyid la sogs par mthong bar 'gyur la /🔽sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de dag gis sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba ni thabs mkhas pa'i mthus / gang bdag kyang stong pa nyid la sogs par mthong bar 'gyur la / sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed pa ste /
translated: They bring sentient beings to full maturity by means of those meditative stabilizations.

original: de ni thabs la mkhas pa'i mthu yin no //
analyzed: de ni thabs la mkhas pa'i mthu yin no //
translated: This is the power of skill in means.

original: gang la la rmi lam du stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum la snyoms par zhugs na /
analyzed: gang la la rmi lam du stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum la snyoms par zhugs na /
translated: Whoever sees emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness in a dream and then enters into the three meditative stabilizations of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness,

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel lam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel lam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: will they increase through the perfection of wisdom?

original: zab mo'i gnas kyi skabs phye nas /
analyzed: zab mo'i gnas kyi skabs phye nas /
translated: Having opened the door to the profound,

original: gnas brtan gnyis kyis sngar 'das pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyid bstan te /
analyzed: gnas brtan gnyis kyis sngar 'das pa'i ting nge 'dzin nyid bstan te /
translated: the two elders taught the very samādhi of the past.

original: gal te chos thams cad dmigs su med na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad dmigs su med na /
translated: If all phenomena are not apprehended,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang rmi lam na ting nge 'dzin gsum la snyoms @239a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang rmi lam na ting nge 'dzin gsum la snyoms @239a * //
translated: when a bodhisattva enters the three samādhis in a dream,

original: par zhugs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: par zhugs pa de'i tshe /
translated: at that time

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
translated: it is reasonable that the perfection of wisdom would increase.

original: gal te rmi lam na pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par 'phel bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te rmi lam na pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par 'phel bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: If the perfections do not increase in a dream

original: gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe ni 'gyur na /
analyzed: gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe ni 'gyur na /
translated: but do when not asleep,

original: de lta na ni rmi lam dang / gnyid kyis ma log pa gnyis la chos rnams la yod pa dang med pa'i bye brag 'ba' zhig yod do snyam du dgongs nas dris pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni rmi lam dang / gnyid kyis ma log pa gnyis la chos rnams la yod pa dang med pa'i bye brag 'ba' zhig yod do snyam du dgongs nas dris pa'o //
translated: then it is only in terms of the existence and non-existence of phenomena in dreams and when not asleep that there is a difference.🔽Thinking this, he asked.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gal te nyin par bsgoms pas rnam par 'phel na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gal te nyin par bsgoms pas rnam par 'phel na /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, if it increases through meditation during the day,

original: rmi lam na yang rnam par 'phel lo zhes dris pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam na yang rnam par 'phel lo zhes dris pa'o //
translated: even in dreams, it increases.

original: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the elder Subhūti

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' la ni rmi lam dang / gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe yang /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' la ni rmi lam dang / gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe yang /
translated: said this: “Here, for the bodhisattva, whether in dreams or not dreaming,

original: chos rnams dmigs su med par mtshungs te /
analyzed: chos rnams dmigs su med par mtshungs te /
translated: the non-apprehension of dharmas is the same.🔽Therefore, ‘dream’ and ‘waking’ are just conceptualizations.”

original: de bas na rmi lam zhes bya ba dang / nyin par zhes bya ba ni yang rnam par rtog pa tsam du zad do zhes rmi lam dang gnyid kyis ma log pa gnyis mtshungs par ston to //
analyzed: de bas na rmi lam zhes bya ba dang / nyin par zhes bya ba ni yang rnam par rtog pa tsam du zad do zhes rmi lam dang gnyid kyis ma log pa gnyis mtshungs par ston to //
translated: Thus he shows that dreams and not dreaming are the same.

original: de ltar na nyin par dang rmi lam gnyis mtshungs na /
analyzed: de ltar na nyin par dang rmi lam gnyis mtshungs na /
translated: If it is like this, dreams and waking are the same.

original: gal te gnyid kyis ma log pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis shes rab rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gnyid kyis ma log pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis shes rab rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur na /
translated: If the perfection of wisdom increases through the samādhi of not dreaming,

original: rmi lam gyi ting nge 'dzin gyis kyang shes rab rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi ting nge 'dzin gyis kyang shes rab rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: then the perfection of wisdom would increase through the samādhi of dreams as well.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rmi lam du las shig byas na /🔽las de sogs pa'am /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rmi lam du las shig byas na / las de sogs pa'am /
translated: Venerable Subhūti, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva performs an action in a dream,🔽does that action accumulate

original: 'bri bar 'gyur ba yod dam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'bri bar 'gyur ba yod dam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: or diminish?”

original: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu'i dgongs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu'i dgongs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What was the intention of the elder Śāriputra?

original: gal te nyin par dang rmi lam na yang chos rnams mtshungs na /
analyzed: gal te nyin par dang rmi lam na yang chos rnams mtshungs na /
translated: If in the daytime and in dreams phenomena are the same,

original: gang rmi lam na sbyin pa la sogs pa sbyin pa dang / gang yang rmi lam na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa de gnyis las snga ma ni dge ba'i las sogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang rmi lam na sbyin pa la sogs pa sbyin pa dang / gang yang rmi lam na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob pa de gnyis las snga ma ni dge ba'i las sogs par 'gyur /
translated: then for one who in a dream gives gifts such as generosity, and also for one who in a dream attains the fruit of stream-entry, is it the case that the former accumulates virtuous karma

original: phyi ma ni las rnams zad par 'gyur ba lta yod dam /
analyzed: phyi ma ni las rnams zad par 'gyur ba lta yod dam /
translated: and the latter exhausts karma?

original: 'on te med ces dris pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te med ces dris pa'o //
translated: Or is it not so?”

original: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the elder Subhūti

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad rmi lam lta bur gsungs na /
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad rmi lam lta bur gsungs na /
translated: said, “If the Blessed One has said that all phenomena are like a dream,

original: de la sogs pa'am 'bri bar 'gyur ba med do zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa dang 'bri ba zhes bya ba @239b ni dngos po yod pa las 'gyur na 'di ltar chos thams cad ni rmi lam lta bu ste /
analyzed: de la sogs pa'am 'bri bar 'gyur ba med do zhes gsungs pa la sogs pa dang 'bri ba zhes bya ba @239b ni dngos po yod pa las 'gyur na 'di ltar chos thams cad ni rmi lam lta bu ste /
translated: and so on, or decrease.

original: de'i phyir rmi lam dang gnyid kyi ma log pa gnyi ga na yang /
analyzed: de'i phyir rmi lam dang gnyid kyi ma log pa gnyi ga na yang /
translated: Since that is so, in both dreams and the waking state,

original: las de dang / byed pa po de rnam pa thams cad du med na /
analyzed: las de dang / byed pa po de rnam pa thams cad du med na /
translated: that karma and that agent do not exist in any way.

original: de las sogs pa'am 'bri ba yod ces ci'i phyir zer zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de las sogs pa'am 'bri ba yod ces ci'i phyir zer zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Why do you say that karma and its result exist?

original: de'i phyir rmi lam na chos gang yang sogs pa'am 'bri ba med do zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rmi lam na chos gang yang sogs pa'am 'bri ba med do zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said that in dreams no dharma at all increases or decreases.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig gi rmi lam na klung chus yongs su gang ba zhig mthong ngam /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig gi rmi lam na klung chus yongs su gang ba zhig mthong ngam /
translated: If someone sees in a dream a river filled with water,

original: rgya mtsho skams pa mthong na /
analyzed: rgya mtsho skams pa mthong na /
translated: or sees the ocean dry up,

original: de las sogs pa dang 'bri ba yod dam /
analyzed: de las sogs pa dang 'bri ba yod dam /
translated: does that increase or decrease?🔽Just as those two, increase and decrease, do not exist in dreams,

original: de la ji ltar rmi lam na sogs pa dang 'bri ba de gnyis med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de la ji ltar rmi lam na sogs pa dang 'bri ba de gnyis med pa de bzhin du /
translated: so too

original: nyin par gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe yang gang la yang sogs pa'am 'bri ba gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyin par gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe yang gang la yang sogs pa'am 'bri ba gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Even when not asleep during the day, there is no accumulation or diminution of anything.

original: de nas gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus /
translated: Then the elder Śāriputra said:🔽If one thinks about it while awake, then there is accumulation or diminution of that karma.

original: gal te sad nas rnam par rtog na ni las de las sogs pa'am 'bri ba'ang yod do zhes gsungs pa ni bdag ni dmigs su med par lta ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du byas nas mi smra'i /
analyzed: gal te sad nas rnam par rtog na ni las de las sogs pa'am 'bri ba'ang yod do zhes gsungs pa ni bdag ni dmigs su med par lta ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du byas nas mi smra'i /
translated: I do not speak from the perspective of the nonconceptual bodhisattva who sees the self as unobservable.

original: gang da lta'i gsar bu rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa dag gal te rmi lam na byas pa'i las la sad pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gang da lta'i gsar bu rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa dag gal te rmi lam na byas pa'i las la sad pa'i tshe /
translated: But for those who are beginners, engaging in conceptual thoughts, if they rejoice in and think about the karma done in a dream

original: rjes su yi rang zhing sems pa de'i tshe mtshan mo byas pa'i las la sogs pa'am 'bri ba yod dam zhes 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang zhing sems pa de'i tshe mtshan mo byas pa'i las la sogs pa'am 'bri ba yod dam zhes 'dri ba'o //
translated: when they are awake, then at that time there is accumulation or diminution of the karma done at night.

original: de bas na rmi lam dang gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de bas na rmi lam dang gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe /
translated: Therefore, there is a difference between when dreaming and when not asleep.

original: bye brag yod par 'gyur ro zhes gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag yod par 'gyur ro zhes gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intention of the elder Śāriputra.

original: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the elder Subhūti

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang nyin par srog bcad pa dang / gang rmi lam na srog bcad pa de la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu gang nyin par srog bcad pa dang / gang rmi lam na srog bcad pa de la /
translated: said to the venerable Śāriputra, “Venerable Śāriputra, as for the one who kills a living being in the daytime and the one who kills a living being in a dream,

original: 'di snyam du bdag gis de bsad do //
analyzed: 'di snyam du bdag gis de bsad do //
translated: if they think, ‘I have killed him,’

original: de bdag gis bsad pa legs so zhes sad nas rnam par rtog na /
analyzed: de bdag gis bsad pa legs so zhes sad nas rnam par rtog na /
translated: and after waking up think, ‘It is good that I have killed him,’

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu las de la khyod ci zer zhes bya bas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu las de la khyod ci zer zhes bya bas /
translated: what do you say about that action, Venerable Śāriputra?”

original: 'khrul pa yod par gsungs te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa yod par gsungs te /
translated: Thus he said that there is error.

original: ci las dgongs she na /
analyzed: ci las dgongs she na /
translated: With what intention was that said?

original: mi la las nyin par ram rmi lam na srog bcad pa las gang gi tshe de bsad par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: mi la las nyin par ram rmi lam na srog bcad pa las gang gi tshe de bsad par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When someone kills a living being in the daytime or in a dream, and at the time he kills him,

original: las de gnyis yid kyis rjes su yi rang zhing bsams pa na /🔽ci nyin par srog bcad pa'i las la rjes su yi rang ba'i rnam par smin pa @240a * //
analyzed: las de gnyis yid kyis rjes su yi rang zhing bsams pa na / ci nyin par srog bcad pa'i las la rjes su yi rang ba'i rnam par smin pa @240a * //
translated: he mentally rejoices in that action and thinks about it,🔽what is greater, the ripening of the action of rejoicing in killing in the daytime,

original: che'am ; 'on te rmi lam na byas pa'i las la rjes su yi rang ba'i rnam par smin pa che snyam pa'o //
analyzed: che'am ; 'on te rmi lam na byas pa'i las la rjes su yi rang ba'i rnam par smin pa che snyam pa'o //
translated: or the ripening of the action of rejoicing in killing in a dream?”

original: de nas sh'a ri'i bus /
analyzed: de nas sh'a ri'i bus /
translated: Then Śāriputra🔽said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor dmigs pa med pa las mi 'byung /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor dmigs pa med pa las mi 'byung /
translated: The Venerable Subhūti said, “It does not arise from the absence of an objective support.🔽It does not arise from the absence of a thought.”

original: dmigs pa med par sems pa mi 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa med par sems pa mi 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning is as follows:

original: rmi lam na srog bcad pa dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid yin pas /
analyzed: rmi lam na srog bcad pa dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid yin pas /
translated: Since the killing in a dream is itself unreal,

original: de la dmigs pa'i sems ni dngos po med pa la dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i sems ni dngos po med pa la dmigs pa yin te /
translated: the thought that has it as an object is an unreal object.

original: de bas na de la rnam par smin pa lhag pa med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na de la rnam par smin pa lhag pa med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, there is no additional karmic maturation.”

original: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the Elder Subhūti

original: de de bzhin no shes sh'a ri'i bu'i tshig la rjes su yi rang bas ji skad bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de de bzhin no shes sh'a ri'i bu'i tshig la rjes su yi rang bas ji skad bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: agreed with the words of Śāriputra.

original: gal te dmigs pa med par las mi 'byung na /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa med par las mi 'byung na /
translated: If karma does not arise without an objective support,

original: gang khyod kyis 'on te sad pa'i tshe rnam par rtog na /
analyzed: gang khyod kyis 'on te sad pa'i tshe rnam par rtog na /
translated: then what you said earlier, “If you think that when you are awake

original: las de las sogs pa'am 'bri ba yod do zhes sngar smras pa de mi rigs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: las de las sogs pa'am 'bri ba yod do zhes sngar smras pa de mi rigs so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: that karma is either accumulated or diminished,” is unreasonable.

original: 'dir klan ka lhag ma ni gal te dmigs pa med par las mi 'byung na /
analyzed: 'dir klan ka lhag ma ni gal te dmigs pa med par las mi 'byung na /
translated: Here, the remaining objection is this: If karma does not occur without an object,

original: de lta na ni rmi lam na byas pa dmigs pa med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na ni rmi lam na byas pa dmigs pa med par 'gyur la /
translated: then in a dream, what is done would be without an object,

original: gnyid kyis ma log par ni byas pa ni dmigs pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba'i phyir rmi lam dang gnyid kyis ma log pa gnyis bye brag yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnyid kyis ma log par ni byas pa ni dmigs pa dang bcas par 'gyur ba'i phyir rmi lam dang gnyid kyis ma log pa gnyis bye brag yod par 'gyur te /
translated: and since what is done while not asleep would be with an object, there would be a difference between dreaming and not dreaming.

original: de lta na ni chos thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni chos thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In that case, the statement that all things are like a dream would be undermined.

original: de bas na klan ka de bstsal ba'i phyir gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis /🔽mthong ba dang thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par rig pa'i chos rnams la blo 'jug ste ma mthong ma thos /🔽bye brag ma phyed /
analyzed: de bas na klan ka de bstsal ba'i phyir gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis / mthong ba dang thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par rig pa'i chos rnams la blo 'jug ste ma mthong ma thos / bye brag ma phyed /
translated: Therefore, in order to respond to this objection, the elder Subhūti said:🔽The mind engages with phenomena that are seen, heard, distinguished, and cognized.🔽It does not engage with phenomena that are not seen, not heard,

original: rnam par ma rig pa'i chos la ni blo mi 'jug go //
analyzed: rnam par ma rig pa'i chos la ni blo mi 'jug go //
translated: not distinguished, and not cognized.

original: de la blo la la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: de la blo la la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: Among them, some minds grasp afflictions.

original: blo la la ni rnam par byang ba yongs su 'dzin to zhes bya ba gsungs te dmigs pa can du spyod pa gsar bu rnams /
analyzed: blo la la ni rnam par byang ba yongs su 'dzin to zhes bya ba gsungs te dmigs pa can du spyod pa gsar bu rnams /
translated: Those who practice with reference points, the beginners,

original: dngos po dag la don dam par yod dam med pa ma brtags par rmi lam dang / gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe yang /
analyzed: dngos po dag la don dam par yod dam med pa ma brtags par rmi lam dang / gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tshe yang /
translated: without examining whether things ultimately exist or not,🔽their minds engage in terms of what they see, hear, discern, and cognize,🔽whether awake or asleep.

original: mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i rjes su 'brang bas blo 'jug ste de de ltar blo 'jug pa na /
analyzed: mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i rjes su 'brang bas blo 'jug ste de de ltar blo 'jug pa na /
translated: When their minds engage in that way,

original: blo la la 'bras bu @240b med /
analyzed: blo la la 'bras bu @240b med /
translated: some minds have no result.

original: la la 'bras bu che /
analyzed: la la 'bras bu che /
translated: Some minds have great results.

original: la la 'bras bu chung /
analyzed: la la 'bras bu chung /
translated: Some minds have small results.

original: la la kun nas nyon mongs pa yongs su 'dzin /
analyzed: la la kun nas nyon mongs pa yongs su 'dzin /
translated: Some minds grasp at complete affliction.

original: la la yongs su mi 'dzin /
analyzed: la la yongs su mi 'dzin /
translated: Some minds do not grasp.

original: la la rnam par byang ba yongs su 'dzin /
analyzed: la la rnam par byang ba yongs su 'dzin /
translated: Some minds grasp at complete purification.🔽Some minds do not grasp.

original: la la mi 'dzin zhes bya bas ji skad bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: la la mi 'dzin zhes bya bas ji skad bstan par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What does this statement mean?

original: 'gro ba dang / dus dang sbyor ba dang / lus rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa dang / rgud pa dang / gnyid la sogs pa dang / rkyen dang bral ba'i dbang las 'gyur bar shes par bya ba'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang / dus dang sbyor ba dang / lus rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa dang / rgud pa dang / gnyid la sogs pa dang / rkyen dang bral ba'i dbang las 'gyur bar shes par bya ba'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It should be understood that they arise from the power of the separation of the continuum of consciousness from the body, and from the power of the separation of the body from the continuum of consciousness.🔽The Blessed One has said that all actions are separated and all intentions are separated.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor las thams cad dben pa dang sems pa thams cad dben pa'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs na zhes bya ba ci las dgongs she na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor las thams cad dben pa dang sems pa thams cad dben pa'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs na zhes bya ba ci las dgongs she na /
translated: What was the intention in that statement?

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir las rnams dang / sems pa dag ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa yin na /🔽de la ji ltar dmigs pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir las rnams dang / sems pa dag ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa yin na / de la ji ltar dmigs pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: Since it is said that all phenomena are separated by their intrinsic reality, actions and intentions are separated by their intrinsic reality.🔽How can they be investigated as having an object or not having an object?

original: dmigs pa med pa'o zhes brtag par bya snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'o zhes brtag par bya snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is what he is thinking.

original: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Then the elder Subhūti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni mtshan mar byas nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams ni mtshan mar byas nas /
translated: The Venerable Śāriputra said, “Venerable Subhūti, the childish ordinary beings, having taken signs as their basis,🔽formulate actions.”

original: las rnams mngon par 'du byed do zhes bya ba 'di'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: las rnams mngon par 'du byed do zhes bya ba 'di'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intention here is as follows:

original: skabs 'dis dmigs pa med par gzigs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen spo la ni mi bya'i dmigs pa can du spyod pa la bya'o //
analyzed: skabs 'dis dmigs pa med par gzigs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen spo la ni mi bya'i dmigs pa can du spyod pa la bya'o //
translated: This passage is not about the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who see without reference points, but about those who engage in conduct with reference points.

original: de bas na de dag gi blo'i rtog pa'i dbang gis dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang / dmigs pa med pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na de dag gi blo'i rtog pa'i dbang gis dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang / dmigs pa med pa bstan to //
translated: Therefore, in accordance with the power of their conceptual thoughts, they are taught to have reference points and not to have reference points.

original: de nas yang gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus /
analyzed: de nas yang gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus /
translated: Then again, the elder Śāriputra🔽said to the venerable Subhūti, “Venerable Subhūti, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva, in a dream, gives gifts, practices morality,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rmi lam na sbyin pa byin pa nas shes rab bsgoms zhes bya ba'i bar gyis klan ka gzhan dag smras te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rmi lam na sbyin pa byin pa nas shes rab bsgoms zhes bya ba'i bar gyis klan ka gzhan dag smras te /
translated: increases in patience, exerts vigor, enters concentration, and cultivates wisdom, and so on, up to ‘having cultivated wisdom,’ and if he sees a buddha, hears the Dharma, and engenders devotion, and so on, up to ‘engenders devotion,’ and if he gets up from his bed and teaches the Dharma to others, and so on, up to ‘teaches the Dharma to others,’ and if he sees the auspicious marks and signs of a buddha, and so on, up to ‘sees the auspicious marks and signs of a buddha,’ and if he sees the Tathāgata’s power, and so on, up to ‘sees the Tathāgata’s power,’ and if he sees the Tathāgata’s sphere, and so on, up to ‘sees the Tathāgata’s sphere,’ and if he sees the Tathāgata’s abode, and so on, up to ‘sees the Tathāgata’s abode,’ and if he sees the Tathāgata’s conduct, and so on, up to ‘sees the Tathāgata’s conduct,’ and if he sees the Tathāgata’s miracles, and so on, up to ‘sees the Tathāgata’s miracles,’ and if he sees the Tathāgata’s light, and so on, up to ‘sees the Tathāgata’s light,’ and if he sees the Tathāgata’s wisdom, and so on, up to ‘sees the Tathāgata’s wisdom,’ and if he sees the Tathāgata’s body, and so on, up to ‘sees the Tathāgata’s body,’ and if he sees the Tathāgata’s voice,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gsar bu lta re zhig zhog la byang chub sems dpa' gang rgyud yongs su smin pa zhig gal te rmi lam na sbyin pa sbyin na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gsar bu lta re zhig zhog la byang chub sems dpa' gang rgyud yongs su smin pa zhig gal te rmi lam na sbyin pa sbyin na /
translated: If a bodhisattva whose mindstream is completely ripe gives gifts in a dream,

original: de la ni rmi lam dang gnyid kyis ma log pa gnyis mtshungs te /
analyzed: de la ni rmi lam dang gnyid kyis ma log pa gnyis mtshungs te /
translated: then in that case, being awake and not being awake are the same.

original: gnyid kyis ma log pa dang 'dra bar sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su yi rang ba dang / yongs su bsngo ba la sogs pa legs par byas par @241a * //
analyzed: gnyid kyis ma log pa dang 'dra bar sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su yi rang ba dang / yongs su bsngo ba la sogs pa legs par byas par @241a * //
translated: Just as if one were not asleep, one would be well-prepared with rejoicing in giving and so on, and with complete dedication and so on.

original: 'gyur ram zhes de skad bstan to //
analyzed: 'gyur ram zhes de skad bstan to //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, this bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya, and so on,

original: de'i tshe tshogs pa'i 'dul ba'i skye bo rnams la phan gdags pa'am /
analyzed: de'i tshe tshogs pa'i 'dul ba'i skye bo rnams la phan gdags pa'am /
translated: at that time, in order to benefit the assembled disciples,

original: bdag dang bsam pa mthun par bstan pa'i phyir des klan ka de'i lan btab pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bsam pa mthun par bstan pa'i phyir des klan ka de'i lan btab pa'o //
translated: or in order to teach in accordance with his own intention, he answered that objection.

original: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, what do you think?

original: gang 'di byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa zhes bya ba'i ming lan glon nam /
analyzed: gang 'di byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa zhes bya ba'i ming lan glon nam /
translated: Is it the name Bodhisattva, great being Maitreya that answers,

original: 'on te gzugs lan glon zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs lan glon zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: or is it form that answers?

original: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu'i klan ka dmigs pa dang bcas par sngar smras pa'i lan btab ste /🔽'di ltar dmigs pa med par gzigs shing /
analyzed: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu'i klan ka dmigs pa dang bcas par sngar smras pa'i lan btab ste / 'di ltar dmigs pa med par gzigs shing /
translated: Thus, he answers the objection of the elder Śāriputra, who previously spoke with reference to an object.

original: rgyud yongs su smin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni rmi lam dang gnyid kyis ma log pa gnyi ga na yang sbyin pa la sogs pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / yongs su bsngo ba la sogs pa rmi lam gyi dngos po bzhin du yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: rgyud yongs su smin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni rmi lam dang gnyid kyis ma log pa gnyi ga na yang sbyin pa la sogs pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang / yongs su bsngo ba la sogs pa rmi lam gyi dngos po bzhin du yod pa ma yin na /
translated: Thus, he sees without reference, and to a bodhisattva whose continuum is completely ripened, whether awake or asleep, there is no giving, etc., rejoicing, and complete dedication, etc., like the entities of a dream.

original: de yod pa ma yin par mi shes pa lta bur glan ka dris so zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de yod pa ma yin par mi shes pa lta bur glan ka dris so zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Since he does not know that they do not exist, he answers with an objection.

original: stong pa nyid du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of emptiness.

original: gang zag dang chos med na /
analyzed: gang zag dang chos med na /
translated: If there is no person and no dharma,

original: byams pa 'di ni lan ldon par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ci las bsams te smra zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: byams pa 'di ni lan ldon par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ci las bsams te smra zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “This love will be repaid” means “What is it that you are saying?”

original: glo bur gyi ming tsam du bzung ste smra'am /
analyzed: glo bur gyi ming tsam du bzung ste smra'am /
translated: Are you speaking by grasping at a mere temporary name?

original: 'on te gzugs la sogs pa'am de dag gi stong pa nyid lan ldon par 'gyur zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te gzugs la sogs pa'am de dag gi stong pa nyid lan ldon par 'gyur zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: Or is it the emptiness of form, etc. that will be repaid?

original: chos thams cad ni gnyis su med cing /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni gnyis su med cing /
translated: All phenomena are nondual

original: gnyis su byar med de tha mi dad de gcig tu gnas pa yin na /
analyzed: gnyis su byar med de tha mi dad de gcig tu gnas pa yin na /
translated: and indivisible, and they abide as one.

original: 'di la su zhig ci zhig su la lan ldon te /
analyzed: 'di la su zhig ci zhig su la lan ldon te /
translated: So who will repay what to whom?

original: su zhig gang gis lan ldon zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: su zhig gang gis lan ldon zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is the meaning of “Who will repay whom with what?”🔽“Son of noble family, are the phenomena that you have explained like this realized by you?”

original: rigs kyi bu chos de dag ji skad du bshad pa de bzhin du chos de dag khyod kyis mngon sum du byas sam zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu chos de dag ji skad du bshad pa de bzhin du chos de dag khyod kyis mngon sum du byas sam zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad gsungs pa ste /
translated: This is what the elder Śāriputra said:

original: gal te khyod kyis chos de dag de bzhin du mngon sum du byas na /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyis chos de dag de bzhin du mngon sum du byas na /
translated: “If you have realized those phenomena like that,

original: de lta na ni mngon sum du byed pa po dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang / mngon sum du byed pa tha dad du dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni mngon sum du byed pa po dang / mngon sum du bya ba dang / mngon sum du byed pa tha dad du dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In that case, the one who perceives, the perception, and the object of perception would be observed as distinct.

original: de bas na 'phags pa byams @241b pas slar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa byams @241b pas slar gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, the noble Maitreya states:

original: chos de dag ji ltar bdag smras pa de ltar chos de dag mngon sum du byas pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos de dag ji ltar bdag smras pa de ltar chos de dag mngon sum du byas pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Those phenomena are not perceived in the way that I have described them.”

original: mngon sum du byed pa'i dus na /
analyzed: mngon sum du byed pa'i dus na /
translated: At the time of perception,

original: chos de dag dmigs su med de /
analyzed: chos de dag dmigs su med de /
translated: those phenomena are not observed.

original: de dag brjod du yang med na /
analyzed: de dag brjod du yang med na /
translated: Since they are inexpressible,

original: ji ltar smra bar bya zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar smra bar bya zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: how can they be described?”🔽“Do you see any phenomenon that is called an arhat?”

original: chos gang gis dgra bcom par brjod pa'i chos de khyod kyis yang dag par rjes su mthong ngam zhes bya ba zhes gsungs pa dang / gnas gyur pa ma gtogs par dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba'i chos gang yang med do snyam nas /
analyzed: chos gang gis dgra bcom par brjod pa'i chos de khyod kyis yang dag par rjes su mthong ngam zhes bya ba zhes gsungs pa dang / gnas gyur pa ma gtogs par dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba'i chos gang yang med do snyam nas /
translated: Thinking, “Apart from the transformation, there is no phenomenon called an arhat,”

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes slar gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma lags so zhes slar gsol to //
translated: he replied, “No, Blessed One.”

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bgyid cing zhes zhus pa ci las dgongs she na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bgyid cing zhes zhus pa ci las dgongs she na /
translated: What is the meaning of the question, Blessed One, how do Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas complete the six perfections?

original: gal te chos thams cad dmigs su med na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad dmigs su med na /
translated: If all phenomena are not perceived,

original: gang dag gi don du su zhig ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed ces zhus pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag gi don du su zhig ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byed ces zhus pa'o //
translated: for the sake of whom and how does anyone complete the six perfections?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can yongs su 'dzin pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can yongs su 'dzin pa'i tshe /
translated: Then, the Blessed One, when grasping sentient beings,

original: snying rje'i dbang gis kun rdzob tu dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i 'du shes can du 'gyur bar bstan nas /
analyzed: snying rje'i dbang gis kun rdzob tu dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i 'du shes can du 'gyur bar bstan nas /
translated: having shown that through the power of compassion one becomes one who perceives conventionally,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i thabs rab tu dbye ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba dag bstan te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i thabs rab tu dbye ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba dag bstan te /
translated: taught the method of completing the six perfections, and the purification of the Buddha-fields.

original: de dag thams cad kyang don gsal bas rnam par ma phye'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang don gsal bas rnam par ma phye'o //
translated: All of those are not distinguished because of the clarity of meaning.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam 'di dag thams cad kyang thams cad la yod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam 'di dag thams cad kyang thams cad la yod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: And all these bodhisattva vows do not exist for everyone,

original: so so'i bsam pa tha dad pa ji lta ba bzhin du smon lam dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: so so'i bsam pa tha dad pa ji lta ba bzhin du smon lam dag 'byung ste /
translated: but vows arise in accordance with the different intentions of individuals.

original: kha cig ni rnam pa thams cad du smon lam btab kyang /
analyzed: kha cig ni rnam pa thams cad du smon lam btab kyang /
translated: Some, even though they have made vows in every way,

original: phyis sems can rnams kyi las kyi dbang gis cung zad mi 'grub pa yang yod do //
analyzed: phyis sems can rnams kyi las kyi dbang gis cung zad mi 'grub pa yang yod do //
translated: later do not accomplish even a little due to the power of the karma of sentient beings.

original: gang g'a'i lha mo lung bstan pa yang go sla'o //
analyzed: gang g'a'i lha mo lung bstan pa yang go sla'o //
translated: The prophecy of the Goddess of the Ganges is easy to understand.

original: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum sgom pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun sgom pa la ji ltar byang chub sems dpas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rnam par grol ba spangs te /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum sgom pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun sgom pa la ji ltar byang chub sems dpas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rnam par grol ba spangs te /
translated: Then the elder Subhuti asked how the bodhisattva, in cultivating the three doors of liberation and the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, should cultivate abandoning the liberation of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: bsgom pa zhes bya ba zhus pa'o //🔽de'i @242a * //
analyzed: bsgom pa zhes bya ba zhus pa'o // de'i @242a * //
translated: which is called meditation.

original: 'og tu bshad pa'i 'gres ni stong pa zhes bya bar so sor brtag par bya'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'og tu bshad pa'i 'gres ni stong pa zhes bya bar so sor brtag par bya'o zhes bya'o //
translated: After that, the pattern of explanation should be analyzed as emptiness and so on.

original: stong pa nyid kyi lhag mthong mngon par 'phel ba'i dus na ni ci nas kyang de ltar so sor brtags nas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi lhag mthong mngon par 'phel ba'i dus na ni ci nas kyang de ltar so sor brtags nas /
translated: When the insight of emptiness is increasing, one should investigate in such a way that, having investigated in that way,

original: sems g-yeng bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar so sor brtag par bya ste zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems g-yeng bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar so sor brtag par bya ste zhes bya'o //
translated: one’s mind does not become distracted.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi dus na ni sems mi g-yeng ba dang ldan pas chos gang mngon sum du bya ba'i chos de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi dus na ni sems mi g-yeng ba dang ldan pas chos gang mngon sum du bya ba'i chos de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste zhes bya'o //
translated: When the concentration of emptiness is present, one’s mind is not distracted. Therefore, one does not see any phenomenon as something to be realized.

original: de bzhin nyid thob pa'i dus na ni des yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas mngon sum du mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin par mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i mtha' la thug pa'i
analyzed: de bzhin nyid thob pa'i dus na ni des yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas mngon sum du mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin par mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i mtha' la thug pa'i
translated: When the attainment of suchness is present, one does not see anything as something to be realized, and so on, up to: one sees that it is neither conjoined nor disjoined.

original: bar gyi gzhung gis bstan te /
analyzed: bar gyi gzhung gis bstan te /
translated: This is taught by the passage.

original: dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa mnyam pas mnyam pa rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa mnyam pas mnyam pa rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du bstan pa'o //
translated: The equality of the object of apprehension and the apprehending subject is taught to be non-conceptuality.

original: des chos de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas mngon sum du mi byed do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des chos de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas mngon sum du mi byed do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Since he does not see that dharma, he does not actualize it.

original: chos ma mthong ba nyid /
analyzed: chos ma mthong ba nyid /
translated: This is the non-seeing of dharma.

original: de'i mngon sum du mi byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de'i mngon sum du mi byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: This is the cause of his not actualizing it.

original: gal te mthong na de lta na ni mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: gal te mthong na de lta na ni mngon sum du byed do //
translated: If he sees it, then he would actualize it.

original: 'o na mngon sum byas na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mngon sum byas na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if he actualizes it, what is the problem?

original: des nyan thos ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des nyan thos ltar yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then he would actualize the limit of reality like a śrāvaka.

original: de lta na ni de'i rnam par grol ba la sbyor bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni de'i rnam par grol ba la sbyor bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And then he would be engaged in liberation.

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po stong pa nyid la gnas la stong pa nyid mngon sum du yang mi bgyid pa lags zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po stong pa nyid la gnas la stong pa nyid mngon sum du yang mi bgyid pa lags zhes bya ba la /
translated: How is it that the bodhisattva mahāsattva, while abiding in emptiness, does not actualize emptiness?

original: stong pa nyid ni chos gang mngon sum du bya ba de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba'i gnas su bstan to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni chos gang mngon sum du bya ba de yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba'i gnas su bstan to //
translated: Emptiness is taught in the passage: “He does not see that dharma which is to be actualized as emptiness.”

original: yang chos de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas mngon sum du mi byed do zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid mngon sum du mi byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: yang chos de yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas mngon sum du mi byed do zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid mngon sum du mi byed pa bstan to //
translated: Also, because he does not see that dharma, he does not actualize it teaches the non-actualization of emptiness.

original: de la gnas kyang de mngon sum du yang mi byed ces bya ba 'di ji ltar shes par rung zhes zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa snga ma'i dbang gis 'gyur ba bstan pa /
analyzed: de la gnas kyang de mngon sum du yang mi byed ces bya ba 'di ji ltar shes par rung zhes zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa snga ma'i dbang gis 'gyur ba bstan pa /
translated: There, having asked, How is it proper to know this, that he abides in that but does not actualize it? the Bhagavān taught the transformation by the power of the former thought.

original: rab 'byor gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang @242b ldan pa'i stong pa nyid la so sor rtog pa na mngon sum du so sor mi rtog go zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang @242b ldan pa'i stong pa nyid la so sor rtog pa na mngon sum du so sor mi rtog go zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva mahāsattvas are discerning emptiness endowed with the most sublime of all aspects, they do not discern actualization.

original: stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa snga ma nyid kyis /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa snga ma nyid kyis /
translated: The statement, One should cultivate emptiness, by the former thought alone,

original: nyan thos 'gog pa mngon sum du bya'o snyam pa'i bsam pa lta bur /
analyzed: nyan thos 'gog pa mngon sum du bya'o snyam pa'i bsam pa lta bur /
translated: is like the thought, The śrāvakas should actualize cessation.

original: stong pa nyid mngon sum du bya'o snyam pa'i dgongs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' de la mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid mngon sum du bya'o snyam pa'i dgongs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' de la mi mnga' ste /
translated: The thought “I will realize emptiness” does not occur to the bodhisattva.

original: stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o snyam pa ni rab tu mthun par bya'o snyam du dgongs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bsgom par bya'o snyam pa ni rab tu mthun par bya'o snyam du dgongs pa nyid yin no //
translated: The thought “I will cultivate emptiness” is the thought that it is to be cultivated in the sense of being in harmony with it.

original: de bas na phyis kyang bsgom pa 'ba' zhig yin gyi mngon sum du byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na phyis kyang bsgom pa 'ba' zhig yin gyi mngon sum du byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, it is said that later on, it is only cultivation, not realization.

original: de bas na 'di ni yongs su 'dris par bya ba'i dus yin gyi 'di ni mngon sum du bya ba'i dus ma yin no zhes bya bar rtog go zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni yongs su 'dris par bya ba'i dus yin gyi 'di ni mngon sum du bya ba'i dus ma yin no zhes bya bar rtog go zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the time is one of thorough familiarization, not of realization.

original: gang stong pa nyid la yongs su 'dris par yang byed la /
analyzed: gang stong pa nyid la yongs su 'dris par yang byed la /
translated: That is, one thoroughly familiarizes oneself with emptiness,

original: mngon sum du yang mi byed pa de ni yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pa nyid kyi mthu yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum du yang mi byed pa de ni yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pa nyid kyi mthu yin no //
translated: but does not realize it. This is the power of the knowledge of thorough familiarization.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa nyid du sems dmigs la 'dogs te zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi sems yin gyi /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa nyid du sems dmigs la 'dogs te zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba rang bzhin gyi sems yin gyi /
translated: This is the natural mind called the knowledge of thorough acquaintance.

original: de mnyam par bzhag pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de mnyam par bzhag pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not concentrated.

original: de bas na skad cig de'i tshe zhi gnas ni med do //
analyzed: de bas na skad cig de'i tshe zhi gnas ni med do //
translated: Therefore, at that moment there is no serenity.

original: zhi gnas med pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam mi 'byung ngo zhes ston to //
analyzed: zhi gnas med pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam mi 'byung ngo zhes ston to //
translated: And, since there is no serenity, the supramundane path does not arise.

original: da ni yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pa /
analyzed: da ni yongs su 'dris pa'i shes pa /
translated: Now, the knowledge of thorough acquaintance

original: dus dang dus ma yin pa shes pa ston te 'di ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dus dang dus ma yin pa shes pa ston te 'di ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: teaches the knowledge of the right and wrong times.

original: skyes bu dpa' bo'i dpe dang / bya'i dpe dang / 'phong gi slob dpon gyi dpe dag kyang gzhung dang sbyar te gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dpa' bo'i dpe dang / bya'i dpe dang / 'phong gi slob dpon gyi dpe dag kyang gzhung dang sbyar te gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The examples of the hero, the bird, and the master archer should be understood as applied to the text.

original: bcom ldan 'das ngo mtshar to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ngo mtshar to //
translated: The Blessed One said, Excellent, excellent, Subhuti!

original: bde bar gshegs pa ngo mtshar to zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mthong ba rnams bar ma dor sems zhum pa'i rgyus /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa ngo mtshar to zhes bya ba ni de ltar chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mthong ba rnams bar ma dor sems zhum pa'i rgyus /
translated: The phrase Sugata, it is amazing refers to the fact that those who see all phenomena as emptiness do not become discouraged in the middle.

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum bsgom zhing nyan thos dang rang byang chub tu ltung bar ma gyur pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum bsgom zhing nyan thos dang rang byang chub tu ltung bar ma gyur pa ste /
translated: The phrase O Sugata, it is amazing! means that those who see all phenomena as emptiness do not fall into the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha stages by cultivating the three meditative stabilizations due to the cause of mental slackness in the interim.

original: ngo mtshar che'o zhes gsol pa'o //🔽rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can thams cad yongs su ma btang ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dir sems @243a * //
analyzed: ngo mtshar che'o zhes gsol pa'o // rab 'byor 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can thams cad yongs su ma btang ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dir sems @243a * //
translated: It is amazing!

original: zhum par mi 'gyur ba'i rgyu ston to //
analyzed: zhum par mi 'gyur ba'i rgyu ston to //
translated: The Blessed One teaches here the cause of not becoming mentally slack, beginning with the phrase Subhūti, it is because bodhisattva great beings do not abandon any sentient being.

original: 'di la yang 'gres bdun te /
analyzed: 'di la yang 'gres bdun te /
translated: Here also there are seven parallels, beginning with the phrase Subhūti, it is because bodhisattva great beings do not abandon any sentient being.

original: dam pa ma yin pa'i chos la 'jug pa'i 'gres dang / dmigs par lta ba'i 'gres dang / sems phyin ci log gi 'gres dang / gang zag dang chos su rnam par rtog pa'i 'gres dang / mtshan ma'i 'gres dang / smon lam gyi 'gres dang /
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa'i chos la 'jug pa'i 'gres dang / dmigs par lta ba'i 'gres dang / sems phyin ci log gi 'gres dang / gang zag dang chos su rnam par rtog pa'i 'gres dang / mtshan ma'i 'gres dang / smon lam gyi 'gres dang /
translated: the pattern of engaging in non-dharmic activities, the pattern of viewing objects, the pattern of distorted thoughts, the pattern of conceptualizing persons and phenomena, the pattern of signs, the pattern of aspirations,

original: byang chub sems dpa' la dri ba'i 'gres so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la dri ba'i 'gres so //
translated: and the pattern of questioning the bodhisattvas.

original: de la sems can 'di dag ni dam pa ma yin pa'i chos la dam par 'du shes pas bslus par gyur pa dag ste /
