analyzed: de la sems can 'di dag ni dam pa ma yin pa'i chos la dam par 'du shes pas bslus par gyur pa dag ste /
translated: Among them, these beings are deceived by perceiving non-dharmas as dharmas.🔽I should not abandon those ignorant beings.

original: bdag gis sems can mi shes pa de dag yongs su gtang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dag gis snying rje mngon par bskyed de /
analyzed: bdag gis sems can mi shes pa de dag yongs su gtang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' dag gis snying rje mngon par bskyed de /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattvas generate compassion.

original: sems can thams cad mi gtong bar yid la byed pa'i rgyus /
analyzed: sems can thams cad mi gtong bar yid la byed pa'i rgyus /
translated: By the cause of keeping in mind not abandoning all beings,

original: bar ma dor zhum par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bar ma dor zhum par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: they do not become discouraged in the middle.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du mi byed pa ni 'gres dang po'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon sum du mi byed pa ni 'gres dang po'o //
translated: Not actualizing the limit of reality is the first pattern.

original: sems can 'di dag ni yun ring po nas bdag dang / sems can la sogs par dmigs par lta bar spyod spyod pa dag ste /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni yun ring po nas bdag dang / sems can la sogs par dmigs par lta bar spyod spyod pa dag ste /
translated: These sentient beings have long been engaged in the practice of the view that observes a self, sentient beings, and so on.

original: de dag gi lta ba de bdag gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos bshad pas spang par bya'o snyam du sems bskyed pa'i dbang gis zhum par mi 'gyur ba ni 'gres gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi lta ba de bdag gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos bshad pas spang par bya'o snyam du sems bskyed pa'i dbang gis zhum par mi 'gyur ba ni 'gres gnyis pa'o //
translated: I will fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood and then, by teaching the Dharma, I will eliminate their view.

original: sems can 'di dag ni yun ring po nas rtag pa dang / bde ba dang sdug pa dang / bdag tu 'du shes pas phyin ci log rnam pa bzhis sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa dag ste /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni yun ring po nas rtag pa dang / bde ba dang sdug pa dang / bdag tu 'du shes pas phyin ci log rnam pa bzhis sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa dag ste /
translated: These sentient beings have long been engaged in the practice of the four errors, which are the errors of mind that arise from the notions of permanence, happiness, purity, and self.

original: bdag gis de dag de las bzlog par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'gres gsum pa'o //🔽sems can 'di dag ni yun ring po nas /
analyzed: bdag gis de dag de las bzlog par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'gres gsum pa'o // sems can 'di dag ni yun ring po nas /
translated: I will turn them away from those.

original: sems can du rnam par rtog pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams su rnam par rtog pa la spyod spyod pa dag ste /
analyzed: sems can du rnam par rtog pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams su rnam par rtog pa la spyod spyod pa dag ste /
translated: These sentient beings have long been engaged in the practice of the concepts of sentient beings and the concepts of phenomena such as form.

original: de dag gi don du bdag gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: de dag gi don du bdag gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: For their sake, having fully awakened to highest genuine full Awakening,

original: stong pa nyid kyi chos bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi chos bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: I will teach the doctrine of emptiness.

original: sems can 'di dag ni yun ring po nas mtshan ma la spyod spyod pa bud med dang / skyes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang / gzugs la sogs pa chos @243b rnams kyi mtshan ma dag la spyod spyod pa dag ste /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni yun ring po nas mtshan ma la spyod spyod pa bud med dang / skyes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang / gzugs la sogs pa chos @243b rnams kyi mtshan ma dag la spyod spyod pa dag ste /
translated: These sentient beings have long been engaged in the practice of signs, the signs of women and men, and the signs of phenomena such as form.

original: de dag gi don du bdag gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: de dag gi don du bdag gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: For their sake, having fully awakened to highest genuine full Awakening,

original: mtshan ma med pa'i chos bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i chos bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lnga pa'o //
translated: I will teach the doctrine of signlessness.

original: de bzhin du sems can 'di dag ni yun ring po nas smon lam la spyod spyod pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can 'di dag ni yun ring po nas smon lam la spyod spyod pa /
translated: Similarly, these sentient beings have long been engaged in the practice of vows,

original: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba la sogs pa'i don dang / gzugs bzang po la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi don du smon lam 'debs pa dag ste /
analyzed: brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba la sogs pa'i don dang / gzugs bzang po la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi don du smon lam 'debs pa dag ste /
translated: making vows for the sake of Śakra, Brahmā, the Lokapālas, and so on, and for the sake of such phenomena as good physical appearance.

original: de dag gi don du bdag gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas smon pa med pa'i chos bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi don du bdag gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas smon pa med pa'i chos bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni drug pa'o //
translated: For their sake, having fully awakened to perfect buddhahood, I will teach the Dharma of wishlessness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la dri ba la yang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la dri ba la yang /
translated: And when asked about the bodhisattvas,

original: gal te de dag gis de skad dris pa la stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / dngos po med pa dag / de ltar khyod kyis legs par bsgom par bya'o zhes de dag nyid bzung nas lan 'debs na /
analyzed: gal te de dag gis de skad dris pa la stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / dngos po med pa dag / de ltar khyod kyis legs par bsgom par bya'o zhes de dag nyid bzung nas lan 'debs na /
translated: if they reply, “You should cultivate emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, non-conditioning, non-arising, and non-existence in that way,”

original: lung bstan pa yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lung bstan pa yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya ste /
translated: it should be known that they are giving a prediction.

original: yongs su 'dris pa shes pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'dris pa shes pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have realized the characteristic of the knowledge of thorough familiarity.

original: gal te de dag gis de skad du dris pa la stong pa nyid sgom pa la sogs pa spong zhing /
analyzed: gal te de dag gis de skad du dris pa la stong pa nyid sgom pa la sogs pa spong zhing /
translated: If they reply to that question by rejecting the cultivation of emptiness and so on,

original: de dag bsgom par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de dag bsgom par mi bya ste /
translated: saying “Those should not be cultivated,”

original: de dag mthong la rnam pa gzhan du mi rtag pa la sogs par bsgom par bya'o zhes lan 'debs na /
analyzed: de dag mthong la rnam pa gzhan du mi rtag pa la sogs par bsgom par bya'o zhes lan 'debs na /
translated: But if he replies, “You should see them and meditate on impermanence and so on in another way,”

original: lung bstan pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lung bstan pa ma yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: you should know that he has not been prophesied.🔽Thus, just as the irreversible bodhisattva has ascended the irreversible stage,

original: de ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpas phyir mi ldog pa'i sa non pa ltar zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sa brgyad pa thob pa phyir mi ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpas phyir mi ldog pa'i sa non pa ltar zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sa brgyad pa thob pa phyir mi ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: just as the one who has attained the eighth stage becomes irreversible,

original: sa brgyad pa thob pa de bzhin du de dag legs par yongs su 'dris par byas nas bsrabs pa'i sa non pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sa brgyad pa thob pa de bzhin du de dag legs par yongs su 'dris par byas nas bsrabs pa'i sa non pa ma yin te /
translated: and just as the one who has attained the eighth stage has ascended the stage of thinning,🔽you should know that he has not ascended the stage of thinning.

original: de tsam du yongs su smin pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de tsam du yongs su smin pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that he is not so fully matured.

original: sa gnyis pa nas bzung nas sa bdun pa'i bar ni bsrabs pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: sa gnyis pa nas bzung nas sa bdun pa'i bar ni bsrabs pa'i sa'o //
translated: The second stage up to the seventh stage is the stage of thinning.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang gis slar mi ldog par 'gyur ba'i rnam grangs mchis sam zhes bya ba ni gal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gis slar mi ldog par 'gyur ba'i rnam grangs mchis sam zhes bya ba ni gal te /
translated: Blessed One, is there a category of irreversible bodhisattvas?

original: de phyir mi ldog pa'i sa brgyad pa ma thob kyang /
analyzed: de phyir mi ldog pa'i sa brgyad pa ma thob kyang /
translated: If he has not attained the eighth stage of irreversibility,

original: legs par yongs su 'dris par byas nas phyir mi ldog pa'i lan @244a * //
analyzed: legs par yongs su 'dris par byas nas phyir mi ldog pa'i lan @244a * //
translated: Having thoroughly familiarized oneself with that, one will not turn back.🔽

original: ldon na / phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ram zhes bstan pa'o //🔽yongs su sbyong bar bgyis pa'i sa'am /
analyzed: ldon na / phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ram zhes bstan pa'o // yongs su sbyong bar bgyis pa'i sa'am /
translated: Having thoroughly familiarized themselves, if they give the answer of nonretrogression, do they become nonregressing because they possess the characteristics of nonretrogression?

original: yongs su sbyong ba bgyid pa ma lags pa'i sa yang mi mngon te zhes bya ba ni sa 'og ma rnams bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su sbyong ba bgyid pa ma lags pa'i sa yang mi mngon te zhes bya ba ni sa 'og ma rnams bstan pa'o //
translated: The stage of thorough purification, or the stage of thorough purification, is not evident.🔽Those bodhisattva-mahāsattvas are few.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni nyung ngo zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi phyir spyod pa mang du zin kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni nyung ngo zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi phyir spyod pa mang du zin kyang /
translated: Although there are many bodhisattvas practicing for enlightenment,

original: 'di ltar sa brgyad pa ma thob kyang yongs su 'dris pa legs par bsgoms pa'i byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa'i lan ldon par 'gyur ba de dag ni nyung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa brgyad pa ma thob kyang yongs su 'dris pa legs par bsgoms pa'i byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa'i lan ldon par 'gyur ba de dag ni nyung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: in this way, even though they have not attained the eighth stage, those bodhisattvas who have well cultivated thorough familiarity and will give the answer of nonretrogression are few. This is the meaning.

original: yongs su sbyong ba'i sa yang rung /
analyzed: yongs su sbyong ba'i sa yang rung /
translated: The stage of thorough purification, or

original: yongs su sbyong ba ma yin pa'i sa yang rung zhes bya ba ni sa 'og ma rnams bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su sbyong ba ma yin pa'i sa yang rung zhes bya ba ni sa 'og ma rnams bstan pa'o //
translated: The stage that is not completely purified is the lower stages.

original: de nas yang bar skabs nas byung ba phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid dang bdud kyi las rnams dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyang go sla'o //
analyzed: de nas yang bar skabs nas byung ba phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid dang bdud kyi las rnams dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyang go sla'o //
translated: Then, the characteristics of irreversibility, the works of Mara, and the spiritual friends are easy to understand.

original: rab 'byor nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin du thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rab 'byor nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin du thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom has the characteristic of being unattached like space. This means that it has the characteristic of being unobstructed like space.

original: sngar ni bdud kyi las la sogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa bstan to //🔽de ni rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mtshan nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: sngar ni bdud kyi las la sogs pas thogs pa dang bcas pa bstan to // de ni rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mtshan nyid med pa ste /
translated: Previously, it was taught that it is obstructed by the works of Mara, etc.🔽Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is without characteristics.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid gang yang med do zhes bya bas thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid bka' stsal te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid gang yang med do zhes bya bas thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid bka' stsal te /
translated: It has no characteristics of the perfection of wisdom at all. Thus, it is said to have the characteristic of being unobstructed.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan gang gi mtshan nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan gang gi mtshan nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not the defining characteristic of anything else.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid kyang ci yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid kyang ci yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the defining characteristic of the perfection of wisdom anything at all.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: It is not a non-entity.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis dben pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis dben pa /
translated: Subhūti, all phenomena are isolated by their very nature.🔽All phenomena are empty of their very nature.

original: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i chos rnams kyis dben zhing bral ba ni yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa'o zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i chos rnams kyis dben zhing bral ba ni yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: This shows that the thoroughly established nature is the isolation and separation from all phenomena that are imputations.

original: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: It is the very essence of all phenomena.

original: de bas na de dag ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na de dag ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, it is the meaning of “they are empty of their very nature.”

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis @244b dben la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis @244b dben la /
translated: Blessed One, if all phenomena are isolated from all phenomena,

original: chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis stong na /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis stong na /
translated: and all phenomena are empty of all phenomena,

original: bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba ji ltar mchis par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad zhus te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba ji ltar mchis par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad zhus te /
translated: The Blessed One, how is it that sentient beings are defiled and purified?

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis dben la stong na phyis dben par byar yang med la stong par byar yang med de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis dben la stong na phyis dben par byar yang med la stong par byar yang med de /
translated: The Blessed One, if all phenomena are isolated by their very essence and empty, then later they are not to be made isolated and not to be made empty.

original: de ltar gyur na dben pa dang stong pa de dag ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na dben pa dang stong pa de dag ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur /
translated: If that is the case, how could those who are isolated and empty become defiled?

original: ji ltar yang rnam par byang bar 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yang rnam par byang bar 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: How could they also become purified?

original: de skad ces zhus pa dang / rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: de skad ces zhus pa dang / rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to Subhūti, Subhūti, what do you think?🔽Have these sentient beings been engaging in the view of 'I' and the view of 'mine' for a long time?

original: sems can 'di dag yun ring po nas ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa la spyod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag yun ring po nas ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa la spyod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught by the above and so forth.

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis dben zhing ngo bo nyid kyis stong du zin kyang /
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis dben zhing ngo bo nyid kyis stong du zin kyang /
translated: Although all phenomena are isolated by their very essence and empty by their very essence,

original: byis pa rnams de dag dben pa dang / stong pa nyid du mi shes te /🔽de dag gis mi shes pa'i nyes pas phung po lnga la sogs pa'i chos rnams la /
analyzed: byis pa rnams de dag dben pa dang / stong pa nyid du mi shes te / de dag gis mi shes pa'i nyes pas phung po lnga la sogs pa'i chos rnams la /
translated: The childish do not understand that they are empty and void.🔽Because of the fault of not understanding,

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pas chags par 'gyur /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pas chags par 'gyur /
translated: they are attached to the dharmas of the five aggregates, etc., through the grasping of “I” and “mine.”

original: chags pas bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa la sogs pa mngon par 'du byed pa rtsom mo //
analyzed: chags pas bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa la sogs pa mngon par 'du byed pa rtsom mo //
translated: Through attachment, they initiate the creation of merit, demerit, etc.

original: de'i dbang gis sems can rnams 'khor bar mtshams sbyor zhing 'khor te /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis sems can rnams 'khor bar mtshams sbyor zhing 'khor te /
translated: Through the power of that, sentient beings are connected to and revolve in cyclic existence.

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur te /
translated: They are defiled by the defilement of the afflictions and the defilement of karma.

original: de ltar mi shes pa'i nyes pas kun nas nyon mongs pa yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar mi shes pa'i nyes pas kun nas nyon mongs pa yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the fault of not understanding is the existence of defilement.

original: de dag kyang phyis gang gi tshe dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnyed nas mnyan pa dang / bsams pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis /
analyzed: de dag kyang phyis gang gi tshe dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnyed nas mnyan pa dang / bsams pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis /
translated: Later, when they find a spiritual friend, through the power of listening, reflection, etc.,

original: dben pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: dben pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: When one realizes the characteristic of emptiness, the characteristic of isolation,

original: ji skad smos pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa mi skye ba'i phyir rim gyis kun brtags pa'i chos rnams yongs su bzlog pas rnam par byang ba yang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji skad smos pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa mi skye ba'i phyir rim gyis kun brtags pa'i chos rnams yongs su bzlog pas rnam par byang ba yang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: then, because the afflictions mentioned above do not arise, purification also exists, since the imagined dharmas are gradually eliminated.

original: de'i 'og tu gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la spyod pa med par brjod pas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la spyod pa med par brjod pas /
translated: After that, since all dharmas such as form are said to be without practice,

original: bshad pa 'di la spyad pa don med do snyam du sems pa rnams kyi dgos pa de bstsal ba'i phyir 'og @245a * //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di la spyad pa don med do snyam du sems pa rnams kyi dgos pa de bstsal ba'i phyir 'og @245a * //
translated: those who think that this explanation is meaningless should be told that the purpose of this is as follows.

original: nas bsod nams mang ba dang / de'i rgyu gsungs te /
analyzed: nas bsod nams mang ba dang / de'i rgyu gsungs te /
translated: The increase in merit and its cause are taught below.

original: bsod nams mang du 'phel ba de dang / de'i rgyu yang nor bu rin po che'i dpes gzhung nyid las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams mang du 'phel ba de dang / de'i rgyu yang nor bu rin po che'i dpes gzhung nyid las rig par bya'o //
translated: The increase in merit and its cause should be understood from the text itself through the example of a precious jewel.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang yid la bgyi ba thams cad rang bzhin dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang yid la bgyi ba thams cad rang bzhin dang bral ba ste /
translated: Blessed One, all mental engagements are free from intrinsic nature.

original: yid la bgyi ba thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ba lags na zhes bya ba 'dis 'di skad zhus te /
analyzed: yid la bgyi ba thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ba lags na zhes bya ba 'dis 'di skad zhus te /
translated: This is what he means by saying, If all mental activity is empty of essence.

original: gal te yid la byed pa thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis dben zhing bral na /
analyzed: gal te yid la byed pa thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis dben zhing bral na /
translated: If all mental activity is essentially empty, essentially devoid of existence,🔽how can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?🔽How can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?🔽How can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba yin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rig par 'gyur /🔽ngo bo nyid kyis dben zhing stong pa la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dam /🔽yid la byed pa'am /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba yin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar rig par 'gyur / ngo bo nyid kyis dben zhing stong pa la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dam / yid la byed pa'am /
translated: How can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?🔽How can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?🔽How can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?🔽How can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?🔽How can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?🔽How can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?🔽How can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?🔽How can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?🔽How can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?🔽How can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?🔽How can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?🔽How can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?🔽How can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?🔽How can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?🔽How can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?🔽How can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?🔽How can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?🔽How can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang yang mi dmigs so zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang yang mi dmigs so zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: How can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?🔽How can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?🔽How can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / yid la byed pa rnams chos gzhan zhig tu yongs su brtags nas de skad gsungs pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / yid la byed pa rnams chos gzhan zhig tu yongs su brtags nas de skad gsungs pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: How can it be known that the knowledge of all aspects is not devoid of mental activity?

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang /
translated: How can it

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis dben par shes pa de tsam gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba'o zhes brtags pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis dben par shes pa de tsam gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba'o zhes brtags pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: It is merely imagined that one is not separated from the attention endowed with the knowledge of all aspects, merely by knowing that all phenomena are void of intrinsic reality.

original: don dam par ni de dag la tha dad pa med par /
analyzed: don dam par ni de dag la tha dad pa med par /
translated: In the ultimate, they are not different.

original: rab 'byor gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: It is taught by “Subhūti, if a bodhisattva-mahāsattva knows in that way,” and so forth.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa ste zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is empty of intrinsic reality means completely pure by intrinsic reality.

original: dri ma med pa'i shes rab chos thams cad kyis dben pa /
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i shes rab chos thams cad kyis dben pa /
translated: Stainless wisdom is void of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad kyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyis stong pa'o //
translated: It is empty of all phenomena.

original: de la 'phel ba med do //
analyzed: de la 'phel ba med do //
translated: There is no increase in that.

original: yongs su 'grub pa med do zhes bya ba ni rab tu zhugs pa'i dbang gis glo bur du 'phel ba yang med ;
analyzed: yongs su 'grub pa med do zhes bya ba ni rab tu zhugs pa'i dbang gis glo bur du 'phel ba yang med ;
translated: There is no establishment means that there is no adventitious increase by the power of engagement.

original: ma zhugs pa'i dbang gis 'grib pa yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma zhugs pa'i dbang gis 'grib pa yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: And because it does not enter, it does not decrease. This is the meaning.🔽The second question is:

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin gyis dben zhing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin gyis dben zhing /
translated: Blessed One, if the perfection of wisdom is isolated by its very nature,

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na zhes zhus pa gnyis pa ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa lags na zhes zhus pa gnyis pa ni /
translated: and if it is empty by its very nature,

original: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @245b pa dben pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @245b pa dben pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
translated: if the perfection of wisdom is isolated by its very nature,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben zhing stong pas ji ltar yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par byed ces zhus pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben zhing stong pas ji ltar yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par byed ces zhus pa'o //
translated: how does the perfection of wisdom, which is isolated and empty, bring about the full realization of complete enlightenment?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Then the Blessed One said:

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dben pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dben pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva is also isolated and empty, because he is by nature the dharma body.

original: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbang gis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur zhes bya ba de lta bu med de /
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbang gis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur zhes bya ba de lta bu med de /
translated: Moreover, it shows that “one will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment through the power of the perfection of wisdom” does not exist in that way.

original: chos kyi sku'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /
translated: The bodhisattva of the dharmakāya

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas 'phel bar 'gyur ba yang med la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas 'phel bar 'gyur ba yang med la /
translated: does not increase in dependence on the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la ma brten na yongs su 'grib par 'gyur ba yang med de /
analyzed: de la ma brten na yongs su 'grib par 'gyur ba yang med de /
translated: If he does not depend on it, he does not decrease.

original: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes ston to //
translated: This is because he has the characteristic of abiding.

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gcig kyang ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gcig kyang ma yin /
translated: “Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is not one thing,

original: gnyis kyang ma yin no zhes bya bas ston te ;
analyzed: gnyis kyang ma yin no zhes bya bas ston te ;
translated: nor is it two things.”

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin nyid ces bya ba de dag ni gcig ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin nyid ces bya ba de dag ni gcig ste /
translated: “The knowledge of all aspects,” “bodhisattva,” “perfection of wisdom,” and “suchness” are one.

original: gnyis su byar med cing grangs kyi bye brag gis tha dad pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyis su byar med cing grangs kyi bye brag gis tha dad pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not twofold, and it is not different by way of a specific number.🔽This is the meaning of the passage.🔽The third question is this:

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stong pa nyid dang / gsog nyid dang / gsob dang / ya ma brla nyid dang / snying po ma mchis pa nyid gang lags pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhu ba gsum pa 'di skad zhus te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stong pa nyid dang / gsog nyid dang / gsob dang / ya ma brla nyid dang / snying po ma mchis pa nyid gang lags pa de zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhu ba gsum pa 'di skad zhus te /
translated: The emptiness, the hollowness, the falsity, the vanity, and the unsubstantiality of the perfection of wisdom, etc.

original: ci shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stong pa nyid /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod dam /
analyzed: ci shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stong pa nyid / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod dam /
translated: Does the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom🔽practice the perfection of wisdom?

original: ci shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'ba' zhig spyod dam /
analyzed: ci shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'ba' zhig spyod dam /
translated: Does it practice only the perfection of wisdom?

original: 'on te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod dam /
analyzed: 'on te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod dam /
translated: Or does it practice the perfection of wisdom?

original: 'on te stong pa nyid spyod dam /
analyzed: 'on te stong pa nyid spyod dam /
translated: Or does it practice emptiness?🔽Or does it practice something other than emptiness?🔽These are the five alternatives.

original: 'on te stong pa nyid las gzhan pa zhig spyod dam zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa lnga dang / de bzhin du ci gzugs la sogs pa spyod dam /
analyzed: 'on te stong pa nyid las gzhan pa zhig spyod dam zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa lnga dang / de bzhin du ci gzugs la sogs pa spyod dam /
translated: And similarly, does it practice form, etc.?

original: 'on te ci gzugs la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid spyod dam zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'on te ci gzugs la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid spyod dam zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /
translated: Or, does one practice the emptiness of form, etc.? These are the two conceptual thoughts.

original: de ltar rnam par rtog pa bdun nye bar bzung nas zhus pa dang / de nas bcom @246a * //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog pa bdun nye bar bzung nas zhus pa dang / de nas bcom @246a * //
translated: Thus, having taken up the seven conceptual thoughts, he asked.

original: ldan 'das kyis rnam par rtog pa de dag nyid dngos po med pas spyod pa gang yin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / ji ltar spyod pa de dag mi dmigs pa dang / de nas yang mi snang ba dag mi dmigs pa dang /
analyzed: ldan 'das kyis rnam par rtog pa de dag nyid dngos po med pas spyod pa gang yin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / ji ltar spyod pa de dag mi dmigs pa dang / de nas yang mi snang ba dag mi dmigs pa dang /
translated: Then, the Lord, by means of the non-existence of those very conceptual thoughts, the practice, the perfection of wisdom, and how that practice is not apprehended, and then also the non-apprehension of the non-appearance,

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa dag mi dmigs pa nye bar bzung nas /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa dag mi dmigs pa nye bar bzung nas /
translated: taking up the non-apprehension of arising and cessation,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod par lung bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod par lung bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag bstan to //
translated: the Lord revealed the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas who have been prophesied to attain acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags /
translated: Lord, what is the practice of the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas?

original: chos thams cad skye ba'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ram zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of the arising of all dharmas,

original: chos thams cad mi skye ba'i slad du zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos sam kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyang rung ste thams cad mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi skye ba'i slad du zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos sam kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyang rung ste thams cad mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: for the sake of the non-arising of all dharmas,

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ba'i chos de lta bu khyod kyis yang dag par rjes su mthong ngam zhes bya ba ni lung bstan par bya ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par byed pa dngos po med pas 'di dang /
analyzed: gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ba'i chos de lta bu khyod kyis yang dag par rjes su mthong ngam zhes bya ba ni lung bstan par bya ba dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par byed pa dngos po med pas 'di dang /
translated: Have you seen that dharma which will attain manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment?

original: 'di lta bu'i don du lung bstan par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i don du lung bstan par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: I will prophesy for such a purpose.

original: de ltar zab cing zab pa'i gnas dag bstan pas /
analyzed: de ltar zab cing zab pa'i gnas dag bstan pas /
translated: Thus, by teaching such extremely profound topics,

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni zab po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to //🔽de nas yang bsod nams mang po bstan pa yang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni zab po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol to // de nas yang bsod nams mang po bstan pa yang /
translated: the Blessed One is addressed as profound and so on.🔽Then, in order to generate faith, the teaching on much merit

original: dad pa rab tu skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pa rab tu skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is given.

original: rab tu bsngags pa'i tshig thams cad dang / phan yon bstan pa dang / brgya byin dang / kun dga' bo'i tshig dang / bdud kyi gtam dang / bdud kyi las dang / de las byung ba'i gtam dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i gang zag rnams kyi drung du ji ltar gnas par bya ba dang /
analyzed: rab tu bsngags pa'i tshig thams cad dang / phan yon bstan pa dang / brgya byin dang / kun dga' bo'i tshig dang / bdud kyi gtam dang / bdud kyi las dang / de las byung ba'i gtam dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i gang zag rnams kyi drung du ji ltar gnas par bya ba dang /
translated: All the words of praise, the teachings on benefits, the words of Shakra and Ananda, the teachings on Mara, the deeds of Mara, the teachings arising from that, and how to abide in the presence of individuals belonging to the Bodhisattva Vehicle -🔽all of this is the chapter on the benefits of rejoicing.

original: mnyam pa nyid bshad pa gang yin pa dang / zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i gtam dang / bslab pa'i phan yon bshad pa dang / sems @246b can dang / sems can ma yin pa rnams zil gyis gnon pa dang /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid bshad pa gang yin pa dang / zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i gtam dang / bslab pa'i phan yon bshad pa dang / sems @246b can dang / sems can ma yin pa rnams zil gyis gnon pa dang /
translated: The explanation of sameness, the discourse on exhaustion, separation from attachment, cessation, and so on, the explanation of the benefits of training, and the surpassing of sentient and non-sentient beings.

original: brgya byin gyi tshig dang / bsod nams tshad med pa dang / de nas yang brgya byin gyi tshig rnams ni gzhung nyid las go sla bas rnam par phye ste ma bshad do //
analyzed: brgya byin gyi tshig dang / bsod nams tshad med pa dang / de nas yang brgya byin gyi tshig rnams ni gzhung nyid las go sla bas rnam par phye ste ma bshad do //
translated: The words of Śakra, immeasurable merit, and then again the words of Śakra are easy to understand in the text itself, so they are not explained in detail.

original: ci nas kyang gnyis kyi 'du shes su 'gyur ba med pa dang gnyis ma yin pa'i 'du shes su 'gyur ba med pa de lta bur yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni de dag gi sems bskyed pa gang yin pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gang yin pa de dag don dam par tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci nas kyang gnyis kyi 'du shes su 'gyur ba med pa dang gnyis ma yin pa'i 'du shes su 'gyur ba med pa de lta bur yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni de dag gi sems bskyed pa gang yin pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gang yin pa de dag don dam par tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: One should dedicate in such a way that there is no dualistic perception, no non-dualistic perception.  The thought of enlightenment and unsurpassed perfect enlightenment are ultimately not different.

original: de dag gi de bzhin nyid ni rnam par dag par rab tu phye ba yin pas de'i phyir gnyis kyi 'du shes su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi de bzhin nyid ni rnam par dag par rab tu phye ba yin pas de'i phyir gnyis kyi 'du shes su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The suchness of those is fully disclosed as pure, therefore, one does not have the notion of duality.

original: gnyis ni dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa'i bye brag las tha dad pa yod pas gnyis kyi 'du shes su yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis ni dri ma dang bcas pa dang / dri ma med pa'i bye brag las tha dad pa yod pas gnyis kyi 'du shes su yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Duality is the difference between the defiled and the undefiled, therefore, one has the notion of duality.

original: de bas na gcig pa'i phyir gnyis kyi 'du shes su mi 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na gcig pa'i phyir gnyis kyi 'du shes su mi 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “because of non-duality, one does not have the notion of duality.”

original: tha dad pa'i phyir gnyis su 'du shes so //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i phyir gnyis su 'du shes so //
translated: Because of difference, one has the notion of duality.

original: yang na yod pa dang / med pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis su 'du shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang na yod pa dang / med pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis su 'du shes pa'o //
translated: Or, existence and non-existence are the notion of duality.

original: yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa ni gnyis su 'du shes med pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa ni gnyis su 'du shes med pa ste /
translated: Neither existence nor non-existence is the absence of the notion of duality.

original: de yang 'og nas 'byung ba'i gzhung gis gsal bar bshad do //
analyzed: de yang 'og nas 'byung ba'i gzhung gis gsal bar bshad do //
translated: That is clarified by the following passage.

original: de nas yang 'og nas ci nas kyang sems de la yang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de nas yang 'og nas ci nas kyang sems de la yang ma yin zhing /
translated: Then, it is said, “in no way does he have the notion of mind.”

original: sems gzhan la yang ma yin pa de ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas gyur pa'i dbang gis sems de la yang ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems gzhan la yang ma yin pa de ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas gyur pa'i dbang gis sems de la yang ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus should one dedicate, in such a way that it is not in the mind either. By the power of transformation, it is not in the mind.

original: don dam par ni tha dad pa med pas sems gzhan la yang ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don dam par ni tha dad pa med pas sems gzhan la yang ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the ultimate, there is no difference, so it is not in another mind either.

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems sgyu ma lta bu'i sems de khyod kyis yang dag par rjes su mthong ngam zhes bya ba ci las dgongs she na /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems sgyu ma lta bu'i sems de khyod kyis yang dag par rjes su mthong ngam zhes bya ba ci las dgongs she na /
translated: Subhuti, what do you think, do you see that illusory mind?

original: gal te sems sgyu ma lta bu yin la /
analyzed: gal te sems sgyu ma lta bu yin la /
translated: If the mind is like an illusion,

original: byang chub sgyu ma lta bu ma yin na ni de lta na klan kar 'gyur na /
analyzed: byang chub sgyu ma lta bu ma yin na ni de lta na klan kar 'gyur na /
translated: and enlightenment is not like an illusion, then there would be a fault.

original: 'di ltar sems dang byang chub gnyi ga yang sgyu ma lta bu yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems dang byang chub gnyi ga yang sgyu ma lta bu yin te /
translated: But both the mind and enlightenment are like illusions.

original: de'i phyir klan ka med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir klan ka med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault.

original: chos gang shin tu dben pa de ni mchis pa'am ma mchis par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos gang shin tu dben pa de ni mchis pa'am ma mchis par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Any dharma that is utterly isolated does not become existent or non-existent.

original: kun brtags pa'i chos gang yin pa de sgyu ma lta bu yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i chos gang yin pa de sgyu ma lta bu yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because any imagined dharma is like an illusion.

original: sgyu ma @247a * //
analyzed: sgyu ma @247a * //
translated: It is not suitable to say that it is like an illusion and exists,

original: dang 'dra bar yod do zhes bya ba'am /🔽med do zhes bya bar brjod du mi rung la /
analyzed: dang 'dra bar yod do zhes bya ba'am / med do zhes bya bar brjod du mi rung la /
translated: or that it does not exist.

original: yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin zhes kyang brjod du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin zhes kyang brjod du mi rung ngo //
translated: It is also not suitable to say that it is neither existent nor nonexistent.

original: yongs su grub pa'i chos gang yin pa de yang dngos po'i rnam pa thams cad kyis dben pa'i phyir yod do zhes brjod du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i chos gang yin pa de yang dngos po'i rnam pa thams cad kyis dben pa'i phyir yod do zhes brjod du mi rung ngo //
translated: The perfected nature, moreover, is not suitable to be called existent because it is devoid of all aspects of being a thing.

original: brjod du med pa dben pa'i rang bzhin yod pa'i phyir med do zhes kyang brjod du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: brjod du med pa dben pa'i rang bzhin yod pa'i phyir med do zhes kyang brjod du mi rung ngo //
translated: It is also not suitable to be called nonexistent because of the existence of the nature of being devoid of expression.

original: yod do zhes bya ba'i tha snyad yod pa'i phyir med do zhes kyang brjod du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yod do zhes bya ba'i tha snyad yod pa'i phyir med do zhes kyang brjod du mi rung ngo //
translated: It is also not suitable to be called nonexistent because the convention of existence exists.

original: med do zhes bya ba'i tha snyad yod pa'i phyir med pa ma yin no zhes kyang brjod du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: med do zhes bya ba'i tha snyad yod pa'i phyir med pa ma yin no zhes kyang brjod du mi rung ngo //
translated: It is also not suitable to be called not nonexistent because the convention of nonexistence exists.

original: de bas na gnyis kyi 'du shes dang / gnyis su med pa'i 'du shes mi rigs so //
analyzed: de bas na gnyis kyi 'du shes dang / gnyis su med pa'i 'du shes mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, the perception of duality and the perception of nonduality are not tenable.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar gang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar gang kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Blessed One, it is because all those phenomena that are defiled🔽or purified do not exist and are not found.

original: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad ni ma mchis shing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams yod pa ma yin te /🔽dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na yang /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i chos de dag thams cad ni ma mchis shing mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams yod pa ma yin te / dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na yang /
translated: The phenomena that are defiled or purified do not exist.

original: nam mkha' bzhin du rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med do //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du rang bzhin gyis dben pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med do //
translated: Even in the state with defilements, there is no defilement because, like space, it is naturally isolated.

original: de med pa nyid kyi phyir sngon ma byung ba'i rnam par byang ba yang med do //🔽'di ni sems de la yang ma yin /
analyzed: de med pa nyid kyi phyir sngon ma byung ba'i rnam par byang ba yang med do // 'di ni sems de la yang ma yin /
translated: Since that does not exist, there is also no purification that did not exist before.🔽This is explained as “it is not in that mind,

original: sems gzhan la yang ma yin zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: sems gzhan la yang ma yin zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: nor is it in another mind.”

original: chos gang shin tu dben pa de ni bsgom par bgyi ba yang ma lags /
analyzed: chos gang shin tu dben pa de ni bsgom par bgyi ba yang ma lags /
translated: That phenomenon which is utterly isolated is not cultivated,

original: rnam par gzhig par bgyi ba yang ma lags zhes bya ba la bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni goms par bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par gzhig par bgyi ba yang ma lags zhes bya ba la bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni goms par bya ba ste /
translated: Here, “cultivation” means familiarization.

original: de dben pa'i phyir mi rigs so //
analyzed: de dben pa'i phyir mi rigs so //
translated: That is not reasonable because of being isolated.

original: rnam par gzhig pa zhes bya ba ni dri ma bstsal ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par gzhig pa zhes bya ba ni dri ma bstsal ba ste /
translated: “To be destroyed” means to remove defilements.

original: de yang shin tu dben pa'i phyir mi rigs so //
analyzed: de yang shin tu dben pa'i phyir mi rigs so //
translated: That also is not reasonable because of being extremely isolated.

original: bsgrub par bgyid pa'i chos kyang gang yang ma mchis zhes bya ba ni shin tu dben pa'i phyir byang chub thob par byed pa ma yin pa'o //🔽dben pa nyid lags pa'i slad du ji ltar dben pas dben pa rjes su rtogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dben pa yin na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bgyid pa'i chos kyang gang yang ma mchis zhes bya ba ni shin tu dben pa'i phyir byang chub thob par byed pa ma yin pa'o // dben pa nyid lags pa'i slad du ji ltar dben pas dben pa rjes su rtogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dben pa yin na /
translated: Nor is there any dharma to be attained means that because of being extremely isolated, there is nothing that causes the attainment of enlightenment.🔽How is emptiness realized by emptiness?🔽If the perfection of wisdom and perfect enlightenment are empty,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben @247b pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dben pa ji ltar rjes su rtog par 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dben @247b pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dben pa ji ltar rjes su rtog par 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: how is perfect enlightenment realized by the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom?

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: Subhūti, it is just so!

original: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad gsungs te /🔽gal te gcig ni dben la /
analyzed: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad gsungs te / gal te gcig ni dben la /
translated: It is just so, etc. The Lord has said this.

original: cig shos ni mi dben pa zhig yin na ni de lta na ni mi rigs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: cig shos ni mi dben pa zhig yin na ni de lta na ni mi rigs par 'gyur na /
translated: If one were to be void and the other not void, then it would be unreasonable.

original: 'di ltar de gnyis ka yang dben pas de'i phyir nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar de gnyis ka yang dben pas de'i phyir nyes pa med de /
translated: But since both are void, therefore there is no fault.

original: chos thams cad kyi dben pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid shes na mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi dben pa'i mtshan nyid de nyid shes na mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: If one knows that very characteristic of voidness of all dharmas, one will fully awaken to enlightenment.

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal ba ltar na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don bdag gis 'tshal ba ltar na /
translated: Lord, according to how I understand the meaning of what the Lord has said,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dka' ba bgyid pa ma lags so zhes bya ba ni /🔽gal te la la ni dmigs /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dka' ba bgyid pa ma lags so zhes bya ba ni / gal te la la ni dmigs /
translated: a bodhisattva great being does not do what is difficult.

original: la la ni mi dmigs na ni de lta na mi mthun pas dka' bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: la la ni mi dmigs na ni de lta na mi mthun pas dka' bar 'gyur na /
translated: If one were to apprehend and the other not to apprehend, then it would be difficult, since they would be inconsistent.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But since all dharmas do not exist,

original: med pa nyid kyi phyir mi dmigs so //
analyzed: med pa nyid kyi phyir mi dmigs so //
translated: Because of non-existence, there is no apprehension.

original: med pa ni mi dmigs pa zhes bya bar shes par mi dka'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: med pa ni mi dmigs pa zhes bya bar shes par mi dka'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not difficult to understand that non-existence is called non-apprehension.

original: bcom ldan 'das mi dmigs par spyod pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ste zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs par spyod pa ma gtogs pa spyod pa gzhan med do //🔽de'i 'og tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du bstan pa ni go sla'o /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mi dmigs par spyod pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ste zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs par spyod pa ma gtogs pa spyod pa gzhan med do // de'i 'og tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du bstan pa ni go sla'o /
translated: This non-apprehension is the practice of the Bodhisattva.

original: // / bam po nyi shu bzhi pa /
analyzed: // / bam po nyi shu bzhi pa /
translated: The teaching on the non-conceptuality of the perfection of wisdom that follows is easy to understand.

original: 'gro ba lngar 'khor ba zhes tha dad du dbye ba 'di ci las gyur rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba'ang ci las gyur ces bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad ston to //
analyzed: 'gro ba lngar 'khor ba zhes tha dad du dbye ba 'di ci las gyur rgyun du zhugs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba'ang ci las gyur ces bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad ston to //
translated: This is taught by the question, What is the basis for the division into five types of transmigrators? and also by the question, What is the basis for the division into stream-enterers and so on?

original: gal te chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa yin na 'khor ba dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams ci las byung zhes dris pa'o //
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa yin na 'khor ba dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams ci las byung zhes dris pa'o //
translated: If all phenomena are non-conceptual, what is the basis for the phenomena of cyclic existence and nirvana?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said:

original: 'di dag ni phyin ci log pa ste /🔽med pa la 'dzin pa /
analyzed: 'di dag ni phyin ci log pa ste / med pa la 'dzin pa /
translated: These are mistaken,🔽grasping what is not there,

original: yod pa sgrib par byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yod pa sgrib par byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: and obscuring what is there.

original: de dag dang 'dres pa'i phyir /🔽'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang yod pa la ni sgrib po //
analyzed: de dag dang 'dres pa'i phyir / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang yod pa la ni sgrib po //
translated: Because they are mixed with those,

original: med pa la ni 'dzin to //
analyzed: med pa la ni 'dzin to //
translated: the conceptual thoughts of desire, hatred, and so on, obscure what is there and grasp what is not there.

original: de dag gis bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gis bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are produced by those,

original: @248a * // bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa la sogs pa'i las byed pa'i sems pa yang /
analyzed: @248a * // bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa la sogs pa'i las byed pa'i sems pa yang /
translated: the intentions that create the karma of merit, demerit, and so on

original: phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa yin te las de dang rnam par rtog pa de dag gis bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa yin te las de dang rnam par rtog pa de dag gis bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: are also mistaken grasping, because that karma and those conceptual thoughts produce them.

original: rnam par smin pa'i shes pa yang de kho na nyid 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i shes pa yang de kho na nyid 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: The consciousness that ripens is also not a grasper of reality.

original: de bas na 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa yang de kho na ma yin pa'i yul can te /
analyzed: de bas na 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa yang de kho na ma yin pa'i yul can te /
translated: Therefore, desire, attachment, and so on also have objects that are not real,

original: kun 'byung ba thams cad ni yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba thams cad ni yang dag pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
translated: and all that arises is not a real essence.

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / lha dang mi'i 'gro ba rnams zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba lnga po dag de kho na'i ngo bo nyid du ston te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / lha dang mi'i 'gro ba rnams zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba lnga po dag de kho na'i ngo bo nyid du ston te /
translated: The five destinies of hell beings, animals, hungry ghosts, gods, and humans are shown to be just that nature.

original: de'i phyir chos rnams rnam par mi rtog pa yin yang de ltar 'khor bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos rnams rnam par mi rtog pa yin yang de ltar 'khor bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, although phenomena are nonconceptual, they are presented in that way in cyclic existence.

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la yang /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la yang /
translated: With regard to the phenomena of purification,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag cing /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag cing /
translated: the stages of stream enterer and so on are presented.

original: thams cad kyang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid de /
analyzed: thams cad kyang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid de /
translated: And all of them are nonconceptual.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: From the stage of stream enterer up to

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar du ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad pa ni gang yang med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar du ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad pa ni gang yang med de /
translated: the stage of a tathāgata, there is not the slightest difference in their nature.

original: thams cad kyang chos kyi sku las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang chos kyi sku las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because all of them are not beyond the dharma body.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos nyid thos pas sh'a ri'i bu'i blo rgya cher gyur nas /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos nyid thos pas sh'a ri'i bu'i blo rgya cher gyur nas /
translated: In that way, having heard the reality of the perfection of wisdom, the mind of Śāriputra became vast.

original: kye ma byang chub sems dpa' gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni snying po la spyod pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / de nas rab 'byor gyis snying po med pa la spyod pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: kye ma byang chub sems dpa' gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de ni snying po la spyod pa'o zhes gsungs pa dang / de nas rab 'byor gyis snying po med pa la spyod pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Then Subhuti said, He courses in the inessential.🔽 Having placed in his mind the inessentiality of all dharmas, because of their nonexistence and nonapprehension, he said, He courses in the inessential.

original: dngos po med pa dang / yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir snying po med pa nyid yin par de'i yid la bzhag nas /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang / yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir snying po med pa nyid yin par de'i yid la bzhag nas /

original: snying po med pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na snying po dmigs pa ltag la yod ces 'jig rten pa'i rigs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: snying po med pa nyid kyang mi dmigs na snying po dmigs pa ltag la yod ces 'jig rten pa'i rigs pa gsungs te /
translated: The inessential of form, etc. is not apprehended.🔽 The Lord said, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva who courses in the perfection of wisdom should course in the inessential of the knowledge of all modes.🔽 The inessential of the knowledge of all modes is not apprehended.🔽 The Lord said, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva who courses in the perfection of wisdom should course in the inessential of the knowledge of all modes.🔽 The inessential of the knowledge of all modes is not apprehended.🔽 The Lord said, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva who courses in the perfection of wisdom should course in the inessential of the knowledge of all modes.

original: 'jig rten na yang snying po med pa ni rnyed sla'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang snying po med pa ni rnyed sla'o //
translated: The inessential of the knowledge of all modes is not apprehended.🔽 The Lord said, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva who courses in the perfection of wisdom should course in the inessential of the knowledge of all modes.

original: snying po can ni rnyed par dka'o zhes tha snyad du byed do //
analyzed: snying po can ni rnyed par dka'o zhes tha snyad du byed do //
translated: The inessential of the knowledge of all modes is not apprehended.🔽 The Lord said, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva who courses in the perfection of wisdom should course in the inessential of the knowledge of all modes.🔽 The inessential of the knowledge of all modes is not apprehended.🔽 The Lord said, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva who courses in the perfection of wisdom should course

original: gang dag chos 'di dag mnyam pa nyid du mngon sum du mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos kyi sku dang yang dag pa'i mtha' yang mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang dag chos 'di dag mnyam pa nyid du mngon sum du mi byed pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos kyi sku dang yang dag pa'i mtha' yang mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The sameness of the Tathāgata, the Dharma body, and the limit of reality are also sameness.

original: nam mkha' dben pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dben pa'i rnam @248b pas so //
analyzed: nam mkha' dben pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dben pa'i rnam @248b pas so //
translated: Because space is void.

original: 'di yang 'gres gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di yang 'gres gsum ste /
translated: This is also a threefold repetition:

original: nam mkha' dang sems can mthun pa'i 'gres dang / nam mkha' lta bu'i sems can gyi go cha'i 'gres dang / gzugs la sogs pa dang / sems can mthun pa'i 'gres so //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang sems can mthun pa'i 'gres dang / nam mkha' lta bu'i sems can gyi go cha'i 'gres dang / gzugs la sogs pa dang / sems can mthun pa'i 'gres so //
translated: the repetition of the sameness of space and sentient beings, the repetition of the armor of space-like sentient beings, and the repetition of the sameness of form and so on and sentient beings.

original: dben pa bshad pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i phan yon yang go sla'o //
analyzed: dben pa bshad pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i phan yon yang go sla'o //
translated: The explanation of voidness and the benefits of practicing the perfection of wisdom are easy to understand.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang yang de bzhin nyid du gnas shing de bzhin nyid du nan tan bgyis te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang yang de bzhin nyid du gnas shing de bzhin nyid du nan tan bgyis te /
translated: Blessed One, those who abide in suchness and practice in suchness,

original: chos gang yang mi dmigs na de ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur ba lags zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la gnas pa dang / sgrub pa chos 'ga' zhig yod na ni rigs na /
analyzed: chos gang yang mi dmigs na de ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas par 'gyur ba lags zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la gnas pa dang / sgrub pa chos 'ga' zhig yod na ni rigs na /
translated: If no dharma is apprehended, how can one stand in the knowledge of all modes?🔽This is the question: if one stands in thusness, and if there is some dharma to be accomplished, that is reasonable.

original: gal te chos thams cad mi dmigs na ji ltar gnas par 'gyur zhes dris pa'o //
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad mi dmigs na ji ltar gnas par 'gyur zhes dris pa'o //
translated: But if no dharma is apprehended, how can one stand in it?

original: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa ji lta ba bzhin du gnas so zhes bya ba ni /🔽ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa bya ba thams cad byed cing gnas pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa ji lta ba bzhin du gnas so zhes bya ba ni / ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa bya ba thams cad byed cing gnas pa de bzhin du /
translated: Subhuti: As a magical creation of the Tathagata stands.🔽As a magical creation of the Tathagata performs all the functions, and yet does not apprehend that as a real fact, just so the Bodhisattva, the great being, stands in the knowledge of all modes, and yet does not apprehend that as a real fact.🔽Subhuti: As a magical creation of the Tathagata stands.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽bcom ldan 'das gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa zhes bgyi ba'i chos gang yang mi dmigs na zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // bcom ldan 'das gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa zhes bgyi ba'i chos gang yang mi dmigs na zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: As a magical creation of the Tathagata performs all the functions, and yet does not apprehend that as a real fact, just so the Bodhisattva, the great being, stands in the knowledge of all modes, and yet does not apprehend that as a real fact.🔽Subhuti: What is the magical creation of the Tathagata?

original: 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa zhes bya ba'i chos gang yang med de /
analyzed: 'di skad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa zhes bya ba'i chos gang yang med de /
translated: The Lord: Here the Tathagata, the Arhat, the fully Enlightened One, creates by his magic power a magical creation of a monk, or a magical creation of a Brahman, or a magical creation of a god, or a magical creation of a man, or a magical creation of a woman, or a magical creation of a boy, or a magical creation of a girl, or a magical creation of an animal.

original: de med pa nyid kyi phyir de bzhin nyid la gnas pa dang / sgrub pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / chos bstan pa yang med la /
analyzed: de med pa nyid kyi phyir de bzhin nyid la gnas pa dang / sgrub pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / chos bstan pa yang med la /
translated: Because that does not exist, there is no abiding in suchness, no practice, no full awakening, and no teaching of the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad ni yod do zhes bya ba ji ltar rigs par 'gyur zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad ni yod do zhes bya ba ji ltar rigs par 'gyur zhes bstan pa'o //

original: de bzhin nyid kyang mi dmigs na /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang mi dmigs na /

analyzed: gang de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur ba lta ci smos zhes bya ba 'dis kyang mi rigs pa gzhan dag ston to //

original: // rab 'byor gzhan yang gzugs dang nam mkha' zad mi shes pas zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i de bzhin nyid dang / nam mkha' la dmigs nas yang de dag mi zad pa nyid du shes rab bskyed par bya'o //

translated: Moreover, Subhuti, by the inexhaustibility of form and space means that by observing the suchness of form, etc. and space, you should generate wisdom that knows their inexhaustibility.

translated: After that, the benefits of cultivating the inexhaustibility like space, and the six perfections applied one by one are easy to understand.

translated: The passage, One does not apprehend 'inner emptiness' as 'inner emptiness,' means that one does not conceptualize, This is inner emptiness.

original: gzugs stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni gnyi gar yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //

original: de bas na tha dad pa med pa de nyid la rag lus pa'i phyir de la rab ces bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na tha dad pa med pa de nyid la rag lus pa'i phyir de la rab ces bya ste /
translated: Therefore, because it is dependent on that very non-difference, it is called “supreme.”

original: 'dir yang ri rab kyi dpes bstan to //🔽don gyi rjes su zhugs pa la ni chos gang la yang bye brag dang khyad par med de zhes bya ba ni don gyi rjes su zhugs @250a * //
analyzed: 'dir yang ri rab kyi dpes bstan to // don gyi rjes su zhugs pa la ni chos gang la yang bye brag dang khyad par med de zhes bya ba ni don gyi rjes su zhugs @250a * //
translated: Here, it is also taught by the example of Mount Meru.

original: pa'i gang zag la chos gang yang bye brag tu mi snang ngo //
analyzed: pa'i gang zag la chos gang yang bye brag tu mi snang ngo //
translated: “For one who has entered into the meaning, there is no distinction or difference in any dharma” means that for a person who has entered into the meaning, no dharma appears as distinct.

original: de bzhin du don gyi dbang gis chos rnams la bye brag gang yang med de /
analyzed: de bzhin du don gyi dbang gis chos rnams la bye brag gang yang med de /
translated: Similarly, due to the power of the meaning, there is no distinction in any dharma.

original: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kho na mchog ces brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kho na mchog ces brjod par mi bya'o zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not say that only the perfection of wisdom is supreme.”

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no ;
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no ;
translated: Subhūti, it is so!

original: / de de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: / de de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni 'di skad bstan te /
translated: “It is so, it is so” teaches this:

original: don gyi rjes su zhugs pa de nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbang gis 'gyur te /
analyzed: don gyi rjes su zhugs pa de nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dbang gis 'gyur te /
translated: That very one who has entered into the meaning is transformed by the power of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bas na de rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de rab ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “supreme.”

original: 'di ltar bye brag med kyang 'jig rten na brda'i rjes su 'brang bas 'di ni sbyin pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar bye brag med kyang 'jig rten na brda'i rjes su 'brang bas 'di ni sbyin pas so //
translated: This is generosity.

original: 'di ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: 'di ni tshul khrims so //
translated: This is morality.

original: 'di ni bzod pa'o zhes 'dogs par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ni bzod pa'o zhes 'dogs par byed de /
translated: This is patience.

original: 'dogs pa de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu las 'gyur gyi gzhan las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dogs pa de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu las 'gyur gyi gzhan las ni ma yin te /
translated: And that designation also comes from the cause of the perfection of wisdom, not from anything else.

original: 'dir yang bud med rin po che'i dpes bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir yang bud med rin po che'i dpes bstan to //
translated: And here it is taught by the example of the jewel of the queen.🔽The perfection of wisdom does not apprehend or abandon any dharma at all.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos gang yang yongs su 'dzin pa'am gtong ba med do zhes bya ba ni gal te byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab chos 'ga' zhig 'dzin na de nyid mngon par zhen pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos gang yang yongs su 'dzin pa'am gtong ba med do zhes bya ba ni gal te byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab chos 'ga' zhig 'dzin na de nyid mngon par zhen pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the bodhisattva’s wisdom were to apprehend any dharma, that would be the fault of attachment.

original: gal te gtong na yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes grub par ni 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gtong na yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes grub par ni 'gyur te /
translated: If it were to abandon, it would not accomplish the knowledge of omniscience.

original: de bas na mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: de bas na mi 'dzin mi gtong ngo //
translated: Therefore, it does not apprehend or abandon.

original: yang kun brtags pa'i dbang gis ni mi 'dzin /
analyzed: yang kun brtags pa'i dbang gis ni mi 'dzin /
translated: Moreover, it does not apprehend by the power of imagination.

original: chos nyid kyi dbang gis ni mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi dbang gis ni mi gtong ngo //
translated: by the power of reality, they are not relinquished.🔽Subhūti, this non-attention to form is not apprehending form.

original: rab 'byor gang gzugs yid la mi byed pa 'di ni gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su mi 'dzin zhes bya ba gang yang med kyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang gzugs yid la mi byed pa 'di ni gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su mi 'dzin zhes bya ba gang yang med kyi /
translated: There is no such thing as “apprehending.”

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir yid la mi byed pa yin yongs su mi 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir yid la mi byed pa yin yongs su mi 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since what is not real does not exist, it is non-attention and is called “non-apprehending.”

original: rab 'byor gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' gzugs yid la mi byed pa nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' gzugs yid la mi byed pa nas /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattvas do not pay attention to form,🔽and so on up to: when they do not pay attention to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, at that time the roots of virtue of the bodhisattva great beings increase.”

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yid la mi byed pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du yid la mi byed pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams
translated: Non-existent phenomena

original: med pas dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid du yongs su shes nas yid la mi byed pa nyid dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o//
analyzed: med pas dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid du yongs su shes nas yid la mi byed pa nyid dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o//
translated: Having understood that it is nonexistent, and that it is the nature of non-existence, the non-attention itself is the increase of the wholesome roots.

original: @250b byang chub sems dpa' de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni mtshan mar dmigs pa'i nyes pas chags pa'o //
analyzed: @250b byang chub sems dpa' de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las nyams par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni mtshan mar dmigs pa'i nyes pas chags pa'o //
translated: “The Bodhisattva will fall away from the perfection of wisdom” means that he is defiled by the fault of perceiving signs.

original: chos thams cad yongs su ma bzung ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma chags pa de nyid yongs su ma bzung ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad yongs su ma bzung ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ma chags pa de nyid yongs su ma bzung ba ste /
translated: “Not taking hold of all dharmas” means that very non-attachment to the perfection of wisdom is not taking hold.
