original: byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab ni gang du yang chags pa med la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab ni gang du yang chags pa med la /
translated: The wisdom of the Bodhisattva is not attached to anything,

original: gang yang yongs su mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: gang yang yongs su mi 'dzin to //
translated: and does not take hold of anything.

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dus thams cad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid🔽dang ma bral ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ma bral ba zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dus thams cad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid dang ma bral ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, the perfection of wisdom is not separate from the perfection of wisdom. This means that the perfection of wisdom is never separate from the nature of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar chos thams cad kyang ji lta ji lta bu'i ngo bo nyid dang ma bral lags na /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad kyang ji lta ji lta bu'i ngo bo nyid dang ma bral lags na /
translated: Thus, all phenomena are not separate from their own nature.

original: 'o na ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bgyi zhes bya ba ni gal te chos thams cad ngo bo nyid dang ma bral ba yin na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bgyi zhes bya ba ni gal te chos thams cad ngo bo nyid dang ma bral ba yin na /
translated: Then how should one accomplish the perfection of wisdom? This means, if all phenomena are not separate from their own nature,

original: 'o na ji ltar de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pas nye bar gzung bar bya zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar de dag dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pas nye bar gzung bar bya zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: then how should one take up the roots of virtue and so forth?

original: gzugs la mngon par zhen pa med de 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: gzugs la mngon par zhen pa med de 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: There is no attachment to form, this is form.

original: 'di ni gzugs so zhes bya bar mngon par zhen pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs so zhes bya bar mngon par zhen pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad ston te /
translated: This is what is being shown:

original: chos ni chos mngon par mi sgrub ste /
analyzed: chos ni chos mngon par mi sgrub ste /
translated: Dharma does not establish Dharma,

original: chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no attachment to any Dharma.

original: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong pas ji lta ji lta bur gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba rtogs pa nyid mngon par sgrub pa zhes bya'i gzhan du ni ma yin no /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong pas ji lta ji lta bur gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos kyi yang dag pa ji lta ba rtogs pa nyid mngon par sgrub pa zhes bya'i gzhan du ni ma yin no /
translated: Since one does not see reality, one establishes the realization of the reality of phenomena just as they are, with the characteristics of how they abide, and not otherwise.

original: zhes de skad ston to //
analyzed: zhes de skad ston to //
translated: This is what is being shown.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i dpe dang / kha lo sgyur ba'i dpes kyang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i dpe dang / kha lo sgyur ba'i dpes kyang shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood through the example of the universal monarch and the example of the charioteer.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos gang skyed pa ma lags 'gog pa ma lags na zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos gang skyed pa ma lags 'gog pa ma lags na zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: Blessed One, if the perfection of wisdom does not give rise to any Dharma, does not terminate any Dharma, and so on,

original: 'di skad zhus te /
analyzed: 'di skad zhus te /
translated: this is what was asked:

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab chos gang yang mi skyed la /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab chos gang yang mi skyed la /
translated: If the wisdom of the bodhisattva does not give rise to any Dharma,

original: nag po'i chos kyang mi 'gog na pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gis ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: nag po'i chos kyang mi 'gog na pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gis ci zhig bya ste /
translated: If one does not stop the dharmas of bad conduct, what is the use of the six perfections?

original: ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: How does one complete the six perfections?

original: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du @251a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du @251a * //
translated: Subhūti, having taken up the knowledge of all aspects,

original: dmigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pas /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad gsungs te /🔽ci zhig bskyed par bya'o snyam mam /
analyzed: dmigs te zhes bya ba la sogs pas / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad gsungs te / ci zhig bskyed par bya'o snyam mam /
translated: he should not think,🔽“I will produce this or that,”

original: ci zhig dgag par bya'o snyam du bsams te /
analyzed: ci zhig dgag par bya'o snyam du bsams te /
translated: or “I will stop this or that.”

original: tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mi bya /
analyzed: tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mi bya /
translated: He should not complete the accumulations.🔽He should dedicate only to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'ba' zhig tu yongs su bsngo zhing yongs su rdzogs par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'ba' zhig tu yongs su bsngo zhing yongs su rdzogs par bstan pa'o //
translated: He should teach the completion.🔽He should not be joined with form, nor should he be disjoined.

original: gzugs ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod na /
analyzed: gzugs ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod na /
translated: If he practices the six perfections,

original: gzugs la kun tu sbyor ba las dbral bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la kun tu sbyor ba las dbral bar bya'o //
translated: he should be disjoined from the fetters of form.

original: mi ldan pa bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i blo bskyed par mi bya ste /
analyzed: mi ldan pa bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i blo bskyed par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not arouse the thought, “I will generate what is not present.”

original: 'di ltar bdag nyid rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag nyid rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because the self is naturally completely pure, it is neither present nor absent.

original: gzugs la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas /🔽rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba'i phung po la sogs pa la gnas par bya'o snyam pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs la gnas par bya'o zhes brtson par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas / rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba'i phung po la sogs pa la gnas par bya'o snyam pa'am /
translated: One should not strive, thinking, “I will abide in form,” etc.🔽One should not strive, thinking, “I will abide in the pleasant aggregates, etc. that are the results of evolution,”

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yang 'bras bu'i tshul du gnas par bya'o snyam du brtson par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yang 'bras bu'i tshul du gnas par bya'o snyam du brtson par mi bya ba'o //
translated: or, “I will abide in the knowledge of all aspects, which is the result.”

original: gzugs ni gang la yang mi gnas so zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs la bya'o /
analyzed: gzugs ni gang la yang mi gnas so zhes bya ba ni chos nyid kyi gzugs la bya'o /
translated: Form does not abide anywhere. This refers to the form of reality.

original: bza' shing gi dpe dang / thams cad kyi sgo dang / 'phong gi slob dpon gyi dpe'o //
analyzed: bza' shing gi dpe dang / thams cad kyi sgo dang / 'phong gi slob dpon gyi dpe'o //
translated: The example of the tree for cutting, the example of the door for all, and the example of the master of archery.

original: de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa la ci nas kyang sbyin pa mi dam pa dang / tshul khrims dang bzod pa mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sbyin pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul du dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas kyi dgongs pa la ci nas kyang sbyin pa mi dam pa dang / tshul khrims dang bzod pa mi dmigs zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sbyin pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul du dgongs pa ste /
translated: The thought is that one should not apprehend giving, etc. in the manner of non-apprehension, because they are not apprehended.

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dgongs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dgongs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The thought of the bodhisattva is that one should not apprehend even the bodhisattva in the manner of non-apprehension.🔽When one knows suchness, one knows the brief and extensive of all dharmas.

original: de bzhin nyid shes na chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe yongs su grub pa de bzhin nyid tsam du shes pa de'i tshe mdo shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid shes na chos thams cad kyi mdo dang rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe yongs su grub pa de bzhin nyid tsam du shes pa de'i tshe mdo shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one knows the perfected nature as just suchness, then one knows the brief.

original: gang gi tshe gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid la sogs pa ma dag cing yongs su ma grub par shes pa de'i tshe rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang / tshor ba'i de bzhin nyid la sogs pa ma dag cing yongs su ma grub par shes pa de'i tshe rgyas pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one knows the impure and unperfected suchness of form, feeling, etc., then one knows the extensive.

original: rab 'byor mtha' med pa ni yang dag pa'i @251b mtha' ste zhes bya ba ni mtha' zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rtse mo'i don te /
analyzed: rab 'byor mtha' med pa ni yang dag pa'i @251b mtha' ste zhes bya ba ni mtha' zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rtse mo'i don te /
translated: The word “limit” means “peak.”

original: dper na ri'i rtse mo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ri'i rtse mo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the peak of a mountain.

original: kha cig tu ni mtha' la bya ste dper na rgya mtsho'i mtha' zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni mtha' la bya ste dper na rgya mtsho'i mtha' zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In some cases, it means “end.” For example, it is like the end of the ocean.

original: mtha' de gnyi ga yang de la med de de la rtse mo'i mtha' med pa ni mtha' gang la chad pa yang ma yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' de gnyi ga yang de la med de de la rtse mo'i mtha' med pa ni mtha' gang la chad pa yang ma yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: That limit is not in either of those two. The endlessness of that is not a limit, as stated in the statement, “It is not a limit that is cut off.”

original: mtha' med pa ni yongs su chad pa med ces gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: mtha' med pa ni yongs su chad pa med ces gsungs pa ste /
translated: The endlessness is not cut off, as stated in the statement, “It is not cut off.”

original: de bas na yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni de kho na mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni de kho na mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the limit of reality is the unchanging suchness.

original: rab 'byor ji ltar chos thams cad ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa nyid kyi phyir gnyi gar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor ji ltar chos thams cad ldan pa yang ma yin mi ldan pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa nyid kyi phyir gnyi gar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Subhuti, how are all phenomena neither conjoined nor disjoined? Because they are non-entities, they are not both.

original: gcig gi tshig bla dags la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni grangs shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: gcig gi tshig bla dags la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni grangs shes pa bstan to //
translated: The expression skilled in the terms of one and so on teaches the knowledge of number.

original: bud med kyi tshig bla dags la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rtags shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: bud med kyi tshig bla dags la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rtags shes pa bstan to //
translated: The expression skilled in the terms of a woman and so on teaches the knowledge of signs.

original: lam gyi rgyun bcad pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i lam la mkhas pa'o /
analyzed: lam gyi rgyun bcad pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i lam la mkhas pa'o /
translated: The expression skilled in cutting off the continuity of the path refers to skill in the mundane path.

original: lam gyi rgyun ma bcad pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: lam gyi rgyun ma bcad pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The expression skilled in not cutting off the continuity of the path refers to skill in the supramundane path.

original: rab 'byor gzugs zhi bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni zhi ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid bzung ste shes rab bskyed par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs zhi bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni zhi ba la sogs pa mtshan nyid bzung ste shes rab bskyed par bya ba'o //
translated: Subhuti, one should practice the perfection of wisdom by means of the peacefulness of form, and so on. This means that wisdom should be generated by apprehending the characteristics of peacefulness and so on.

original: rab 'byor nam mkha' ltar stong pa nyid mngon par bsgrub pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor nam mkha' ltar stong pa nyid mngon par bsgrub pas /
translated: Subhuti, by accomplishing emptiness like space, one should practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin du stong pa nyid du rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bzhin du stong pa nyid du rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: The passage, one should accomplish the perfection of wisdom, means that one should realize emptiness like space.

original: nam mkha' stong pa nyid du bsgom pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bsgom pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid bsgom par bya ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' stong pa nyid du bsgom pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' bsgom pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid bsgom par bya ba'o //
translated: The passage, one should cultivate the perfection of wisdom by cultivating the emptiness of space, means that one should cultivate emptiness by cultivating space.

original: de la bye brag tu brjod par 'dod pa la /
analyzed: de la bye brag tu brjod par 'dod pa la /
translated: Now, in order to explain the differences,

original: dang po ni rtsol ba dang bcas mtshan ma dang bcad pa'i gnas skabs kyi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ni rtsol ba dang bcas mtshan ma dang bcad pa'i gnas skabs kyi spyod pa'o //
translated: the first is the practice of the stage of striving with signs.

original: sa dang po yin chad ni rtsol ba dang bcas la /🔽mtshan ma med pa'i gnas skabs kyi mngon par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang po yin chad ni rtsol ba dang bcas la / mtshan ma med pa'i gnas skabs kyi mngon par sgrub pa'o //
translated: From the first stage on, there is striving,🔽but it is the accomplishment of the stage of signlessness.

original: sa brgyad pa yan chad ni lhun gyis grub cing mtshan ma med pa'i gnas skabs kyi sgom pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa yan chad ni lhun gyis grub cing mtshan ma med pa'i gnas skabs kyi sgom pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: From the eighth stage on, there is effortless cultivation of the stage of signlessness.

original: sems kyi rgyun ma chad cing ma bral bar rjes su 'brel pas zhes @252a * //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun ma chad cing ma bral bar rjes su 'brel pas zhes @252a * //
translated: It is said that the mindstream is uninterrupted and connected because it is not separated from the mind.🔽

original: bya ba ni sems rgyun ma chad pa dang / ma bral ba ste /
analyzed: bya ba ni sems rgyun ma chad pa dang / ma bral ba ste /
translated: The phrase “because it is connected with the mind in an unbroken and inseparable manner” means that the mind is in an unbroken and inseparable state.

original: gang rjes su 'brel zhing rgyun chags pa des sems par chad med cing so sor ma gyis pa dang / rjes su 'brel bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang rjes su 'brel zhing rgyun chags pa des sems par chad med cing so sor ma gyis pa dang / rjes su 'brel bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “in a manner that is connected, continuous, uninterrupted, and not separated” means that the mind is in a state that is connected, continuous, uninterrupted, and not separated.

original: ci nas kyang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams mi rgyu ba de ltar bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas gyur gyi bar du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci nas kyang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams mi rgyu ba de ltar bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas gyur gyi bar du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “in such a manner that the mind and the mental factors do not move” means that one should meditate in such a way that the mind and the mental factors do not move until the attainment of the state of transformation.

original: ci lags bsgoms pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ram zhes gsol pa dang / rab 'byor de ni ma yin no zhes bsal ba gsungs te /🔽rtsol ba dang bcas /
analyzed: ci lags bsgoms pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ram zhes gsol pa dang / rab 'byor de ni ma yin no zhes bsal ba gsungs te / rtsol ba dang bcas /
translated: When asked, “Is the knowledge of all aspects attained through meditation?” the Blessed One replied, “No, Subhūti, it is not.”

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs la bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs la bya'o //
translated: This is the stage that is accompanied by effort and accompanied by investigation.

original: ma bsgoms pas sam zhes gsol nas /
analyzed: ma bsgoms pas sam zhes gsol nas /
translated: When asked, “Is it attained through nonmeditation?”

original: cang mi gsung bar gyur pa dang / ma yin no zhes bsal ba gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: cang mi gsung bar gyur pa dang / ma yin no zhes bsal ba gsungs pa'o //
translated: He remained silent, and then said, No.

original: bsgoms kyang bsgoms la ma bsgoms kyang bsgoms pas sam zhes gsol ba dang / skyon gnyis ka bshad zin pas gsal ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bsgoms kyang bsgoms la ma bsgoms kyang bsgoms pas sam zhes gsol ba dang / skyon gnyis ka bshad zin pas gsal ba gsungs so //
translated: When it was asked, Is it cultivated by both cultivation and non-cultivation? he said, No, because both faults have already been explained.

original: bsgoms pa yang ma lags ma bsgoms pa yang ma lags pas sam zhes gsol pa dang / gal gnyis su smra ba'i gzhung gis 'khrugs su dogs pas bsal ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bsgoms pa yang ma lags ma bsgoms pa yang ma lags pas sam zhes gsol pa dang / gal gnyis su smra ba'i gzhung gis 'khrugs su dogs pas bsal ba gsungs te /
translated: When it was asked, Is it cultivated by neither cultivation nor non-cultivation? he said, No, fearing confusion due to the scriptures of the two-sided proponents.

original: rnam pa thams cad du brjod du med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas skabs yin par bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du brjod du med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas skabs yin par bstan to //
translated: It is taught that it is a state that is inexpressible and inconceivable in every way.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni phyis chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i gnas su bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin nyid ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni phyis chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i gnas su bstan pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, just as suchness is refers to the later teaching of the state of non-apprehending all phenomena.

original: bdag gi khams ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi khams ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is taught as just like the realm of self and so on.

original: rab 'byor gdags su med pa'o zhes bya ba ni brjod du med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rab 'byor gdags su med pa'o zhes bya ba ni brjod du med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Subhūti, cannot be designated means it cannot be expressed.

original: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems sems can du gdags pa dmigs su yod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs pas kun brtags pa'i phyir med pa las kun rdzob tu btags pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ji snyam du sems sems can du gdags pa dmigs su yod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs pas kun brtags pa'i phyir med pa las kun rdzob tu btags pa ste /
translated: Subhuti, what do you think? Is the designation of a sentient being to be apprehended? and so on. It is taught that because of the imaginary nature of the hells and so on, they are imputed conventionally from what is nonexistent.

original: byis pa so so'i skye po rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye po rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is for the sake of benefiting the childish ordinary beings.

original: dbri ba med pa dang bsnan pa med par zhes bya ba ni yod pa la skur pa 'debs pa ni dbri ba'o //
analyzed: dbri ba med pa dang bsnan pa med par zhes bya ba ni yod pa la skur pa 'debs pa ni dbri ba'o //
translated: Without subtraction and without addition means that subtraction is the denial of what exists.

original: med pa la sgro 'dogs pa ni bsnan pa'o //
analyzed: med pa la sgro 'dogs pa ni bsnan pa'o //
translated: Addition is the superimposition of what does not exist.

original: skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa la @252b bslab pa zhes bya ba skye ba med pa'i bslab pa ni gang sgro 'dogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa la @252b bslab pa zhes bya ba skye ba med pa'i bslab pa ni gang sgro 'dogs pa med pa'o //
translated: The training in non-arising and non-cessation means that the training in non-arising is the absence of superimposition.

original: 'gag pa med pa'i bslab pa ni yod pa la gang skur pa 'debs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa'i bslab pa ni yod pa la gang skur pa 'debs pa med pa'o //
translated: The training in non-cessation is the absence of denial regarding what exists.

original: bsgom par yang mi bgyi /
analyzed: bsgom par yang mi bgyi /
translated: One should not cultivate and so on.

original: rnam par gzhig pa yang mi bgyi zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa la slob pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par gzhig pa yang mi bgyi zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa la slob pa ste /
translated: “One should not destroy” means training in the absence of fabrication.

original: bsgom par bya /
analyzed: bsgom par bya /
translated: One should cultivate🔽and generate.

original: bskyed par bya snyam pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa med pas skye ba med pa'i bslab pa'o //
analyzed: bskyed par bya snyam pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa med pas skye ba med pa'i bslab pa'o //
translated: The training in non-arising is due to the absence of fabrication in the form of thinking, “I will generate.”

original: rnam par gzhig par bya med par bya snyam pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa med pas 'gag pa med pa'i bslab pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhig par bya med par bya snyam pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa med pas 'gag pa med pa'i bslab pa'o //
translated: The training in non-cessation is due to the absence of fabrication in the form of thinking, “I will destroy.”

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs ni gzugs nyid du med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i gzugs ni gzugs nyid du med pa'o //
translated: Form is empty of form means that imagined form does not exist as form.

original: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is empty of the characteristics of form.

original: spyod pa med pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir gang la yang mi spyod pa nyid spyod pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa med pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba ni thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir gang la yang mi spyod pa nyid spyod pa'o //
translated: The absence of practice is the practice of the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva means that the very non-practice of anything is practice, because everything is not apprehended.

original: gal te spyod pa ma mchis pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa lags na las dang po ba'i byang chub sems dpas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar spyad par bgyi zhes zhus pa dang / las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpas zhes bya ba ni la sogs pas sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: gal te spyod pa ma mchis pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa lags na las dang po ba'i byang chub sems dpas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar spyad par bgyi zhes zhus pa dang / las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpas zhes bya ba ni la sogs pas sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: If the non-practice is the practice of the Bodhisattva, then how should the beginner Bodhisattva practice the perfection of wisdom?

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul du chos thams cad la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul du chos thams cad la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The beginner Bodhisattva should train in all dharmas in the manner of non-apprehension.

original: las dang po pa la don dam pa'i spyod pa med du zin kyang de'i phyir bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: las dang po pa la don dam pa'i spyod pa med du zin kyang de'i phyir bslab par bya ste /
translated: Although the beginner does not have the ultimate practice, still he should train in it.

original: bslab pa nyid spyad pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bslab pa nyid spyad pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that the training itself is the practice.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci dmigs su mchis pa mi dmigs pa lags sam zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa dmigs su mchis sam zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci dmigs su mchis pa mi dmigs pa lags sam zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa dmigs su mchis sam zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: Blessed One, is non-apprehension apprehended? This is asking if non-apprehension is apprehended.

original: dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pas /
analyzed: dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pas /
translated: Since the nature of non-apprehension is non-apprehension,

original: dmigs so zhes brjod du mi rung ba'i phyir dmigs su yod pa mi dmigs pa yang ma yin zhes bya bas bstsal ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dmigs so zhes brjod du mi rung ba'i phyir dmigs su yod pa mi dmigs pa yang ma yin zhes bya bas bstsal ba gsungs te /
translated: Because it is not tenable to say “it is observed,” “it is not observed” is stated to eliminate that.

original: dmigs su med pa'i mtshan nyid chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid yod pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa dmigs su med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs su med pa'i mtshan nyid chos thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid yod pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa dmigs su med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because the equality of all phenomena, which is the characteristic of non-observation, exists, non-observation is not non-observable. This is the meaning.

original: dmigs pa dang mi @253a * //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang mi @253a * //
translated: The equality of observation and non-observation is non-observation.

original: dmigs pa mnyam pa nyid ni mi dmigs pa ste zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dmigs su yod pa dngos po gang yin pa dang / chos thams cad dmigs su med pa dngos po med pa gang yin pa de gnyi ga yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa mnyam pa nyid ni mi dmigs pa ste zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad dmigs su yod pa dngos po gang yin pa dang / chos thams cad dmigs su med pa dngos po med pa gang yin pa de gnyi ga yang mtshungs so //
translated: That which is the existence of all phenomena that are observable and that which is the nonexistence of all phenomena that are unobservable are both equal.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are essenceless.

original: dmigs su yod pa ni kun brtags pa yin pas ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: dmigs su yod pa ni kun brtags pa yin pas ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: Since that which is observable is imagined, it is essenceless.

original: dmigs su med pa yang dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid yin pas ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: dmigs su med pa yang dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid yin pas ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: Since that which is unobservable is the nature of non-existence, it is essenceless.

original: de bas na gnyi ga yang ngo bo nyid med par mtshungs te /
analyzed: de bas na gnyi ga yang ngo bo nyid med par mtshungs te /
translated: Therefore, both are the same in being without own-being.

original: dmigs su yod pa dang / dmigs su med pa de gnyis kyi mnyam pa nyid ngo bo nyid med pa /
analyzed: dmigs su yod pa dang / dmigs su med pa de gnyis kyi mnyam pa nyid ngo bo nyid med pa /
translated: The sameness of those two, the existent and the nonexistent, is the non-existence of own-being.

original: gang yin pa de ni dmigs su med pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang yin pa de ni dmigs su med pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is to say, it is non-apprehensible.

original: ji ltar sa nas sa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar sa nas sa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi /
translated: How should one perfect the stages?🔽How should one attain the knowledge of all modes?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ji ltar thob par bgyi zhes bya ba ni gal te dmigs pa la chags par ma gyur na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ji ltar thob par bgyi zhes bya ba ni gal te dmigs pa la chags par ma gyur na /
translated: If one does not become attached to the objective support,

original: gong nas gong ma'i sa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la ji ltar brtson par bya zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gong nas gong ma'i sa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la ji ltar brtson par bya zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: how should one strive for the higher stages and the knowledge of all modes?

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dmigs su med ces bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dmigs su med ces bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bstan te /
translated: Subhuti: If the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended, nor the knowledge of all modes, nor the stage of a Bodhisattva, nor the stage of a Disciple, nor the stage of a Pratyekabuddha, nor the stage of a Tathagata, then how can a Bodhisattva, who has not apprehended the stages, go forth to the knowledge of all modes?

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis /
translated: The Lord: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.

original: sa gong ma'am rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sa gong ma'am rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not apprehended, nor the knowledge of all modes, nor the stage of a Bodhisattva, nor the stage of a Disciple, nor the stage of a Pratyekabuddha, nor the stage of a Tathagata.

original: ji lta ji ltar dmigs su med pa mthu dang ldan par gyur pa de lta de ltar sa gzhan nas gzhan du 'phar ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar dmigs su med pa mthu dang ldan par gyur pa de lta de ltar sa gzhan nas gzhan du 'phar ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur te /
translated: As much as non-apprehension becomes powerful, to that extent one leaps from stage to stage, and attains the knowledge of all modes.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dmigs su med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro zhes ston to //
translated: This is what is being taught: because the perfection of wisdom, enlightenment, and the bodhisattvas are of the nature of non-apprehension.

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid dang bral ba la ji ltar rab tu rnam par dbye bar bgyi zhes bya ba ni gal te chos thams cad ngo bo nyid dang bal ba yin na /🔽'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid dang bral ba la ji ltar rab tu rnam par dbye bar bgyi zhes bya ba ni gal te chos thams cad ngo bo nyid dang bal ba yin na / 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: How can one discriminate among all dharmas which are devoid of own-being? This is saying: if all dharmas are devoid of own-being,🔽how can one discriminate among them, saying, “This is form,

original: 'di ni tshor ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs par rab tu rnam par dbye bar ji ltar byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshor ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs par rab tu rnam par dbye bar ji ltar byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: this is feeling,” and so on?

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' ni ji ltar na byas pas gzugs dmigs par 'gyur ba de ltar chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed @253b par mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' ni ji ltar na byas pas gzugs dmigs par 'gyur ba de ltar chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed @253b par mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bstan te /
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva does not discern phenomena in such a way that form is apprehended by the act of fabrication.

original: byang chub sems dpas ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams mi dmigs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams mi dmigs te /
translated: The bodhisattva does not apprehend phenomena such as form.

original: ji lta ji ltar sgrub pa de lta de ltar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar sgrub pa de lta de ltar mi dmigs so //
translated: The more one practices, the less one apprehends.

original: de bas na dmigs su med pa'i don la rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: de bas na dmigs su med pa'i don la rab tu 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, one enters into the meaning of non-apprehension.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te gzugs kyang mi dmigs zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad gsol te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te gzugs kyang mi dmigs zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad gsol te /
translated: Blessed One, if form is not apprehended, etc.

original: gal te dmigs su med pa'i don la rab tu zhugs pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te dmigs su med pa'i don la rab tu zhugs pa yin na /
translated: If one enters into the meaning of non-apprehension,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / skyon med par 'jug pa dang / zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / mngon par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / skyon med par 'jug pa dang / zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / mngon par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang /
translated: How can the bodhisattva practice be accomplished in the perfections, in entering into the faultless, in purifying the field, in maturing sentient beings, in full enlightenment, in turning the wheel of the Dharma,

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa dang / sems can rnam par grol bar bya ba la sogs pa dmigs pa'i sbyor ba rnams ji ltar grub par 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa dang / sems can rnam par grol bar bya ba la sogs pa dmigs pa'i sbyor ba rnams ji ltar grub par 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: in the deeds of a Buddha, in liberating sentient beings, and so on?

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' ni gzugs kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' ni gzugs kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bstan te /
translated: Subhuti, the bodhisattva does not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of form, etc.🔽 This is taught as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpas ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la mi spyod kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la mi spyod kyi /
translated: The bodhisattva does not practice with regard to phenomena such as form, etc.

original: chos thams cad dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir ro spyod do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad dmigs su med pa nyid kyi phyir ro spyod do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because all phenomena are unobservable.

original: sngar bshad pa'i dmigs su yod pa ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad yin gyi /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i dmigs su yod pa ni kun rdzob kyi tha snyad yin gyi /
translated: The existence of an object as previously explained is a conventional expression,

original: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: but not in the ultimate sense.

original: ma byas pa 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ba'i don ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: ma byas pa 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ba'i don ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of “uncreated” and “unchanging” has already been explained.🔽How can the three vehicles be differentiated?

original: theg pa gsum po dag ji ltar rnam par dgod par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gal te chos thams cad ma byas pa /
analyzed: theg pa gsum po dag ji ltar rnam par dgod par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gal te chos thams cad ma byas pa /
translated: If all dharmas are uncreated

original: 'gyur ba med pa yin na /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa yin na /
translated: and unchanging,

original: theg pa gsum du dbye ba med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: theg pa gsum du dbye ba med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: then it would follow that there would be no differentiation into three vehicles.🔽Subhuti, in uncreated and unchanging dharmas, no differentiation whatsoever is apprehended.

original: rab 'byor ma byas pa dang / 'gyur ba med pa'i chos rnams la ni rnam par dgod pa gang yang dmigs su med de zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i theg pa rnam par dgod pa dag don dam par yod pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor ma byas pa dang / 'gyur ba med pa'i chos rnams la ni rnam par dgod pa gang yang dmigs su med de zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i theg pa rnam par dgod pa dag don dam par yod pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that the differentiation of the imagined vehicles does not exist in the ultimate.

original: 'dir zhus pa dang lan btab pa dag go sla bas rnam par ma bkrol lo //
analyzed: 'dir zhus pa dang lan btab pa dag go sla bas rnam par ma bkrol lo //
translated: Here the question and answer are easy to understand, so they are not explained in detail.

original: ngas ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yang dag pa ma yin pa las 'dzin pa las zlog gi don dam par @254a * //
analyzed: ngas ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yang dag pa ma yin pa las 'dzin pa las zlog gi don dam par @254a * //
translated: I refute the grasping of what is not real even in terms of worldly convention, but not in terms of ultimate reality.

original: ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam par phung po gsum du gtogs pa'i sems can gang yang dmigs su med kyi /
analyzed: ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni don dam par phung po gsum du gtogs pa'i sems can gang yang dmigs su med kyi /
translated: In terms of ultimate reality, no sentient being whatsoever is observed that belongs to any of the three groups.

original: de dag yang dag pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams la yang dag par 'dzin pa las 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu slar ldog par zad de /
analyzed: de dag yang dag pa ma yin pa'i chos rnams la yang dag par 'dzin pa las 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob tu slar ldog par zad de /
translated: It is only in terms of worldly convention that I refute the grasping of what is not real in regard to those who grasp what is not real.

original: ming des tha snyad du 'dogs kyi /
analyzed: ming des tha snyad du 'dogs kyi /
translated: I designate them by that name conventionally,

original: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: but not ultimately.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa don dam pa la bzhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa don dam pa la bzhugs te /
translated: Blessed One, when the Tathāgata abides in ultimate reality,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas sam zhes zhus pa la /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas sam zhes zhus pa la /
translated: has he fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: don dam par gnas med pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba med pa'i phyir rab 'byor de ni ma yin no zhes bstsal ba gsungs so //
analyzed: don dam par gnas med pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba med pa'i phyir rab 'byor de ni ma yin no zhes bstsal ba gsungs so //
translated: Because there is no abiding ultimately and there is no buddhahood to be attained, Subhūti, it is not so.

original: 'o na rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam grangs la bzhugs te'am zhes bya ba ni gal te don dam pa la ma yin na /
analyzed: 'o na rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam grangs la bzhugs te'am zhes bya ba ni gal te don dam pa la ma yin na /
translated: If it is not in the ultimate, then is it in the enumeration of miracles?

original: 'o na sprul pas sam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: 'o na sprul pas sam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: This means, is it in an emanation?

original: / de yang shin tu med pa'i phyir lan gsungs te /
analyzed: / de yang shin tu med pa'i phyir lan gsungs te /
translated: The answer is given:

original: brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid dang / so sor rang gis rig pa'i rnam pas chos thams cad rtogs pa ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid dang / so sor rang gis rig pa'i rnam pas chos thams cad rtogs pa ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
translated: Because it is the inexpressible nature and the realization of all phenomena by the aspect of individual knowledge is complete buddhahood.

original: 'dir yang ci khyod don dam pa la zhugs te'am rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam grangs la zhugs te'am zhes ci'i phyir khyod gnas 'dri bar byed ces dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang ci khyod don dam pa la zhugs te'am rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam grangs la zhugs te'am zhes ci'i phyir khyod gnas 'dri bar byed ces dgongs pa'o //
translated: Here, the thought is, why do you ask about these two abodes, “Is it in the ultimate or in the enumeration of miracles?”

original: de ni 'dus byas kyi khams sam 'dus ma byas kyi khams gang la yang gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub kyang gang la yang gnas pa ma yin par bstan te /
analyzed: de ni 'dus byas kyi khams sam 'dus ma byas kyi khams gang la yang gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas byang chub kyang gang la yang gnas pa ma yin par bstan te /
translated: It is not located in any compounded or uncompounded element.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa'i dpes bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa'i dpes bstan to //
translated: The Tathagata has taught this with the example of a magical creation.🔽Subhuti, there is no difference between the Tathagata and the Tathagata's magical creation.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa la khyad par med do zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa las byed do zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba na /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa la khyad par med do zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa las byed do zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba na /
translated: The Tathagata's magical creation does the work.

original: gang gi tshe bdag cag gi bcom ldan 'das byams pa la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag cag gi bcom ldan 'das byams pa la /
translated: When the Blessed Buddha is in Parinirvana,🔽at that time, when the Bodhisattva does not see a Bodhisattva who is fit to be prophesied by the Blessed One Maitreya,

original: khyod kyis nga 'das pa'i 'og tu sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byas nas sems can rnams kyi don byos shig ces bya bar lung bstan du 'os pa lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa' ma gzigs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: khyod kyis nga 'das pa'i 'og tu sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byas nas sems can rnams kyi don byos shig ces bya bar lung bstan du 'os pa lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa' ma gzigs pa de'i tshe /
translated: who will do the work of a Buddha after I have passed away, and who will work for the benefit of beings,

original: nyid kyi sku dang mtshungs pa gzugs phun @254b sum tshogs pa'i sprul pa sprul nas khyod sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byos shig ces bka' stsal te /
analyzed: nyid kyi sku dang mtshungs pa gzugs phun @254b sum tshogs pa'i sprul pa sprul nas khyod sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byos shig ces bka' stsal te /
translated: Having emanated a body similar to his own, endowed with the best of forms, he says to him, “You must perform the deeds of a Buddha.”

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de'i tshe /
translated: When he has entered into complete Nirvana,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa de 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa de 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad de /
translated: that emanation of the Tathagata performs the deeds of a Buddha in all the world systems

original: sems can rnams la phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan 'dogs so //
translated: and benefits sentient beings.

original: gang gi tshe lung bstan du 'os pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzigs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lung bstan du 'os pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzigs pa de'i tshe /
translated: When he sees a Bodhisattva who is fit to be prophesied,

original: sems can rnams de'i lag tu gtad nas nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ston te /
analyzed: sems can rnams de'i lag tu gtad nas nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ston te /
translated: he entrusts sentient beings to his care and then demonstrates his own complete Nirvana.

original: sprul pa de dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la bye brag cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: sprul pa de dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la bye brag cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is not the slightest difference between that emanation and the Tathagata.

original: chos nyid de nyid kyi sprul pa yang zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga yang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa dang / sems can la phan pa nyid kyi phyir byung ba dang / de'i mdzad pa mdzad pa'i phyir de skad du bshad do //
analyzed: chos nyid de nyid kyi sprul pa yang zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga yang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa dang / sems can la phan pa nyid kyi phyir byung ba dang / de'i mdzad pa mdzad pa'i phyir de skad du bshad do //
translated: The emanation of that reality itself is called both, because they are both the nature of non-existence, and because they arise for the benefit of sentient beings, and because they perform their deeds.

original: de'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnams kyi chos nyid dkrugs par ma gyur tam zhes bya ba ni med pa'i chos rnams yod pa nyid du bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnams kyi chos nyid dkrugs par ma gyur tam zhes bya ba ni med pa'i chos rnams yod pa nyid du bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, Bhagavan, has the reality of phenomena not been disturbed? means because non-existent phenomena are explained as existent.

original: rab 'byor ngas ni ming dang mtshan mas chos rnams bstan te zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du byis pa'i yongs su rtog pa zhal gyis bzhes kyi gzhan du sla ba ma yin pas de skad brjod do //
analyzed: rab 'byor ngas ni ming dang mtshan mas chos rnams bstan te zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du byis pa'i yongs su rtog pa zhal gyis bzhes kyi gzhan du sla ba ma yin pas de skad brjod do //
translated: Subhuti, I have taught phenomena with names and signs means that in worldly conventions, the conceptions of the childish are accepted, but it is not easy to do otherwise, so it is said.

original: ming dang mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams la /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams la /
translated: There is no attachment to names and signs means that for worldly people,

original: rnam par gzhan gyis go bar bya mi nus shing dka' ba'i phyir de dang mthun pa'i kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du byas kyi /
analyzed: rnam par gzhan gyis go bar bya mi nus shing dka' ba'i phyir de dang mthun pa'i kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du byas kyi /
translated: It is called a conventional expression of the relative because it is not understood by others, and because it is difficult.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pas nyes pa med do //
translated: But there is no fault, because there is no attachment.

original: gal te 'di ni bden pa'o zhes mngon par zhen pa de'i phyir nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gal te 'di ni bden pa'o zhes mngon par zhen pa de'i phyir nyes par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: If one were to think, “This is the truth,” then there would be a fault.

original: rab 'byor rnam pa gal te ming ming la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ram /🔽mtshan ma mtshan ma la mngon par zhen par 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba ni gal te ming ming la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ram ;
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam pa gal te ming ming la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ram / mtshan ma mtshan ma la mngon par zhen par 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba ni gal te ming ming la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ram ;
translated: Subhūti, if a name were to be attached to a name,

original: mtshan ma mtshan ma la mngon par zhen par 'gyur na /
analyzed: mtshan ma mtshan ma la mngon par zhen par 'gyur na /
translated: or if a sign were to be attached to a sign,

original: de lta na ni stong pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni stong pa nyid kyang stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ro //
translated: then emptiness would be attached to emptiness,

original: de bzhin du mtshan ma med pa la sogs pa yang mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan ma med pa la sogs pa yang mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: and likewise signlessness and so on would be attached.

original: 'di ltar stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni dngos @255a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni dngos @255a * //
translated: Thus, emptiness and so on are not established as things.🔽

original: po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, emptiness and so on are not reified, because they are the nature of non-existence.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos rnams kyi mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos rnams kyi mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the Buddhas and the Hearers do not reify.

original: rab 'byor 'di ltar chos thams cad ming dang / mtshan ma tsam du zad do zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar chos thams cad ming dang / mtshan ma tsam du zad na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ltar chos thams cad ming dang / mtshan ma tsam du zad do zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar chos thams cad ming dang / mtshan ma tsam du zad na /
translated: Subhūti, it is because all dharmas are merely names and signs.

original: 'jig rten rnams kyis de ltar mi shes te /
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams kyis de ltar mi shes te /
translated: The world does not know this,

original: de bas na de dag gis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na de dag gis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: and therefore the Bodhisattvas practice in order to make them understand.

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du zad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du zad de /
translated: Thus, all dharmas are merely names and signs.

original: de'i phyir de dag rtogs pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag rtogs pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, by understanding them, they attain the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gal te chos 'ga' zhig dngos po yod na /
analyzed: gal te chos 'ga' zhig dngos po yod na /
translated: If any dharma existed as a thing,

original: de lta na ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: If it were so, then one would not fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor thams cad shes pa nyid ces bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor thams cad shes pa nyid ces bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi'o //
translated: Subhūti, the knowledge of all modes is that of all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi'o //
translated: The knowledge of paths is that of bodhisattva great beings.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is that of tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas.

original: de la thams cad shes pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de la thams cad shes pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa'o //
translated: There, the knowledge of all modes is that all conditioned things are impermanent.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: All that is contaminated is suffering.

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes thams cad shes pa nyid rnam pa gsum gyis zhugs nas chos dang rjes su rtog pa'i shes pa'i dbang gis chos thams cad kyi mthar gtugs pa'i shes pa ni thams cad shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes thams cad shes pa nyid rnam pa gsum gyis zhugs nas chos dang rjes su rtog pa'i shes pa'i dbang gis chos thams cad kyi mthar gtugs pa'i shes pa ni thams cad shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Having entered into the knowledge of all phenomena through the three aspects of the knowledge of all things, the knowledge that is the culmination of all things by the power of the knowledge of phenomena and subsequent knowledge is called the knowledge of all things.

original: shes pa de yang chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du shes pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: shes pa de yang chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du shes pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: That knowledge is not the knowledge of all things in all their aspects,

original: mtshan nyid gsum dang / bden pa bzhi'i sgo nas chos thams cad la rmongs pa med pa'i phyir nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi shes pa la thams cad shes pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum dang / bden pa bzhi'i sgo nas chos thams cad la rmongs pa med pa'i phyir nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi shes pa la thams cad shes pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: but because it is not confused about all things through the three realities and the four truths, the knowledge of the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas is called the knowledge of all things.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ces bya ba 'di la byang chub sems dpa' dang po sems bskyed pa nas mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ces bya ba 'di la byang chub sems dpa' dang po sems bskyed pa nas mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas bzung ste /
translated: The knowledge of the aspects of the path.

original: sa chos @255b kyi sprin la thug gi bar du kun du 'gro ba'i don dang / mchog gi don la sogs pa rab tu rtogs pas de bzhin nyid rnam par spyod pa la zhugs pa gnas gyur pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / sems can thams cad la phan pa dang /
analyzed: sa chos @255b kyi sprin la thug gi bar du kun du 'gro ba'i don dang / mchog gi don la sogs pa rab tu rtogs pas de bzhin nyid rnam par spyod pa la zhugs pa gnas gyur pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / sems can thams cad la phan pa dang /
translated: It is the cause for the transformation of the bodhisattva who has entered the practice of the suchness of the path of seeing, which is the realization of the meaning of all-pervasiveness and the meaning of the supreme and so on up to the cloud of the stage of the earth.🔽It is the wisdom that causes the attainment of the great city of omniscience for the sake of benefiting and

original: bde ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i ye shes rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong khyer chen por phyin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i ye shes rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong khyer chen por phyin par byed pa ste /
translated: happy all sentient beings.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ces bya'o //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid ces bya'o // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: It is called the knowledge of the aspects of the path.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa'i sems can gyi don gyi rgyun ma bcad pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ye shes nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa'i sems can gyi don gyi rgyun ma bcad pa /
translated: Omniscience is the wisdom of the buddhas that is uninterrupted in its continuity of benefit for sentient beings that extends to the limits of space.

original: chos kyi sku rab tu rtogs pa /
analyzed: chos kyi sku rab tu rtogs pa /
translated: It is the realization of the dharmakāya.

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba rab tu spangs pa 'bras bu'i ye shes te /
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba rab tu spangs pa 'bras bu'i ye shes te /
translated: It is the wisdom of the result that has completely abandoned the connections of traces.

original: chos thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la rnam pa thams cad du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: It is called “the knowledge of all aspects” because it is the result of having engaged in all aspects of all phenomena.🔽Subhūti, it is called “the knowledge of all aspects” in one way, in that it is the aspect of peace.

original: rab 'byor rnam pa gcig gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ste 'di ltar zhi ba'i rnam pas zhes bya ba ni gang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis yongs su rtogs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa thams cad rab tu nub cing sems can gyi 'jig rten dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam pa gcig gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ste 'di ltar zhi ba'i rnam pas zhes bya ba ni gang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis yongs su rtogs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa thams cad rab tu nub cing sems can gyi 'jig rten dang /
translated: The aspect of peace is the aspect of the complete pacification of all conceptual thoughts that are realized by the tathāgatas.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten mtha' dag dang / bral bas khams gsum du gtogs pa'i tshul khrims kyis rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa'i dra ba 'gags par gyur pa na /
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten mtha' dag dang / bral bas khams gsum du gtogs pa'i tshul khrims kyis rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa'i dra ba 'gags par gyur pa na /
translated: When the net of conceptual elaborations of the discipline that is included in the three realms is stopped,🔽the dharmadhātu, which is utterly pure, enters into sameness.

original: chos kyi dbyings shing tu rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid kyi rnam par zhugs pa lhun gyis grub pa'i chos kyi su'i bdag nyid shin du zhi ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa de /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shing tu rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid kyi rnam par zhugs pa lhun gyis grub pa'i chos kyi su'i bdag nyid shin du zhi ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa de /
translated: The aspect of peace is the nature of the spontaneous dharma.

original: chos thams cad kyi rnam pa yin pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad ces bya ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rnam pa yin pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad ces bya ste /
translated: It is called “all aspects” because it is the aspect of all phenomena.

original: rnam pa de lta bur zhugs pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin de lta bu la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bur zhugs pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin de lta bu la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The knowledge that penetrates in that way is called “the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba spangs pa zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags rnams las /
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba spangs pa zhes bya ba ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags rnams las /
translated: “Abandoning the connection of the latent afflictions” means that, from among the latent afflictions of the karma and afflictions,

original: 'dir sems can rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nas gcig tu bar ma chad par 'byung ba gang yin pa de /
analyzed: 'dir sems can rnams kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nas gcig tu bar ma chad par 'byung ba gang yin pa de /
translated: Here, the uninterrupted arising of the causes and effects of sentient beings

original: rgyun chad pa la bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba spangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa la bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba spangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: is called “abandoning the connection of the latent afflictions.”

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob par nyon mongs pa spang @256a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob par nyon mongs pa spang @256a * //
translated: “Is the abandonment of the afflictions uncompounded without obtaining the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: pa 'dus ma bgyis lags sam zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de skad gsungs te /
analyzed: pa 'dus ma bgyis lags sam zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de skad gsungs te /
translated: This is said because it has the nature of cessation.

original: 'gog pa ni spong ba tsam du zad pas /
analyzed: 'gog pa ni spong ba tsam du zad pas /
translated: Cessation is merely the abandonment of the afflictions.

original: lus dang dag gi 'gyur ba dag ni 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lus dang dag gi 'gyur ba dag ni 'byung ngo //
translated: The body and speech of the bodhisattvas are transformed.🔽And these are not harmful to ordinary people.

original: de dag kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams la gnod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni me long la lta ba dang / mchong zhing 'gro ba la sogs pa dang / pi lin da bad sas dmangs mo'i tshig brjod pa bzhin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams la gnod par 'gyur ba ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni me long la lta ba dang / mchong zhing 'gro ba la sogs pa dang / pi lin da bad sas dmangs mo'i tshig brjod pa bzhin te /
translated: This is like the example of looking in a mirror, or jumping and walking, or like the words of a slave woman.

original: de dag kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams sam 'phags pa rnams gang la yang gnod par ni mi 'gyur ro //🔽ci lam la gnas te 'am /
analyzed: de dag kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams sam 'phags pa rnams gang la yang gnod par ni mi 'gyur ro // ci lam la gnas te 'am /
translated: These are not harmful to either ordinary people or noble beings.

original: lam ma yin pa la gnas te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis slar bka' stsal te /
analyzed: lam ma yin pa la gnas te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis slar bka' stsal te /
translated: The Bhagavān again asked, “Do you abide in the path or do you abide in what is not the path?”

original: lam ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas gnas su mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lam ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas gnas su mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Bhagavān said, “The path is not suitable as a basis because it has the nature of non-entityness.”

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te lam dngos po ma mchis la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te lam dngos po ma mchis la /
translated: Subhūti said, “Bhagavān, if the path is a non-entity

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang dngos po ma mchis na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang dngos po ma mchis na /
translated: and nirvāṇa is also a non-entity,

original: 'on ci'i slad du 'di skad du 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on ci'i slad du 'di skad du 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
translated: Why is it that you say, This is a stream-enterer,

original: 'di ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o zhes bshad ces bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: 'di ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'o zhes bshad ces bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: This is a once-returner, and so on?

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams dang sangs rgyas bshad pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams dang sangs rgyas bshad pa /
translated: The Buddha explains the noble persons and buddhas.

original: lam gyi dbang gis bshad dam /
analyzed: lam gyi dbang gis bshad dam /
translated: Is it explained by the power of the path,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thob pas bshad grang na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thob pas bshad grang na /
translated: or is it explained by attaining nirvana?

original: gal te gnyi ga med na 'phags pa'i gang zag ji ltar rnam par 'god ces dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te gnyi ga med na 'phags pa'i gang zag ji ltar rnam par 'god ces dgongs pa'o //
translated: If neither is the case, how are the noble persons established?

original: rab 'byor de dag thams cad kyang 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes bya ba ni lam dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis med du zin kyang /
analyzed: rab 'byor de dag thams cad kyang 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes bya ba ni lam dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis med du zin kyang /
translated: Subhuti, all of these are distinguished by the unconditioned. Although the two, the path and nirvana, are non-dual,

original: 'dus byas med pa'i rang bzhin de bzhin nyid kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes slar bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas med pa'i rang bzhin de bzhin nyid kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes slar bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: it is said again that they are distinguished by suchness, which is the nature of the absence of the conditioned.

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags 'dus ma bgyis pa de 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o zhes rab tu 'byed pa mchis sam zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye bas 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes dgongs na /🔽ci 'dus ma byas pa de gang zag de dag rab tu 'byed dam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags 'dus ma bgyis pa de 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o zhes rab tu 'byed pa mchis sam zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye bas 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes dgongs na / ci 'dus ma byas pa de gang zag de dag rab tu 'byed dam /
translated: The Blessed One, is there a differentiation of the unconditioned in the sense that this is a stream-enterer?

original: skyed par 'gyur ram zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: skyed par 'gyur ram zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: Does the unconditioned differentiate those persons, or does it generate them?

original: rab 'byor 'dus ma byas ni rab tu 'byed pa med mod kyi zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas skyed par mi byed mod kyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'dus ma byas ni rab tu 'byed pa med mod kyi zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas skyed par mi byed mod kyi /
translated: Subhūti, the unconditioned is indeed without differentiation, means that the unconditioned does not generate anything.

original: 'on kyang gnas @256b gyur pa'i dbang gis de bzhin nyid la 'jug pa'i bye brag dang / nyon mongs pa bag la nyal bar spong ba'i bye brag gis de dag de lta de lta bur 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes bshad do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gnas @256b gyur pa'i dbang gis de bzhin nyid la 'jug pa'i bye brag dang / nyon mongs pa bag la nyal bar spong ba'i bye brag gis de dag de lta de lta bur 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes bshad do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: However, due to the power of transformation, by the distinction of engaging in suchness and the distinction of abandoning latent afflictions, they become such and such. Therefore, it is explained that the unconditioned is differentiated by the unconditioned. This is the teaching.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'o na ji ltar 'khor ba'i phyi ma'i mtha' mchis par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sngar thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la sogs pa bshad pa las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'o na ji ltar 'khor ba'i phyi ma'i mtha' mchis par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sngar thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid la sogs pa bshad pa las /
translated: In the earlier explanation of the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, etc.

original: 'khor ba med do zhes 'khor ba'i thog ma dang / tha ma dang / dbus dmigs su med pa smos la /
analyzed: 'khor ba med do zhes 'khor ba'i thog ma dang / tha ma dang / dbus dmigs su med pa smos la /
translated: it was said that there is no Samsara, and that the beginning, end, and middle of Samsara cannot be apprehended.

original: da ni dgra bcom pa dag 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: da ni dgra bcom pa dag 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye bar 'gyur na /
translated: Now, if the Arhats are distinguished by the unconditioned,

original: 'khor ba'i phyi ma'i mtha' yod par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs nas zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i phyi ma'i mtha' yod par 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs nas zhus pa'o //
translated: then there will be a later end of Samsara.🔽 The Lord: The worldly conventional is accepted as valid cognition, not the ultimate.

original: rab 'byor 'jig rten gyi tha snyad tshad mar byas kyi don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni so so skye bo rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid ni dus thams cad du 'jug pa'i phyir phyi ma'i mtha' med mod kyi /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'jig rten gyi tha snyad tshad mar byas kyi don dam par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni so so skye bo rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid ni dus thams cad du 'jug pa'i phyir phyi ma'i mtha' med mod kyi /
translated: The Suchness of the common people and of the Arhats is always present, and so there is no later end of Samsara.

original: 'on kyang gang phung po lnga zhes bya ba kun brtags pa'i chos de /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang phung po lnga zhes bya ba kun brtags pa'i chos de /
translated: But the five aggregates which are imagined as dharmas

original: rgyun chad pa nye bar bzung nas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du de lta bu dag bshad do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa nye bar bzung nas 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du de lta bu dag bshad do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and, taking up the continuity, they are explained in that way in worldly convention.

original: de bas na gang dang gang gis mtha' chad pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na gang dang gang gis mtha' chad pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “whatever and by whatever is cut off.”

original: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la sngon gyi mtha' mi dmigs na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa la sngon gyi mtha' mi dmigs na /
translated: Subhūti, if all phenomena are empty of their own marks, the prior limit is not apprehended.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' smos kyang mi 'tshal zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa phung po lnga'i chos dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' smos kyang mi 'tshal zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa phung po lnga'i chos dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: The Blessed One said, “If the imagined, which is the five aggregates, is empty of its own mark, because it is the nature of non-existence,

original: sgyu ma lta bu yin pa'i phyir de dag skye ba'i 'du shes can rnams kyi sngon gyi mtha' yang med na /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu yin pa'i phyir de dag skye ba'i 'du shes can rnams kyi sngon gyi mtha' yang med na /
translated: then, since they are like an illusion, those who have the notion of arising do not have a prior limit.

original: 'gag pa'i 'du shes can rnams kyi phyi ma'i mtha' lta ga la yod ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa'i 'du shes can rnams kyi phyi ma'i mtha' lta ga la yod ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: How could those who have the notion of cessation have a posterior limit?”

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin no //
translated: Subhūti, it is just so!

original: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa'i phyir de'i tshig la rjes su yi rang ba'o //
analyzed: de de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad skye ba med cing 'gag pa med pa'i phyir de'i tshig la rjes su yi rang ba'o //
translated: That is so means that because all phenomena are unborn and unceasing, one rejoices in that statement.

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos thams cad kyi pha rol dam pa ste /🔽de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos thams cad kyi pha rol dam pa ste / de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Subhūti, this perfection of wisdom is the highest perfection of all phenomena.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir rnam par rtog pa'i don bzhi yod de re zhig dang por pha rol @257a * //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir rnam par rtog pa'i don bzhi yod de re zhig dang por pha rol @257a * //
translated: Therefore, it is called the perfection of wisdom. Here, the term perfection has four meanings of conceptualization.

original: tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i sgra dang don mtshungs pa pa mtha' zhes bya ba'i sgra yang yod de /
analyzed: tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'i sgra dang don mtshungs pa pa mtha' zhes bya ba'i sgra yang yod de /
translated: First, the term perfection and the term end have a similar meaning.

original: pha mtha'i dngos po la ni pha rol nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: pha mtha'i dngos po la ni pha rol nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The state of the end is called the other shore.

original: chos thams cad kyi pha mthar gyur cing chos thams cad kyi mthar thug par gnas pa'i phyir pha rol nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi pha mthar gyur cing chos thams cad kyi mthar thug par gnas pa'i phyir pha rol nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Because it is the other shore of all phenomena and because it is the ultimate of all phenomena, it is called the other shore.

original: lung las kyang /
analyzed: lung las kyang /
translated: Also, in the scriptures it is said:

original: dngos po'i rkyen tha ma na yod kyang chos kho nar brjod de /
analyzed: dngos po'i rkyen tha ma na yod kyang chos kho nar brjod de /
translated: Although the condition of things is ultimate, it is called a phenomenon.

original: dper na chu'i khams gsher ba la chu'i khams gsher ba nyid do zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na chu'i khams gsher ba la chu'i khams gsher ba nyid do zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: For example, the water element is moisture, and it is called the moisture of the water element.

original: de bas na rab 'byor 'di ni chos thams cad kyi pha rol nyid dam pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na rab 'byor 'di ni chos thams cad kyi pha rol nyid dam pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, Subhūti, this is the highest perfection of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad kyi shin tu pha rol nyid mthar thug pa'i pha rol nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi shin tu pha rol nyid mthar thug pa'i pha rol nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means the ultimate perfection of all phenomena, the final perfection.

original: yang na pha rol zhes bya ba ni mtha'o //
analyzed: yang na pha rol zhes bya ba ni mtha'o //
translated: Or, the other shore is the end.

original: phyin pa ni son pa ste /
analyzed: phyin pa ni son pa ste /
translated: To go is to arrive.

original: de'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is a perfection.

original: de bas na nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'dis pha rol du son zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'dis pha rol du son zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that all śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and tathāgatas have gone to the other shore by this.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'gro bar byed pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'gro bar byed pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it causes one to go to the other shore, it is called a perfection.

original: yang na dam pa'i sgra ni don dam pa la bya ste /🔽dam pa las byung ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: yang na dam pa'i sgra ni don dam pa la bya ste / dam pa las byung ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Alternatively, the term “sublime” refers to the ultimate.🔽The perfection is so called because it arises from the sublime,
