original: don dam pa la dmigs pa las byung ba'i phyir dam pa las byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa la dmigs pa las byung ba'i phyir dam pa las byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: that is, it arises from the observation of the ultimate.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi rang bzhin la dmigs nas byung ba'i shes rab ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid don dam pa chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi rang bzhin la dmigs nas byung ba'i shes rab ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the wisdom that arises from the observation of the ultimate, which is characterized by nondwelling nirvana, the nature of the equality of all phenomena.

original: de bas na don dam par chos thams cad dbyer med pa'i don gang yin pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na don dam par chos thams cad dbyer med pa'i don gang yin pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the phrase “the perfection of wisdom by which the tathāgatas fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood” is the meaning of the inseparability of all phenomena in the ultimate.

original: shes rab ni don dam pa la dmigs pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis don dam pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: shes rab ni don dam pa la dmigs pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis don dam pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: Wisdom is so called because it observes the ultimate, and the tathāgatas fully awaken to the ultimate.

original: yang na pha rol gyi sgra ni de bzhin nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: yang na pha rol gyi sgra ni de bzhin nyid la bya ste /
translated: Or else, the word “other” refers to reality.

original: thams cad kyi pha rol tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi pha rol tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the other shore of all.

original: pha rol tu phyin par gyur pa de bzhin nyid thob pa la pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin par gyur pa de bzhin nyid thob pa la pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The attainment of reality, which is the other shore, is called “perfection.”

original: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir de bzhin nyid kyang chud /
analyzed: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dir de bzhin nyid kyang chud /
translated: Therefore, this perfection of wisdom includes reality.

original: ma nor @257b ba de bzhin nyid kyang chud ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ma nor @257b ba de bzhin nyid kyang chud ces gsungs so //
translated: It includes unerring reality.

original: de bzhin nyid la sogs pa 'dir chud pa'i phyir 'di ni de bzhin nyid la sogs pa la khyab par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ming can yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la sogs pa 'dir chud pa'i phyir 'di ni de bzhin nyid la sogs pa la khyab par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ming can yin no //
translated: Because reality, etc., are included in this, it has the name “pervading reality, etc.”

original: ldan pa'am mi ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis man chad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid 'ba' zhig ston to //
analyzed: ldan pa'am mi ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis man chad ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid 'ba' zhig ston to //
translated: The phrase “endowed or not endowed,” etc., teaches only the intrinsic reality of the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos thams cad spyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos thams cad spyod par byed pa'o //
translated: This perfection of wisdom is the practice of all dharmas.

original: spobs pa thams cad sbyin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la spyod cing /
analyzed: spobs pa thams cad sbyin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad la spyod cing /
translated: “It gives all self-confidence” means that it gives all knowledge.

original: shes pa thams cad skyed par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽'di ltar spyod par byed pa gang yin pa dang / gang gi tshe spyod pa dang / ji ltar spyod pa de dag thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni spyod pa po dang /
analyzed: shes pa thams cad skyed par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'di ltar spyod par byed pa gang yin pa dang / gang gi tshe spyod pa dang / ji ltar spyod pa de dag thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni spyod pa po dang /
translated: It gives all knowledge means that it gives all knowledge of all dharmas.🔽“In this way, the one who practices, the time of practice, and the practice—all of these are not apprehended in this perfection of wisdom” means that the one who practices,🔽the one who is fit to practice, and the practice—all of these are not apprehended in this perfection of wisdom.

original: spyod par 'os pa dang / spyad par bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mi dmigs pa'i phyir da la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang de dag spyod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: spyod par 'os pa dang / spyad par bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mi dmigs pa'i phyir da la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yang de dag spyod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Therefore, those who practice the perfection of wisdom do not practice” means that they do not practice.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don la ji ltar spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don la ji ltar spyad par bya ste /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings should practice the meaning of the perfection of wisdom like this.”

original: 'di lta ste mi rtag pa'i don dang sdug bsngal ba'i don dang / bdag med pa'i don la spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba gsum gyis thams cad kyi thun mong gi don bstan nas /
analyzed: 'di lta ste mi rtag pa'i don dang sdug bsngal ba'i don dang / bdag med pa'i don la spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba gsum gyis thams cad kyi thun mong gi don bstan nas /
translated: Thus, the meaning of impermanence, the meaning of suffering, and the meaning of selflessness.

original: sdug bsngal shes pa'i don dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa'i don nas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa'i don dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa'i don nas /
translated: The meaning of the knowledge of suffering, the meaning of the knowledge of the origin,🔽up to the meaning of the knowledge of thorough familiarity and the meaning of the knowledge of the literal.

original: yongs su 'dris pa shes pa dang / sgra ji bzhin shes pa'i don gyi bar shes pa bcu gcig po 'di rnams ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir de dag gi don gang yin pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don yin no zhes bstan
analyzed: yongs su 'dris pa shes pa dang / sgra ji bzhin shes pa'i don gyi bar shes pa bcu gcig po 'di rnams ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir de dag gi don gang yin pa de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don yin no zhes bstan
translated: These eleven knowledges are the essence of the perfection of wisdom, therefore, the meaning of those is the meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

original: pa'o // don dang tshul gyis zhes bya ba la don ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i don de dag go //
analyzed: pa'o // don dang tshul gyis zhes bya ba la don ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i don de dag go //
translated: Meaning and method. The meaning is those meanings of impermanence and so on.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid sngar bstan pa dang 'og nas 'byung ba gang yin pa de dag ni tshul lo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid sngar bstan pa dang 'og nas 'byung ba gang yin pa de dag ni tshul lo //
translated: The essence of the perfection of wisdom that was previously explained and will be explained below is the method.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don la spyod pas na /🔽'dod chags bdag gi don tam /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don la spyod pas na / 'dod chags bdag gi don tam /
translated: Because one practices the meaning of the perfection of wisdom,🔽one should not practice thinking, “Attachment is for my benefit”

original: bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas @258a * //
analyzed: bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas @258a * //
translated: or “It is not for my benefit.”

original: ni don dang don ma yin pa tha dad par rnam par rtog pa yang bsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ni don dang don ma yin pa tha dad par rnam par rtog pa yang bsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In this way, one should also eliminate the conceptualization of a difference between what is beneficial and what is not.

original: de bzhin nyid la de lta bur 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la de lta bur 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught because there is no such engagement in suchness.

original: gzugs bdag gi don zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs bdag gi don zhes spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not practice thinking, “Form is for my benefit.”🔽One should not practice thinking, “Form is not for my benefit.”

original: gzugs bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs dmigs par lta ba ni don ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs bdag gi don ma yin zhes spyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs dmigs par lta ba ni don ma yin pa'o //
translated: The view that form is an object is not for one’s benefit.

original: gzugs dmigs su med par lta ba ni don yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs dmigs su med par lta ba ni don yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The view that form is not an object is for one’s benefit. This is the meaning.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung zhes bya ba 'dis 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung zhes bya ba 'dis 'di skad bstan te /
translated: “Whether the Tathāgatas arise or not, ” by this it is taught that

original: gang la yang don tam don ma yin pa mi byed do zhes bya ba ni chos gnas pa 'di ngo bo nyid kho na ste /
analyzed: gang la yang don tam don ma yin pa mi byed do zhes bya ba ni chos gnas pa 'di ngo bo nyid kho na ste /
translated: It does not perform any function or non-function with regard to anything. This is the very nature of the abiding of dharmas,

original: 'di ltar de ltar gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ltar gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: because it abides thus.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos gang la yang mi byed ces bya ba 'dis ni 'di skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mthong nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos gang la yang mi byed ces bya ba 'dis ni 'di skad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mthong nas /
translated: This is what is being taught: “In this perfection of wisdom, no dharma, whether compounded or uncompounded, is performed.”🔽By this, it is said that the non-performance of all dharmas is the perfection of wisdom, because by seeing the perfection of wisdom,

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad ma mthong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir chos thams cad byed pa ma yin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad ma mthong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir chos thams cad byed pa ma yin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no /
translated: all compounded and uncompounded dharmas are not seen.

original: de ji ltar don tam don ma yin pa 'ga' zhig byed par 'gyur zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ji ltar don tam don ma yin pa 'ga' zhig byed par 'gyur zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: How could it perform any function or non-function? This is what is being taught.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'du ma bgyis pa 'phags pa thams cad kyi don ma lags sam zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dus ma byas pa mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bgyid pa ma lags sam zhes dgongs nas gsol pa'o //🔽phan pa'am gnod pa nye bar gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyus mya ngan las 'das pa la phan pa'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'du ma bgyis pa 'phags pa thams cad kyi don ma lags sam zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dus ma byas pa mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bgyid pa ma lags sam zhes dgongs nas gsol pa'o // phan pa'am gnod pa nye bar gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyus mya ngan las 'das pa la phan pa'am /
translated: This is thinking that this perfection of wisdom does not bring about the attainment of the unconditioned nirvana.🔽It is not present as helpful or harmful means that by the cause of the perfection of wisdom, there is neither any help nor any harm to nirvana.

original: gnod pa gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste //
analyzed: gnod pa gang yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de la yang nam mkha'i de bzhin nyid kyi dpe bstan to //
analyzed: de la yang nam mkha'i de bzhin nyid kyi dpe bstan to //
translated: And here the example of the suchness of space is taught.

original: 'dus ma bgyis kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi bgyid dam zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid skyed par byed pa ma
analyzed: 'dus ma bgyis kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi bgyid dam zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid skyed par byed pa ma
translated: Having trained in the unconditioned perfection of wisdom, does one not attain the knowledge of all aspects? means that the perfection of wisdom does not generate the knowledge of all aspects.

original: yin nam snyam du dgongs nas gsol pa'o //
analyzed: yin nam snyam du dgongs nas gsol pa'o //
translated: Thinking that this is so, he asks.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis spyod pa'i tshe kun rdzob tu de lta yin no zhes de'i @258b tshig la rjes su yi rang nas /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis spyod pa'i tshe kun rdzob tu de lta yin no zhes de'i @258b tshig la rjes su yi rang nas /
translated: The Lord, having agreed with his words, saying, “So it is at the conventional level, when one is engaged in conduct,”

original: gnyis kyi tshul gyis ni ma yin no zhes dgag pa mdzad do //
analyzed: gnyis kyi tshul gyis ni ma yin no zhes dgag pa mdzad do //
translated: refutes him, saying, “But not in the manner of duality.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gcig ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gcig ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom and the knowledge of all modes are one,

original: tha dad pa ma yin la /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin la /
translated: they are not different.

original: gnyis su med pa de'i phyir phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa de'i phyir phan gdags par bya ba dang / phan 'dogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since they are not two, there is no establishment and no object of establishment.🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti, is there any dharma which the Tathagata has proclaimed?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti, is there any dharma which the Tathagata has fully known?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti, is there any dharma which the Tathagata has demonstrated?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti, is there any dharma which the Tathagata has taught?

original: bcom ldan 'das ci lags gnyis su ma mchis pa'i chos gnyis su ma mchis pa'i chos thob par bgyid dam zhes bya ba ci las dgongs she na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci lags gnyis su ma mchis pa'i chos gnyis su ma mchis pa'i chos thob par bgyid dam zhes bya ba ci las dgongs she na /
translated: The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti, is there any dharma which the Tathagata has set rolling?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti, is there any dharma which the Tathagata has stopped?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti, is there any dharma which the Tathagata has brought to an end?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti, is there any dharma which the Tathagata has abandoned?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti, is there any dharma which the Tathagata has rejected?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti, is there any dharma which the Tathagata has accepted?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti, is there any dharma which the Tathagata has pointed out?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti, is there any dharma which the Tathagata has shown?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti, is there any dharma which the Tathagata has revealed?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti, is there any dharma which the Tathagata has made known?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti, is there any dharma which the Tathagata has taught?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti, is there any dharma which the Tathagata has explained?🔽The Lord: What do you think, Subhuti, is there

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyus byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes grags pa de la /🔽ci ngo bo nyid med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'dis gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyus byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes grags pa de la / ci ngo bo nyid med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'dis gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob par 'gyur ram /
translated: It is well known that the perfection of wisdom causes bodhisattvas to attain omniscience.🔽In this regard, does this bodhisattva who has no intrinsic reality attain the perfection of wisdom that has the nondual nature?🔽Or does the bodhisattva who has a dual nature attain the perfection of wisdom that has a nondual nature?

original: 'on te gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid kyi byang chub sems dpas gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob par 'gyur zhes rnam par rtog pa gnyis zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gnyi gar yang brjod du mi rung ba'i phyir ma gnang nas 'di skad du gnyis kyi chos sam gnyis su med pa'i chos kyang mi dmigs na de ltar dmigs su med pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro
analyzed: 'on te gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid kyi byang chub sems dpas gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob par 'gyur zhes rnam par rtog pa gnyis zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gnyi gar yang brjod du mi rung ba'i phyir ma gnang nas 'di skad du gnyis kyi chos sam gnyis su med pa'i chos kyang mi dmigs na de ltar dmigs su med pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro
translated: The Bhagavān did not permit either of these two conceptions, saying, “If even the phenomena of duality or nonduality are not observed, omniscience will be attained in that way, by means of nonobservation.”

original: zhes gsungs te /🔽ji ltar chos 'di dag thams cad gnyis kyi bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te / ji ltar chos 'di dag thams cad gnyis kyi bdag nyid dam /
translated: Thus it is said.🔽Just as all these phenomena are not perceived as having the nature of duality

original: gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid du yang dmigs su med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid du yang dmigs su med pa de bzhin du /
translated: or as having the nature of non-duality,🔽in the same way, by the method of not perceiving phenomena as dual and by the method of not perceiving phenomena as non-dual, one attains the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gnyis kyi chos dmigs su med pa'i tshul dang / gnyis su med pa'i chos dmigs su med pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob ces bya'i de las gzhan pa ni cung zad kyang med do /🔽// / bam po nyi shu lnga pa /
analyzed: gnyis kyi chos dmigs su med pa'i tshul dang / gnyis su med pa'i chos dmigs su med pa'i tshul gyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob ces bya'i de las gzhan pa ni cung zad kyang med do / // / bam po nyi shu lnga pa /
translated: There is nothing else apart from that.

original: de lta bu'i zab mo'i gnas thos nas /
analyzed: de lta bu'i zab mo'i gnas thos nas /
translated: Having heard such a profound topic,

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
translated: the Blessed One said, The perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: dpe la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dpe la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: And so on, and the examples should be applied in the same way.

original: dper na mi des /
analyzed: dper na mi des /
translated: For example, if that person

original: rtsa ba dang / shun pa dang yal ga dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu 'dod par gyur na /
analyzed: rtsa ba dang / shun pa dang yal ga dang / lo ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu 'dod par gyur na /
translated: wished for the roots, bark, branches, leaves, flowers, and fruits,🔽first they would not perceive them.

original: thog mar de dag mi dmigs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: thog mar de dag mi dmigs pa de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: byang chub sems @259a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems @259a * //
translated: the bodhisattva

original: dpas kyang chos thams cad mi dmigs so //
analyzed: dpas kyang chos thams cad mi dmigs so //
translated: The bodhisattva, the great being, who courses in perfect wisdom, does not review any dharma, or apprehend any dharma.

original: ji ltar phyis mi des sdong bu bskyed na /
analyzed: ji ltar phyis mi des sdong bu bskyed na /
translated: Just as that man, after he has cut down the tree,

original: rtsa ba dang shun pa la sogs pa rnyed nas nye bar spyod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rtsa ba dang shun pa la sogs pa rnyed nas nye bar spyod pa de bzhin du /
translated: will make use of the roots, the bark, the branches, and the leaves,

original: bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs du ma bskyed na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba nye bar spyod par byed par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs du ma bskyed na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba nye bar spyod par byed par shes par bya'o //
translated: just so the bodhisattva, the great being, after he has cut down the tree of ignorance, will make use of the knowledge of the modes of the path for the sake of all beings.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin nyid gang gis de bzhin gshegs par gdags pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid du gshegs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin nyid gang gis de bzhin gshegs par gdags pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid du gshegs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Subhuti : The Tathagata is so called because he has gone to suchness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang de bzhin nyid du gshegs pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang de bzhin nyid du gshegs pa yin te /
translated: The Bodhisattva is also so called because he has gone to suchness.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore the Bodhisattva should be called Tathagata.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin nyid 'di la gnas te zhes bya ba 'gres gnyis pa la de bzhin nyid khong du chud cing rtogs pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin nyid 'di la gnas te zhes bya ba 'gres gnyis pa la de bzhin nyid khong du chud cing rtogs pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The second repetition of “the bodhisattva great being, standing in this suchness” is because he is called a Tathāgata because he has realized and comprehended suchness.

original: de bzhin nyid 'di yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid 'di yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And this suchness is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i 'og tu de bzhin nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i phan yon dang bsod nams 'phel ba ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de bzhin nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i phan yon dang bsod nams 'phel ba ni go sla'o //
translated: After that, the benefits of practicing suchness and the perfection of wisdom and the increase of merit are easy to understand.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhugs par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhugs par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam la gnas pa'o //
translated: “The bodhisattva who has entered” is one who is standing on the path to complete perfect enlightenment.

original: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po med pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po med pas /
translated: “Subhūti, the knowledge of all aspects” is a non-entity.

original: mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i chos las 'das pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i chos las 'das pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'o //
translated: “Signless” is a non-entity because it transcends entities.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: It is without characteristics, because it is free from specific and general characteristics.

original: ming dang mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: It is signless, because it is free from all names and signs.

original: rtsol ba med pa'i phyir lhun gyis grub pa'o //
analyzed: rtsol ba med pa'i phyir lhun gyis grub pa'o //
translated: It is spontaneous, because it is effortless.

original: 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir skye ba med pa'o //
translated: It is non-arisen, because it is unconditioned.

original: gnas pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir 'byung ba med pa'o //
translated: It is non-occurring, because it has the characteristic of non-abiding.

original: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni dngos po med pa la dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa las brtsams nas 'jug ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni dngos po med pa la dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni dngos po med pa las brtsams nas 'jug ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Subhūti, the knowledge of all aspects has a non-existent object. This means that it engages from the non-existent.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the objective condition.

original: dran pas dbang bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi rgyu'i dbang gis brjod @259b kyi de'i tshe ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dran pas dbang bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi rgyu'i dbang gis brjod @259b kyi de'i tshe ni ma yin no //
translated: It is controlled by mindfulness. This means it is expressed by the power of past causes, not at that time.

original: rab 'byor 'dus pa las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med ces bya ba ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'dus pa las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med ces bya ba ni gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: “Subhūti, the absence of an essential nature that arises from a collection” refers to the imagined essential nature of form, feeling, etc.

original: rkyen gzhan gyi dbang las byung ba'i phyir 'dus pa las byung zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rkyen gzhan gyi dbang las byung ba'i phyir 'dus pa las byung zhes bya ste /
translated: Because it arises from the power of other conditions, it is said to “arise from a collection.”

original: gzhan gyi dbang bya ba'i phyir de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid kyi ming du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang bya ba'i phyir de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid kyi ming du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is dependent on another, it is given the name “such an essential nature.”

original: gang la 'dus pa las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa ste dngos po med pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos gang gzhan la rag las pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang la 'dus pa las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa ste dngos po med pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos gang gzhan la rag las pa yin gyi /
translated: “That which lacks an essential nature that arises from a collection, that is, that is nonexistent” refers to that thing which is dependent on another,

original: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ma yin pa de dngos po med pa zhes te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ma yin pa de dngos po med pa zhes te /
translated: but is not an essential nature. It is called “nonexistent.”

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ltar gtan med pa'i phyir med pa ni ma yin gyi dngos po yod pa'i chos las bzlog pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ltar gtan med pa'i phyir med pa ni ma yin gyi dngos po yod pa'i chos las bzlog pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'o //
translated: It is not nonexistent because it is not utterly nonexistent, like the horns of a rabbit, etc. It is nonexistent because it is the opposite of an existent thing.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i chos rnams la dngos po med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i chos rnams la dngos po med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The nature of non-entityness is said to be the non-entityness of all phenomena such as form, etc.

original: de la bzlog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la bzlog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The nature of reversal is also said to be the nature of non-entityness.

original: de'i 'og tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa dang thabs mkhas pa dag bstan to //🔽de la bcom ldan 'das chos rnams chos nyid dang bral ba lags sam zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad chos thams cad dang bral ba yin na de lta na ni shes rab bya ba dang shes par byed pa yang med pas 'di ni shes par byas so
analyzed: de'i 'og tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa dang thabs mkhas pa dag bstan to // de la bcom ldan 'das chos rnams chos nyid dang bral ba lags sam zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad chos thams cad dang bral ba yin na de lta na ni shes rab bya ba dang shes par byed pa yang med pas 'di ni shes par byas so
translated: After that, the perfection of wisdom, which is the nature of non-entityness, and skillful means are taught.

original: zhes bya bar brjod du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya bar brjod du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: There, Are phenomena separated from the intrinsic nature of phenomena? means if all phenomena are separated from all phenomena, then wisdom would not exist as something to be done or as something to be known, so it would be incorrect to say this is known. This is the meaning.

original: dngos pos kyang dngos po 'tshal bar mi rung zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pas kun brtags pa shes par mi rung ste /
analyzed: dngos pos kyang dngos po 'tshal bar mi rung zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pas kun brtags pa shes par mi rung ste /
translated: Also, an entity does not know an entity means that the imagined does not know the imagined.

original: med pa'i phyir ji ltar sgyu ma'i glang po ches sgyu ma'i glang po che'i rjes lta bu'o //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ji ltar sgyu ma'i glang po ches sgyu ma'i glang po che'i rjes lta bu'o //
translated: Because it does not exist, like a magical elephant does not know a magical elephant.

original: dngos po med pas kyang dngos po med pa shes par mi rung ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pas kyang dngos po med pa shes par mi rung ste /
translated: Also, a non-entity does not know a non-entity means that.

original: ji ltar nam mkhas nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkhas nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: like space does not know space.

original: dngos pos kyang dngos po med pa shes par mi rung ste /
analyzed: dngos pos kyang dngos po med pa shes par mi rung ste /
translated: Also, an entity does not know a non-entity means that.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma'i mis nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma'i mis nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: like a magical person does not know space.

original: dngos po med pas kyang dngos po shes par mi rung ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pas kyang dngos po shes par mi rung ste /
translated: Also, a non-entity does not know an entity means that.

original: ji ltar nam mkhas sgyu ma'i mi bzhin te 'di ni dngos po yod pa dang dngos po med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das ci lags 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyang gzhan zhig la /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkhas sgyu ma'i mi bzhin te 'di ni dngos po yod pa dang dngos po med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o // bcom ldan 'das ci lags 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob kyang gzhan zhig la /
translated: like space does not know a magical person. This is the perfection of wisdom of existent entities and non-existent entities.

original: don dam pa yang gzhan lags sam zhes bya ba ni @260a * //
analyzed: don dam pa yang gzhan lags sam zhes bya ba ni @260a * //
translated: Bhagavan, is the conventional of the world one thing, and the ultimate another?

original: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam pa zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir don dam pa zhus pa'o //
translated: The ultimate is asked about because the characteristic of the non-existence of things is the conventional of the world.

original: 'jig rten kun rdzob kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid don dam pa'i de bzhin nyid yin zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob ces bya ba gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid don dam pa'i
analyzed: 'jig rten kun rdzob kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid don dam pa'i de bzhin nyid yin zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob ces bya ba gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de nyid don dam pa'i
translated: That suchness of the conventional of the world is itself the suchness of the ultimate. This means that the suchness of all dharmas such as form, which are called the conventional of the world, is itself the suchness of the ultimate.

original: de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The suchness of the conventional of the world is the suchness of the ultimate.

original: rab 'byor yang dag pa'i don ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ste zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa ste yang dag pa'i don de bzhin nyid chos kyi sku la sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rab 'byor yang dag pa'i don ni sangs rgyas zhes bya ste zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa ste yang dag pa'i don de bzhin nyid chos kyi sku la sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, the meaning of reality is called the Buddha. This is the statement of the characteristic of the essence of the Buddha. The meaning of reality, suchness, the Dharma Body, is called the Buddha.

original: des yang dag pa'i don mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa gsum gyis nges pa'i tsheg gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: des yang dag pa'i don mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa gsum gyis nges pa'i tsheg gsungs pa ste /
translated: The three kinds of ascertainment are stated by the phrase because he has fully and completely awakened to the reality of things, and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi ye shes kyis yang dag pa'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa nyid sangs rgyas par 'gyur ba dang / de'i 'og tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis yang dag pa'i don stong pa dang zhi ba la sogs pa'i don du rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi ye shes kyis yang dag pa'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa nyid sangs rgyas par 'gyur ba dang / de'i 'og tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis yang dag pa'i don stong pa dang zhi ba la sogs pa'i don du rtogs pa dang /
translated: The Bhagavat has awakened to the reality of the true Dharma of nirvana by the wisdom of the path of the arhat, and after that he has realized the reality of things, the meaning of emptiness, peace, and so on, by the wisdom of omniscience.

original: de'i rjes la thob pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid pa'i ye shes kyis thams cad kyi mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i rjes la thob pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid pa'i ye shes kyis thams cad kyi mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: After that he has realized the characteristics of all things just as they are by the wisdom of omniscience.

original: de ltar yang dag pa'i chos mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / yang dag pa'i don rab tu rtogs pa dang / chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa'i chos mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa dang / yang dag pa'i don rab tu rtogs pa dang / chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, he is called a Buddha because he is fully enlightened with respect to the true Dharma, because he has fully understood the true meaning, and because he is fully enlightened with respect to all dharmas just as they are.🔽“Blessed One, what is the meaning of the word ‘enlightenment’?”

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub ces bgyi ba de gang gi tshig bla dags lags so zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyang rnam pa gsum du bstan te ngo bo nyid dang mtshan nyid dang nges pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub ces bgyi ba de gang gi tshig bla dags lags so zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyang rnam pa gsum du bstan te ngo bo nyid dang mtshan nyid dang nges pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: Enlightenment is also taught in three ways: by way of its nature, by way of its characteristics, and by way of its verbal definition.

original: de la ngo bo nyid rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Its nature is twofold:

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: the perfected nature and the imagined nature.

original: de la yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rab 'byor byang chub ces bya ba de ni stong pa nyid kyi tshig bla dags so zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rab 'byor byang chub ces bya ba de ni stong pa nyid kyi tshig bla dags so zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The perfected nature is stated in the passage that begins: “Subhūti, the word ‘enlightenment’ is a designation for emptiness.”

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rab 'byor 'di ltar yang /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rab 'byor 'di ltar yang /
translated: The imagined nature is stated in the passage that begins: “Subhūti, it is thus.

original: byang chub ces bya ba de ni ming tsam zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba de ni ming tsam zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The name is only a name.

original: mtshan nyid ni @260b yang dag pa'i don ni byang chub kyi don to zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni @260b yang dag pa'i don ni byang chub kyi don to zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: The definition is stated: The meaning of enlightenment is the meaning of reality.

original: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid ni yang dag par don dam pa'i don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid ni yang dag par don dam pa'i don zhes bya'o //
translated: The ultimate reality is called the meaning of the ultimate.

original: nges pa'i tshig ni de ni chos thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du rtogs par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig ni de ni chos thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du rtogs par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The etymology is threefold: It is the realization that all phenomena are mere names and signs.

original: de la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i nges pa'i tshig ni de ni chos thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du rtog par byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i nges pa'i tshig ni de ni chos thams cad ming dang mtshan ma tsam du rtog par byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The etymology of the realization of the imagined nature is stated as the realization that all phenomena are mere names and signs.

original: gzhan gyi dbang rtogs pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang rtogs pas /
translated: By realizing the dependent nature,

original: gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid chos kyi sku'i tshul ni de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub ste /
analyzed: gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid chos kyi sku'i tshul ni de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi byang chub ste /
translated: the mode of the transformed nature, the Dharma body, is stated: That is the enlightenment of the Blessed Buddhas.

original: de'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called enlightenment.

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa ni de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas na de'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa ni de ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas na de'i phyir byang chub ces bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: “When the Bhagavat Buddhas fully awaken to it, it is called enlightenment.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub ni chos gang yang bstsags pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub ni chos gang yang bstsags pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The enlightenment of one who practices the perfection of wisdom is not for the sake of accumulating any dharma,🔽nor for the sake of diminishing any dharma.

original: 'grib par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bstsags pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'grib par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bstsags pa'i phyir ram /
translated: It is not for the sake of accumulating roots of virtue such as generosity,

original: ser sna dang 'chal pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa 'grib par bya ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: ser sna dang 'chal pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa 'grib par bya ba'i phyir ram /
translated: nor for the sake of diminishing stinginess, immorality, and so on.

original: nag po'i phyogs rnams nyams par bya ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs rnams nyams par bya ba'i phyir ram /
translated: It is not for the sake of diminishing the dark side,

original: dkar po'i phyogs rnams 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: dkar po'i phyogs rnams 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir ram /
translated: nor for the sake of increasing the bright side.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ram /
translated: It is not for the sake of generating the unarisen qualities of a buddha,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa skyes pa rnams dgag pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa skyes pa rnams dgag pa'i phyir ram /
translated: nor for the sake of stopping the arisen afflictions.

original: dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na kun nas nyon mongs par bya ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na kun nas nyon mongs par bya ba'i phyir ram /
translated: It is not present in the manner of an object of observation in the situation of being with stain, in order to afflict,

original: dri ma med pa'i gnas skabs na rnam par byang bar bya ba'i phyir dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nye bar gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i gnas skabs na rnam par byang bar bya ba'i phyir dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nye bar gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: or in the situation of being without stain, in order to purify.

original: byang chub ni dmigs pa thams cad sel ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de skad ces gsungs so ;
analyzed: byang chub ni dmigs pa thams cad sel ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de skad ces gsungs so ;
translated: It is said this way because enlightenment has the nature of eliminating all objects of observation.

original: / gnyis kyi tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod ces bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par bye dpa'i dngos pos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / gnyis kyi tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod ces bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par bye dpa'i dngos pos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “practicing the perfection of generosity in the manner of duality” means in the manner of the thing that is the object of observation and the thing that observes.

original: de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par @261a * //
analyzed: de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par @261a * //
translated: Thus, because of possessing the roots of virtue, the bodhisattva attains the knowledge of all aspects.

original: mi nus zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i dbang gis thabs mkhas pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes de ma thag tu 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: mi nus zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa'i dbang gis thabs mkhas pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes de ma thag tu 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: The phrase one is not able means that one is not skilled in means due to the influence of the objective supports. This will be explained immediately below.

original: ji ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin zhes bya ba ni byang chub la dmigs nas sbyin pa byin na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming du 'gyur ro snyam nas gsol pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin zhes bya ba ni byang chub la dmigs nas sbyin pa byin na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming du 'gyur ro snyam nas gsol pa'o //
translated: The phrase how does one embrace the perfection of generosity? means that one thinks, If one gives a gift while focusing on enlightenment, then that becomes the name of the perfection of generosity.

original: gnyis kyi tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do zhes bya ba ni 'di byang chub kyi phyir bya'o zhes dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa gnyis kyi dngos por rnam par brtags nas mi spyod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
analyzed: gnyis kyi tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do zhes bya ba ni 'di byang chub kyi phyir bya'o zhes dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa gnyis kyi dngos por rnam par brtags nas mi spyod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
translated: The phrase one does not practice the perfection of generosity in a manner that is dualistic means that one does not practice while conceptualizing the entity of a duality, such as the one who acts for the sake of enlightenment and the one for whose sake one acts.

original: go // bcom ldan 'das gal te gnyis kyi tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod na zhes bya ba ni gal te gnyis kyi tshul gyis byang chub kyi phyir yongs su sngo zhing mi byed na ji ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams mngon par 'phel
analyzed: go // bcom ldan 'das gal te gnyis kyi tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod na zhes bya ba ni gal te gnyis kyi tshul gyis byang chub kyi phyir yongs su sngo zhing mi byed na ji ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams mngon par 'phel
translated: increase?

original: bar 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: bar 'gyur zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: This is the question.

original: rab 'byor gang gnyis la spyod pa de dag ni dge ba'i chos rnams rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med par spyod pa nyid dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel ba'i rgyu yin gyi gnyis su spyod pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa
analyzed: rab 'byor gang gnyis la spyod pa de dag ni dge ba'i chos rnams rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med par spyod pa nyid dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel ba'i rgyu yin gyi gnyis su spyod pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhūti, those who practice in duality, their wholesome dharmas increase, meaning that practicing non-dually is the cause for the increase of the roots of virtue, but practicing dualistically is not.🔽 This is taught.

original: ste / 'di ni gnyis su med par spyod pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ste / 'di ni gnyis su med par spyod pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the perfection of wisdom of practicing non-dually.

original: de nas yang thabs mkhas pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos la spyod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' bsngags pa'i ngo bo nyid las mi g-yo ba rnams ni gzhung nyid las go sla'o //
analyzed: de nas yang thabs mkhas pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la spyod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos la spyod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' bsngags pa'i ngo bo nyid las mi g-yo ba rnams ni gzhung nyid las go sla'o //
translated: Then, the practice of the six perfections, the practice of the factors of enlightenment, the practice of the qualities of the Buddha, and the bodhisattvas who do not waver from the nature of praise are easy to understand from the text itself.

original: dngos po ma mchis pas dngos po ma mchis pa mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bgyi bar nus sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa bzhi ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pas spror rung ba
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pas dngos po ma mchis pa mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bgyi bar nus sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa bzhi ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa la de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pas spror rung ba
translated: As for the four concepts beginning with Is it possible to fully awaken to a non-existent thing by a non-existent thing? they are not suitable to be elaborated upon with such concepts in full awakening.

original: ma yin pa'i phyir 'di la shes par byed pa med do //
analyzed: ma yin pa'i phyir 'di la shes par byed pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no means of knowing this.

original: ji ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa yang ma yin pa de ltar mnyam pa nyid mngon pa ni mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma byas pa bzhin te kun brtags pa ni dngos po'i rnam pa ma yin la ri bong gi rva ltar
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa yang ma yin pa de ltar mnyam pa nyid mngon pa ni mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma byas pa bzhin te kun brtags pa ni dngos po'i rnam pa ma yin la ri bong gi rva ltar
translated: Just as it is not a thing and not a non-thing, so also the realization of the sameness of things is called “realization.” It is like a magical creation, for the imagined is not the form of a thing,

original: shin tu med pa'i @261b rnam pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: shin tu med pa'i @261b rnam pa yang ma yin no //
translated: but it is not the form of a complete non-existence, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa mnyam pa nyid mthong ba mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa de ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa mnyam pa nyid mthong ba mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The sameness of thing and non-thing is called “the realization of the vision of the sameness of thing and non-thing.”

original: 'di ni spros pa med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni spros pa med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the perfection of the absence of conceptual differentiation.

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhūti, it is thus:

original: dgra bcom pas lam thams cad la bslabs nas zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i lam la bslabs nas so //
analyzed: dgra bcom pas lam thams cad la bslabs nas zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa'i lam la bslabs nas so //
translated: For example, a worthy one, having trained in all the paths, i.e., having trained in the paths of the stream-enterers, once-returners, non-returners, and worthy ones,

original: yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la 'jug ste zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid kyi skyon med pa 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la 'jug ste zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa nyid kyi skyon med pa 'jug pa'o //
translated: He enters into the faultless state of reality means he enters into the faultless state of arhatship.

original: re zhig lam gyi skad cig la dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu ma thob kyi bar du zhes bya ba ni ji srid du tha ma la rnam par grol pa'i lam gyi skad cig mi skyed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: re zhig lam gyi skad cig la dgra bcom pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu ma thob kyi bar du zhes bya ba ni ji srid du tha ma la rnam par grol pa'i lam gyi skad cig mi skyed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: As long as he does not attain the fruit of the path of the arhat in the moment of the path, means as long as he does not generate the moment of the path of liberation at the end.

original: skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis zhes bya ba ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi skad cig dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis zhes bya ba ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi skad cig dang ldan pas so //
translated: Possessing wisdom in one moment means possessing the moment of the vajra-like samadhi.

original: shes pa dang mthong bas sa brgyad po dag la rnam par bltas nas yongs su 'da' ste zhes bya ba ni yongs su dris pa'i shes pa bstan pa'i skabs su sngar ji skad du bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shes pa dang mthong bas sa brgyad po dag la rnam par bltas nas yongs su 'da' ste zhes bya ba ni yongs su dris pa'i shes pa bstan pa'i skabs su sngar ji skad du bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: Having seen the eight stages with knowledge and vision, he transcends means as previously explained in the section on the knowledge of thorough investigation.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos skad dang brda dang sgra thams cad yang dag par bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba ni sems can sna tshogs kyi skad dang mthun par ro //🔽chos gang la yang sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos skad dang brda dang sgra thams cad yang dag par bsgrub par bya zhes bya ba ni sems can sna tshogs kyi skad dang mthun par ro // chos gang la yang sgrub pa'am /
translated: Here, the phrase the bodhisattva mahāsattva should accomplish all languages, sounds, and voices refers to [accomplishing] the languages of various sentient beings.🔽There is no dharma that is established or destroyed.

original: 'jig par bgyid pa ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos mtshan nyid med pa /
analyzed: 'jig par bgyid pa ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos mtshan nyid med pa /
translated: The bodhi-factors are without characteristics, and their nature is non-existent.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de dag byang chub sgrub pa ma lags sam zhes zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor de de bzhin no de de bzhin te zhes bsngags pa mdzad de /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid de dag byang chub sgrub pa ma lags sam zhes zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor de de bzhin no de de bzhin te zhes bsngags pa mdzad de /
translated: Did he not say, Are those not the establishment of awakening? The Blessed One praised, saying, Subhūti, it is so, it is so.

original: chos gang yang chos gang la yang sgrub par mi byed de /
analyzed: chos gang yang chos gang la yang sgrub par mi byed de /
translated: There is no dharma that establishes any dharma at all.

original: chos rnams gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro /
analyzed: chos rnams gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro /
translated: Because the characteristic of dharmas is to abide.

original: de lta mod kyi byis pa rnams khong du chud par bya ba'i thabs su kun rdzob tu 'di mdzad de /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi byis pa rnams khong du chud par bya ba'i thabs su kun rdzob tu 'di mdzad de /
translated: However, as a means for the understanding of the childish, this is done conventionally.

original: rim pa 'dis shes par gyur nas de bzhin du bsgrubs pas 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rim pa 'dis shes par gyur nas de bzhin du bsgrubs pas 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having understood in this way, one becomes enlightened by practicing accordingly.

original: 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis 'dod chags la @262a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis 'dod chags la @262a * //
translated: The so-called noble discipline of the Dharma is taught to have the characteristic of being disciplined by nature with regard to desire, etc.,

original: sogs pa 'dul ba dang / bsgrubs pas 'dul bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid du ston to //
analyzed: sogs pa 'dul ba dang / bsgrubs pas 'dul bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid du ston to //
translated: and being disciplined by practice with regard to the remaining [non-virtuous factors].

original: 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This noble discipline of the Dharma is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di ni chos thams cad sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ni chos thams cad sgom pa rnam par 'jig pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the destruction of the meditation on all phenomena.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad sgom pa med par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad sgom pa med par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that it causes the non-meditation on all phenomena such as form, etc.🔽One does not meditate on form as an existent thing.🔽One does not meditate on form as having the nature of an existent thing. That is the non-meditation.

original: gzugs dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo zhes bya ba ni gzugs dngos po yod pa'i ngo bo nyid do snyam du mi sgom pa de ni dngos po la 'di ni bdag go zhes bya bar mtha' gnyis la chags te zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i
analyzed: gzugs dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sgom mo zhes bya ba ni gzugs dngos po yod pa'i ngo bo nyid do snyam du mi sgom pa de ni dngos po la 'di ni bdag go zhes bya bar mtha' gnyis la chags te zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i
translated: One does not meditate on form as this is mine.

original: 'du shes can te /
analyzed: 'du shes can te /
translated: 1. Those who have the notion of a self,

original: 'di ni bdag ste gud na yod do zhe'am /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag ste gud na yod do zhe'am /
translated: thinking “This is my self, which exists separately,”

original: bdag ni gzugs so //
analyzed: bdag ni gzugs so //
translated: or “The self is form,”

original: bdag ni tshor ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa chad pa dang / rtag pa'i mtha' gnyis la chags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag ni tshor ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa chad pa dang / rtag pa'i mtha' gnyis la chags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: or “The self is feeling,” and so on, are attached to the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism.

original: rab 'byor gzugs su 'du shes pa ni gnyis so zhes bya ba ni gang la gzugs so zhes bya ba'i 'du shes yod pa de la /🔽yod pa dang med pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs su 'du shes pa ni gnyis so zhes bya ba ni gang la gzugs so zhes bya ba'i 'du shes yod pa de la / yod pa dang med pa'am /
translated: “ Subhuti, the notion of form is dualistic” means that where there is the notion of form,🔽there is the notion of existence or nonexistence,

original: dngos po'am / dngos po ma yin par rnam par rtog pa gdon mi za bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po'am / dngos po ma yin par rnam par rtog pa gdon mi za bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or the notion of entity or nonentity.

original: yang na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir gnyis zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir gnyis zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, it is called “dualistic” because it is the entity of the grasped and the grasper.

original: ji tsam du dngos po yod pa de tsam du 'du byed do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji tsam du dngos po yod pa de tsam du 'du byed do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ As long as there is the notion of an entity, there is the notion of a compounded thing” means that

original: dngos por rnam par rtog pas /
analyzed: dngos por rnam par rtog pas /
translated: through the notion of an entity,

original: bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed rnams skyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed rnams skyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: the compounded things of merit, demerit, and so on are produced.

original: dngos po yongs su 'dor ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos po yongs su 'dor ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Giving up things means

original: rnam par smin pa yongs su mi 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yongs su mi 'dor ba'o //
translated: not giving up the evolutionary development of beings.

original: chos thams cad la mnga' bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub po //
analyzed: chos thams cad la mnga' bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub po //
translated: The mastery of all things means the perfect enlightenment.

original: yul la mnga' brnyes par gyur ces bya ba ni mngon par shes pa dang dbang bcu'o //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor 'di la nga sngon pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la /
analyzed: yul la mnga' brnyes par gyur ces bya ba ni mngon par shes pa dang dbang bcu'o // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor 'di la nga sngon pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la /
translated: The mastery of objects means the ten masteries, such as of intuition, etc.🔽Then the Lord, in order to show this, says,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ston te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ston te /
translated: When I was practicing the Bodhisattva way of life, practicing the six perfections, etc.

original: nga pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod cing mngon par shes pa la sogs pa la yang snyoms par 'jug pa de na /
analyzed: nga pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod cing mngon par shes pa la sogs pa la yang snyoms par 'jug pa de na /
translated: When I was practicing the perfections and entering into the concentrations such as the superknowledges, etc.,

original: mtshan ma la ro myang ba med par @262b dmigs pa can gyi 'du shes bsal te /
analyzed: mtshan ma la ro myang ba med par @262b dmigs pa can gyi 'du shes bsal te /
translated: I eliminated the notion of objective reference, without relishing the signs.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i 'du shes bskyed cing spyad nas /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i 'du shes bskyed cing spyad nas /
translated: Having practiced, generating the notion of natural purity,

original: nam mkha' yid la byed pa nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
analyzed: nam mkha' yid la byed pa nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /
translated: Having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by means of attention to space,

original: phyis rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyis kyang /
analyzed: phyis rjes la thob pa'i ye shes kyis kyang /
translated: later, with the subsequently attained wisdom,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas na /
translated: having fully awakened to the four noble truths,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mngon sum du byas te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mngon sum du byas te /
translated: having actualized the qualities of a buddha,

original: kun rdzob yid la byed pas /
analyzed: kun rdzob yid la byed pas /
translated: with attention to the conventional,

original: sems can rnams phung po gsum du lung bstan par gyur te /
analyzed: sems can rnams phung po gsum du lung bstan par gyur te /
translated: he prophesied three groups of sentient beings.

original: de bas na mi dmigs pa nyid kyis spyod pa dang / mi dmigs pa nyid kyis byang chub par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de bas na mi dmigs pa nyid kyis spyod pa dang / mi dmigs pa nyid kyis byang chub par 'gyur bas /
translated: Therefore, since one practices by means of non-apprehension and awakens by means of non-apprehension,

original: nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: there is no fault. This is the meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa dang / sems can rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na de dag ji ltar bskyed /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa dang / sems can rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na de dag ji ltar bskyed /
translated: “Bhagavān, if the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One” and so on: if meditative stabilization, superknowledge, and sentient beings are not entities, how are they generated?

original: sems can rnams kyang ji ltar lung bstan zhes gnas brtan gyis zhus pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang ji ltar lung bstan zhes gnas brtan gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: And how are sentient beings predicted?

original: des na bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor gal te 'dod pa rnams dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor gal te 'dod pa rnams dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: Thus, the Blessed One, in the passage beginning “Subhūti, if the desire realm and the nonvirtuous dharmas,”

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir thams cad grub kyi /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir thams cad grub kyi /
translated: teaches that everything is established because of the nature of nonentityness.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bstan te /
translated: It is not otherwise.

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa rnams dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te de'i phyir lung bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa rnams dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin te de'i phyir lung bstan to //
translated: Thus, the desire realm and the nonvirtuous dharmas are the nature of nonentityness. Therefore, they are predicted.

original: bsam gtan rnams bskyed do //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams bskyed do //
translated: The concentrations are generated.

original: dngos po'am / dngos po med pa'am /
analyzed: dngos po'am / dngos po med pa'am /
translated: They are not entities or nonentities.

original: rang gi dngos po'am /
analyzed: rang gi dngos po'am /
translated: They are not one’s own entity or🔽another’s entity.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid kyis ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa'i dngos po'i bdag nyid kyis ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not due to the nature of an imputed entity.

original: ri bong gi rva bzhin du shin tu dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin la /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva bzhin du shin tu dngos po med pa'i bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin la /
translated: They are not utterly the nature of nonentity, like the horn of a donkey.

original: rang gi dngos po'i bdag nyid 'ga' zhig tu yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi dngos po'i bdag nyid 'ga' zhig tu yang ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not in any way its own entity.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po'i bdag nyid 'ga' zhig tu ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po'i bdag nyid 'ga' zhig tu ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is not in any way the entity of something else.

original: ji ltar mthar gyis spyod pa dang / mthar gyis slob pa dang / mthar gyis nan tan du bgyi ba mchis par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ji @263a * //
analyzed: ji ltar mthar gyis spyod pa dang / mthar gyis slob pa dang / mthar gyis nan tan du bgyi ba mchis par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ji @263a * //
translated: How is there gradual practice, gradual training, and gradual application?

original: ltar sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs par dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs pa dag 'phral kho na la 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ltar sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs par dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs pa dag 'phral kho na la 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the perception of an illusory elephant, etc. and the non-perception of it occur immediately,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang 'phral kho na la dmigs su med pa rtogs par 'gyur gyi rim gyis ni ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang 'phral kho na la dmigs su med pa rtogs par 'gyur gyi rim gyis ni ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o ;
translated: so the Bodhisattva immediately realizes the non-perception of all dharmas, not gradually.

original: / rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpas thog mar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: / rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpas thog mar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: Here, Subhuti, the Bodhisattva first of all honors the Buddhas, the Lords, and then hears this perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad bstan te /
translated: The Lord has taught this.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag gi don du mthar gyi spyod pa mi rtsom gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag gi don du mthar gyi spyod pa mi rtsom gyi /
translated: The bodhisattva does not undertake the practice for his own sake.

original: sems can thams cad kyi 'phral la shes par mi nus te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi 'phral la shes par mi nus te /
translated: He is not able to make all sentient beings understand immediately,

original: rim gyis shes par bya ba'i phyir rim gyis rtsom ste /
analyzed: rim gyis shes par bya ba'i phyir rim gyis rtsom ste /
translated: but in order to make them understand gradually, he undertakes gradually.

original: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: From the time of generating the first thought of enlightenment, etc.

original: de dag gi rim pa ston to //
analyzed: de dag gi rim pa ston to //
translated: teaches their sequence.

original: zhugs nas zhes bya ba ni sems skyed nas so //
analyzed: zhugs nas zhes bya ba ni sems skyed nas so //
translated: Having entered means having generated the thought.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi ngo bo nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos thams cad la yod pa'am med pa dmigs su yod snyam mam zhes bya ba ni gal te med par 'dzin par gyur na chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi ngo bo nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos thams cad la yod pa'am med pa dmigs su yod snyam mam zhes bya ba ni gal te med par 'dzin par gyur na chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase do you think that existence or non-existence is apprehended in all things which are the nature of the six perfections and the nature of non-existence? means that if one grasps as non-existent, one falls into nihilism.

original: dngos po med pa dang ngo bo nyid du smra ba rnams dngos po med par smra ba dang ngo bo nyid yod par smra bas /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang ngo bo nyid du smra ba rnams dngos po med par smra ba dang ngo bo nyid yod par smra bas /
translated: The proponents of non-existence and the proponents of inherent existence are proponents of non-existence and proponents of inherent existence, respectively.

original: yod po'am med pa nyid kyi mthar byar mi rung bas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yod po'am med pa nyid kyi mthar byar mi rung bas bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase it is not suitable to be made into the extreme of existence or non-existence teaches that.

original: rab 'byor mi dmigs pa nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor mi dmigs pa nyid thob pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, it is the attainment of nonapprehending.🔽It is the realization of nonapprehending.

original: mi dmigs pa nyid mngon par rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa thob pa dang / mi dmigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa zhes brjod na thob par bya ba dang / mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir mi dmigs pa yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid mngon par rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa thob pa dang / mi dmigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa zhes brjod na thob par bya ba dang / mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir mi dmigs pa yod par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is said that nonapprehending is the attainment and the realization of nonapprehending, then nonapprehending would exist in order to be attained and realized.

original: de lta na ni dmigs pa nyid thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces brjod par bstan to //
analyzed: de lta na ni dmigs pa nyid thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces brjod par bstan to //
translated: In that case, it would be taught that apprehending is the attainment, realization, and perfect complete enlightenment.🔽Where are the superknowledges that arise from evolution?

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa yang ga la mchis zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa yan chad la rnam par smin pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mngon par shes pa yang ga la mchis zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa yan chad la rnam par smin pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams nye bar gnas so //
translated: On the eighth ground and above, the superknowledges that arise from evolution and the perfections that arise from evolution are present.

original: mthar gyis grub pa bstan pa thams cad ni go sla'o //
analyzed: mthar gyis grub pa bstan pa thams cad ni go sla'o //
translated: All the teachings on gradual accomplishment are easy to understand.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji @263b ltar na sems gcig gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin par sbyin pa byin na zhes bya ba
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji @263b ltar na sems gcig gis pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba lags zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin par sbyin pa byin na zhes bya ba
translated: The question Blessed One, how does a single thought complete the six perfections? and so on, is answered by When one gives with the perfection of wisdom.

original: brjod pas / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyang gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pas / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyang gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught: Because it is embraced by the perfection of wisdom, all sentient beings become one.

original: gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gcig kho nar ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de nas zhus pa gnyis pa la yang /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gcig kho nar ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de nas zhus pa gnyis pa la yang /
translated: Not different means only one, that is the meaning.

original: sems gnyis su med pa'i phyir sems gcig go zhes ston to //
analyzed: sems gnyis su med pa'i phyir sems gcig go zhes ston to //
translated: Then, in the second question, it is taught: Because there is no duality of mind, there is a single mind.

original: gnyis kyi 'du shes med par pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa chos thams cad sgom pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyi 'du shes med par pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa chos thams cad sgom pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The meditation on all phenomena such as the six perfections without the perception of duality is easy to understand.

original: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems zag pa med pas sbyin pa byin na rnam par smin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa yan chad nyon mongs pa 'byung ba med pa dang / rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir de skad ces bstan to //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i sems zag pa med pas sbyin pa byin na rnam par smin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sa brgyad pa yan chad nyon mongs pa 'byung ba med pa dang / rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir de skad ces bstan to //
translated: If one gives a gift with a mind free from signs, the perfection of the result of evolution is fulfilled. This is taught because on the eighth stage and above, the afflictions do not occur and there is the result of evolution.

original: sbyin pa des ci zhig bya ba zhes bya ba ni bdud kyi ris rnams smra ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa des ci zhig bya ba zhes bya ba ni bdud kyi ris rnams smra ba'o //
translated: What will you do with that giving? This is Mara's faction speaking.

original: de'i 'og tu pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnam par smin pa'i mngon par shes pa dang bcas pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa ni gzhung nyid las gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnam par smin pa'i mngon par shes pa dang bcas pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa ni gzhung nyid las gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Then, the fulfillment of the six perfections together with the superknowledges that are the result of evolution should be understood from the text itself.
