original: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid shes pa bstan pas rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa yang go sla ba nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid shes pa bstan pas rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa yang go sla ba nyid do //
translated: The teaching of the knowledge of the characteristics of all things also teaches the perfection that results from evolution, which is easy to understand.

original: de'i 'og tu bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus pa dang / lan dang ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba bstan pa dang /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad rmi lam lta bu dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhus pa dang / lan dang ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba bstan pa dang /
translated: After that, the Blessed One was asked, In the case of all phenomena that are like a dream, which are empty of their own characteristics, having the nature of non-existence, and so forth, and the answer and the teaching of the marvelous and wondrous [qualities] were given.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa dag kyang gzhung nyid las gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa dag kyang gzhung nyid las gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The mundane and supramundane gifts of the Dharma should also be understood from the text itself.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa bstan pa'i lhag ma ni sngar bstan zin te /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa bstan pa'i lhag ma ni sngar bstan zin te /
translated: Here, the remainder of the teaching on the supramundane gift of the Dharma has been explained before.

original: sngar ma bstan pa dag bstan to //
analyzed: sngar ma bstan pa dag bstan to //
translated: What has not been explained before has been explained.

original: de la nyon mongs pa med pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni bdag gi phyir gzhan dag la nyon mongs pa skye bar ma gyur cig ces byin gyis brlabs nas ting nge 'dzin la @264a * //🔽snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa med pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni bdag gi phyir gzhan dag la nyon mongs pa skye bar ma gyur cig ces byin gyis brlabs nas ting nge 'dzin la @264a * //🔽snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: Here, what is non-affliction? Having blessed [the mind] with the thought, May affliction not arise in others for my sake, one enters into meditative equipoise.

original: sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis gzhan gyi rgyud la nyon mongs pa skye ba'i skabs mi 'byed pa de ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gyi stobs kyis gzhan gyi rgyud la nyon mongs pa skye ba'i skabs mi 'byed pa de ni nyon mongs pa med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The non-occurrence of the afflictions in the mental continuum of others by the power of one’s former prayers is called the meditative attainment of the absence of afflictions.

original: de la smon lam gyi shes pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni dus gsum dang khams gsum gyi chos rnams las shes par bya bar bsdus pa'i chos /🔽'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das par gtogs pa gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig shes par bya ba'i phyir smon lam btab pas na de de ma thag tu shes pa gang gi shes par gyur pa de smon lam sngon du 'gro ba'i shes pa yin pas smon
analyzed: de la smon lam gyi shes pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni dus gsum dang khams gsum gyi chos rnams las shes par bya bar bsdus pa'i chos / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das par gtogs pa gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig shes par bya ba'i phyir smon lam btab pas na de de ma thag tu shes pa gang gi shes par gyur pa de smon lam sngon du 'gro ba'i shes pa yin pas smon
translated: What is knowledge through prayer?🔽In order to know any phenomenon whatsoever, whether mundane or supramundane, that is included in the three times and the three realms, one formulates a prayer.

original: nas shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nas shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Immediately after that prayer, one knows. That knowledge is called knowledge through prayer.

original: de la yongs su dag pa bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la yongs su dag pa bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: What are the four purities?

original: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len thams cad gnas dang shin tu bral bar gyur pa dang / bdag gi lus kyang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin len pa dang / gnas pa dang 'chi 'pho ba rnams la rang dbang du gyur pa ni gnas yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len thams cad gnas dang shin tu bral bar gyur pa dang / bdag gi lus kyang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin len pa dang / gnas pa dang 'chi 'pho ba rnams la rang dbang du gyur pa ni gnas yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The complete absence of all the negative tendencies of the defilements in all sentient beings, and the mastery of taking up, maintaining and abandoning a body as one wishes, is the complete purity of the basis.

original: sprul pa dang / yongs su bsgyur ba'i grangs su gtogs pa dang / dmigs pa thams cad la dbang du gyur pa ni dmigs pa yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa dang / yongs su bsgyur ba'i grangs su gtogs pa dang / dmigs pa thams cad la dbang du gyur pa ni dmigs pa yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The mastery of emanation and transformation, and of all objective supports, is the complete purity of objective supports.

original: sems kyi gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral bas sems la rnam pa thams cad du dge ba 'phel ba ni sems yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral bas sems la rnam pa thams cad du dge ba 'phel ba ni sems yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The increase of all that is virtuous in the mind, because it is free from all negative tendencies of the mind, is the complete purity of mind.

original: ma rig pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral bas shes par bya ba thams cad la shes pa sgrib pa med pa dbang du gyur pa ni ye shes yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral bas shes par bya ba thams cad la shes pa sgrib pa med pa dbang du gyur pa ni ye shes yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The mastery of the knowledge of all that is to be known, without obscuration, because it is free from all the negative tendencies of the side of ignorance, is the complete purity of gnosis.

original: de la dbang bcu gang zhe na zhes bya ba la ji srid 'dod pa de srid du 'dug pa ni tshe la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: de la dbang bcu gang zhe na zhes bya ba la ji srid 'dod pa de srid du 'dug pa ni tshe la dbang ba'o //
translated: The mastery of life is the ability to remain alive for as long as one wishes.

original: bsam gtan dang tshad med pa dang / rnam par thar pa la sogs pa sems gnas pa gang gis gnas par 'dod pa des ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin gnas pa 'di ni sems la dbang ba'o //🔽kun du brtags pa tsam gyis de ma thag tu /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang tshad med pa dang / rnam par thar pa la sogs pa sems gnas pa gang gis gnas par 'dod pa des ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin gnas pa 'di ni sems la dbang ba'o // kun du brtags pa tsam gyis de ma thag tu /
translated: The mastery of mind is the ability to remain in any state of mental stability that one wishes, such as the meditative absorptions, the immeasurables, and the liberations.

original: de'i bza' ba la sogs pa yo byad thams cad ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin 'byor pa 'di ni yo byad la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bza' ba la sogs pa yo byad thams cad ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin 'byor pa 'di ni yo byad la dbang ba'o //
translated: The mastery of necessities is the ability to cause all necessities, such as food and clothing, to be present merely by thinking of them.

original: skye bar 'gyur ba'i las thams cad la ji ltar @264b 'dod pa bzhin du bsgyur ba 'di ni las la dbang ba'o //🔽skye ba'i gnas thams cad du /
analyzed: skye bar 'gyur ba'i las thams cad la ji ltar @264b 'dod pa bzhin du bsgyur ba 'di ni las la dbang ba'o // skye ba'i gnas thams cad du /
translated: The mastery of action is the ability to transform any action into whatever one wishes.🔽The mastery of birth is the ability to be born in any place of birth that one wishes.

original: gang du 'dod par ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du skye ba 'di ni skye ba la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: gang du 'dod par ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du skye ba 'di ni skye ba la dbang ba'o //
translated: The mastery of aspiration is the ability to cause all aspirations to be fulfilled.🔽The mastery of wisdom is the ability to know all objects of knowledge in a single instant.
